reviews.review_title: Will always love it for all the wrong reasons.
reviews.content:
As a horror film, it fails in almost every aspect. As an accidental comedy, it works like a charm.Troll 2 has some of the worst acting ever seen in a film, some of the worst effects, some of the worst dialogue, some of the worst music, some of the worst cinematography......but it's still one hell of a fun time for all its flaws.Here's just a few highlights:-The iconic "OH MY GOOOOOOODDD" scene.
-The corn on the cob seduction scene.
-The dinner table urination scene.
-The amount of times Grandpa Seth appears as a ghost just to say Joshua, at one point even mistaking Joshua's sister for Joshua himself somehow.Classic stuff.
Probably the greatest movie ever made. Up their with Citizen Kane and Gone With The Wind.

First of all let me say "House Swaping"? Sounds more like an ABC reality show then something that would happen in real life. I mean what kind of cheap Bastard would plan a vacation like that. What was he thinking "It's free". Who is he "Al Bundy"? Next problem, the movie is called TROLL 2, not GOBLINS 1. Where were the Troll? There is no Trolls in Troll 2. No connection to the first movie what so ever. Next major issue, if the "goblins" were vegetarians, then why turn people into vegetables when they can grow their own! It would make more sense if they were flesh eaters. Now finally, the last and biggest problem with "troll 2". The climax, the ending of the film leaves the impression that Josh destroys all the Goblins, then the other shoe drops. He walks into the kitchen and finds Goblins eating his mother after turning her into veggie matter. What the hell is up with that. THE NOOSE

Horror movies are a tough breed to make indeed.  Classics in the genre such as Evil Dead, Night of the Living Dead, Dracula, Scream, Nightmare on Elm Street while good in their own right, will have taken a serious step down in your mind after you've laid eyes on the greatest horror nay, any movie ever made.  Troll 2!!!  The movie begins when a typical house exchange program goes awry and the protagonist family ends up living in Nilbog, that's goblin spelled backward (pure genius), the capital of the goblins.  From here on in, zany antics ensue.  The family youngster, Joshua(played by electrifying Michael Stephenson), sets out on his own personal quest to save his family and rid the world of the goblins.  Kudos Michael.  After some close calls in which young Joshua has several brushes with death, he manages to contact his dead grandfather (who is not in hell by the way) and gets him to come back for a pivotal 10 minutes in which he punches out one particularly nasty goblin and equips Joshua with the most powerful weapon that Earth has against a force as devastating as the goblins.  A TRIPLE DECKER BOLOGNA SANDWHICH!!!!  Look out Hiroshima.  Then almost as suddenly as he arrived, Grandpa disappears for good ala Obi-Wan Kenobi in some lesser known movie. I cried at the ending of the movie, which I will not ruin for those of you out there that have not yet been fortunate enough to see this work of art. I think that since prequels are all the rage nowadays, we need a Troll prequel or two to get our juices flowin again.  Who wouldn't like to see Grandpa Seth as a rambunctious teen who has some run-ins with the goblins and yet somehow finds the will to defeat them.  I can only wish that this movie gets made.  Until then I will have to continue to watch Troll 2 on a daily basis.p.s. the musical score is completely terrifying in it's own right.  The artist's use of "spooky" chords and notes in several of the film's key chase scenes, and the infamous popcorn scene simply made the movie that much better

Well, it seems many of the comments on this site have pretty much summed it up: you will never ever ever see a movie like "Troll 2". It is destined to be the stuff of "Shock Video" type geekdom/worship/hatred in twenty years or so. Totally transcending any movie in ANY genre, it soars (or is that sinks?) in its heights of ineptness and twisted depravity. A direct-to-video family monster movie becomes, in this case, a hideous and surreal monster in its own right, shocking the viewer with its universally awful acting, ridiculous costumes, insane dialogue and hideously ugly kid actor star. Anyone who can make it through the whole 90 minutes of this will emerge a new person, and will probably ache for hours just from laughing so hard. Hard to believe director Joe D'Amato was the man responsible for the cult classic gore films Anthropophagus 1 and 2! I think the guy must've hit his pinnacle here, though, blessing us with this amazing turd. I'd recommend watching this once sober and then, if you're up for it, trying the following drinking game:TROLL 2 for Alcoholics:You'll need: a few cases of cheap beer (Beast or Genny'll do, quantity depends on how many friends you have over; figure MANY beers necessary per person) AND one bottle Mister Bostonplus, as many friends as you can muster up (must have sense of humor)the rules: 1.) Drink once every time a character seeps green goo 2.) Drink once every time someone sez: "Joshua" 3.) Drink twice every time dad sez something totally bizarre or mom gives mega creepy stare 4.) Drink twice every time Grampa Seth appears 5.) One shot every time a character is given disgusting random green food to eat (and doesn't find it strange!) 6.) One shot for every time eighties dance music is blaring 7.) Two shots for every time aforementioned music accompanied by actual dance 8.) First person to tally beard/mustache count in "General Store" scene can make someone else drink 9.) Drink three times for every close-up shot of Joshua's unspeakable face 10.) Slam beer for every line spoken by actual goblin 11.) Any person to spot one of the three f**k-ups in filming (besides movie itself) makes others drink (HINT: fly, dad's oops, hallway)12.) Drink twice for each time "smelly bladder" "nest of infections" or "stinky intestines" is mentioned 13.) Two shots for every time grampa and grandson engage in pyromania together 14.) Slam six-pack everytime you're genuinely gripped with fear.Hopefully this game will make the film that much more enjoyable, and your friends can drive home drunk and create some horror of their own. Come to think of it, no, I don't think it's possible to make this film better (worse) than it is, but you're welcome to try (and destroy your liver in the process). Cheers!

reviews.review_title: A Movie So Bad, Its good,dont take it seriously!
reviews.content:
The remember the first day I saw Troll 2.  I went to the market with my mate to buy a DVD and found it for £3.50(around$2).In so many words troll 2 is an excellent film.  Its funny and extremely amusing. The whole point of the film is if you take it seriously you wont enjoy it.  You ask me its a cult!I cant be bothered explaining the plot for their isnt much too it.  As a filmaking stand-point its pretty damb alful but thats its beauty.  That a film so bad can become so excellent by sheer badness.The acting from young Joshua is very good for an actor of that age but the parents have no excuse!
Anyway Im not the type for going on and on so just buy it for gods sake, get a beer and some mates found and laugh your ass off!FANTASTIC!

Usually, when we see a bad movie, it has at least one redeeming quality. Not with "Troll 2" however, a film that seems to have no shame with it's horrendously bad acting, plot, special effects and overall ambiance.I kept thinking the whole way through that it had to be a joke. Maybe it was. I did laugh a few times.Was this some kind of strange statement about vegetarians? Or meat? I didn't get it if so. We are treated to various bizarre sequences about meat and vegetables but it never really comes together at all.The costumes are atrocious, designed by Laura 'Emmannuelle' Gemser. Porn star? Maybe. Costume designer? God no. Watch for the goblins, clearly little people or kids with masks. It was like they got the props from Party City, it's that bad.The music, which has been a source of ridicule in reviews on here, was, at times terrible but it didn't stand out to me as overly bad. Perhaps it was overshadowed by worse elements.All in all, "Troll 2" will have you scratching your head in amazement and questioning the sanity of all involved in the project. Did they actually think they were making a horror movie here? 2 out of 10, kids.

Here is a important lesson on how not to become a Troll. You must pee on your food before you eat it. If you do this before every meal this will prevent you from becoming a Troll. This household remedy was brought to you by the terrible movie Troll 2.

Rating1/10This film deserves it's reputation. It is shockingly bad in all departments. Horrible acting and dirt cheap effects combine with a lacklustre plot to give us a contender for one of the worst movies of all time.

Oh man, it just doesn't get any worse than this. Well, I still do contend that "Manos: Hands of Fate" IS worse than Troll 2, however, Troll 2 is defintly still up there as some of the worst crap ever made.There are so many ways this movie is bad. Each actor is bad in their own unique way. Each plot point is stupid in its own unique way. And it never ends! It seems to go on forever. Anyone watching this movie should seriously consider playing video games during the course of this movie, its really the only way to get through it. I hated that kid, I can't believe it took him so long to realize nilbog was goblin spelt backwards (did I mention there are no trolls in this movie, only goblins) I hated the granpa too, but its the dad in the movie that really puts in the most ridicliously bad performance par excellance.

In-crappy-credible. That's the word that comes to mind. How do movies like this get made? Was there no sane person on the set (never mind, they didn't have a set) who had the guts to tell Claudio Fragasso "sorry mate, this just ain't gonna work, just give it up already before anyone gets hurt"? Wow. That's all I can say. I truly cannot summarize how awful this movie is in words. But I'll try, anyway. I have to get this film out of my system before I go insane.Take some rednecks and ex-porn stars, throw them into some anonymous town in the middle of nowhere, slap a huge "NILBOG" sign on a pole, hire lots of dwarfs and some sh!tty costumes, and get the most over-the-top, annoying, washed-up Z-movie actress you can find to play the main antagonist, add a delusional kid who is almost as convincing as the thespian from "Pod People", and at least twice as irritating, and you have a movie. That's the Claudio Fragasso way! So we have a kid actor with whom we're supposed to sympathize, but he's so bad I just wanted to hit him most of the time and tell him not to be such an overreacting little prick. Seriously, Joshua looks like someone is repeatedly kicking him in the groin whenever he tries to emote.Unbelievably, Joshua isn't the worst actor in the film - even though everyone in this movie either screams or mumbles his or her casual lines , and even though Joshua's mum looks like a crack addict psychopath during most of her scenes, the real Dung Beetle award for incompetent acting has to go to Deborah Reed. She plays Creedence Leonore Gielgud in a way that makes it hard not to think that the nice men in white coats were waiting for Deborah after major shooting of the film had finished. This woman has the scariest eyes I've ever seen, they're constantly moving up and down, bulging in and out of their sockets so fast even Rodney Dangerfield would be scared. Her eyes are enough to almost distract you from her horrendous overacting, but only almost. Hearing her deliver her "little flower" speech makes you pine for the subtlety and depth of Vin Diesel. But enough about her.Can it get any worse? Actually it can, because suddenly a myriad of the aforementioned dwarfs - sorry, I meant goblins - appear. Think of an army of walking, oinking potatoes with bargain bin Halloween masks - those are the goblins. Sound scary yet? I thought so.Kill me now. I thought the film couldn't get any dumber, but it did - suddenly Joshua realizes that "NILBOG" is actually "GOBLIN" spelled BACKWARDS!!! Yes, I'm stunned too. This truly is the most brilliant plot twist this side of M. Night Shyallaman. And so cleverly set up, too! I can assure you I did NOT see this coming, no siree. Gee whizz, what a shocker! All sarcasm aside, this is probably the part of the film where I completely lost it. The sheer look of shock on Joshua's face upon his revelation combined with the "scary" music (which was probably stolen from some Japanese TV show from the eighties, by the way) - this is unintentional comedy at its finest. And by "finest", I mean "most painful".So, when all is said and done, what can we make of this movie? It's low budget, so badly acted you'll want to gouge your eyes out, unintentionally hilarious, blatantly homoerotic (Elliott having trouble choosing between his "boys" and his girlfriend, Elliott's "boys" sleeping half-naked next to each other) and it gave me the impression that Claudio Fragasso has a fetish for the colour green. In conclusion this film has very deservedly earned itself a position on the Bottom 100, and I'm still blown away by the fact that there are movies this irredeemably awful out there. My review has barely scratched on the surface of how awful this film is - it's worse than "Red Zone Cuba", worse than "The Beast of Yucca Flats", worse than "Time of the Apes"... and I wouldn't hesitate to say that it's *this* close to being as bad as "Manos: The Hands of Fate" (interestingly enough, both films feature a hilarious scene in which the main characters inexplicably burst out in a chorus of "Row your boat"). My Bottom 100 marathon couldn't have ended on a higher note of badness and I'm happy to say that I survived this ordeal (Watching "Bloodrayne", "Captain America" and this in a row) without any extensive brain damage... or did I? Anyway, to any devoted fan of bad movies, this is truly appetizing... and provocative. To quote Arnold, one of Elliot's "boys": "OH MY GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD!"

reviews.review_title: A Notorious Title! Few are worse then Troll 2.
reviews.content: How bad can movies get? Well this low-budget fantasy/horror film from 1990 is always right up there with the very worst of em'. The inconsistencies are numerous, the acting is terrible throughout and ultimately the film feels very scatterbrained. It's my viewing experience that Italian's are guilty of churning out some of the worst movies ever and what do you know, Troll 2 just happened to be directed by one, Claudio Fragasso is his real name, though he's credited as "Drake Floyd" in the movie. I've read that this talentless and delusional imbecile actually thinks that THIS MOVIE, TROLL 2! is a "masterpiece". It boggles the mind. It is a scatter-brained mess of a movie, but not completely incoherent, it's plot (is that really the word to use) goes as such and it is a challenge to thread this mess together. Here goes.The "Wait" family are going on a vacation and their destination is a quaint little hamlet out in the country-side by the name of Nilbog (and as the movie will proclaim, Nilbog IS goblin spelled backwards) with a population of 26 people. It's all very scenic, with meadows and prairies's and such, however the town folk are all rather odd in the eye's of the Wait's (their not a likable bunch either). You see their swapping homes with another family (for a month I believe) who happen to live in Nilbog, I've never heard of this before, but that's what their doing here.There's this ugly little kid named Joshua who keeps seeing apparitions of his dead grandpa, who keeps telling Joshie-boy of bad things to come, specifically "goblin's" (and you were expecting trolls, weren't you), this fictitious rubbish is all started by the cardigan-clad ghost of grampa Seth, reading him stories from a book of tall tales, while sitting in a rocking-chair. Josh is unbalanced from the loss of his grandpa, so a vacation is what they all need. Back to Nilbog, the town folk are all vegans and scorn those who aren't (Josh's defense from them later in the movie is a "double-decker bologna sandwich".....) there's a fanatic preacher in the town, who along with the sheriff are their leader's. One afternoon Josh hears voices and wanders into a barn and see's the preacher yapping to a crowd about the sin's of eating meat, Josh is quickly discovered, he's briefly groped by a few people, then pop's walks in and saves him "we were just giving him some ice cream" is the preachers line.Later that day the town folk all unexpectedly gather at the home of the Wait's family "to make up for the misunderstanding we had earlier today" they bring all kinds of eat's, but nothing with meat in it, they play some terrible sounding folksy piano music, do their own brand of dancing..... and well it's a party, of sorts. Then Josh is lured outside by the ghost of grampa Seth once again, the preacher literally goes up in flames for some reason, the flames are quickly put out, what was once a man is now the charred remains of a goblin (still no trolls). As is the logic in this movie, the sheriff say's "you killed him", to Mr. Wait's even though he was the one who extinguished the fire; the collective mood of the town folk turns grim once again, they intend to kill the family somehow (all while remaining motionless), so a stand-off begins as the family runs back into the house. At one point the sheriff throws them a bag of poisoned sammiches, their logic, eat these it'll make it easier for you and you won't have to die violently. Oh god this is painful, cutting to the chase, the Wait's family survives their ordeal, partly because a little boy brandishes a double-decker bologna sammich.In this movie there's really two stories going on, the Wait's teenage daughter is followed to Nilbog by her effeminate boyfriend Elliot, in an RV who also brings along some friends. They park on the outskirts of Nilbog and soon one by one they die/or are romanced by this "witch" who is CONSTANTLY over-acting and is quite irritating. She has many magic potions that transform people into, plants, green gelatinous goo, or sometimes it just makes people lethargic and sweaty, it varies for each victim - again the logic of this movie....well there just isn't much of it. I guess you could say she's the goblin queen (still no trolls).Returning home the Wait's are safe at last, pops goes to the office, sis goes somewhere, leaving Josh and mom at home. However some noises soon catch Josh's attention, wandering downstairs, there's mom or what's left of her, surrounded by "trolls" who are eating her remains, or more rather just smearing green crap on the muzzles of their cheap masks.The so-called troll's in this miserable movie are nothing more than midgets wearing cheap masks (without a hint of pliability) and brown robes, with rope belts and their armed with crude looking spears and for the most part are ineffective at killing anyone. Their, literally, just tossed around a bit.For me it's a real chore to watch Troll 2 from beginning to end, I find that the film runs out of steam an hour in, the last 30 minutes are truly painful boring to watch.Ultimately Troll 2 is -easily- one of the worst movies of the 90's or from any time period.Coincidently, not a single cast member has/had much of an acting career. Not-a-one, hmmmmm.........

reviews.review_title: The Most Entertaining Film Ever Made
reviews.content: They can...THEY CAN! Easily the most entertaining (and rewatchable) film ever made, if not quite the best. It's got more quotable lines than any other film I've ever seen, Duck Soup included. An acquired taste, how much you like it will depend on how familiar you are with the stereotypical movies it resembles...barely resembles. Those who haven't seen too many horror movies usually just think it's badly made, with bad acting, bad effects, etc., and completely miss the surrealist heights it hits. Imagine taking your run-of-the-mill late nite cheapo horror flick and stripping it of any logic or pretense of plausibility, cast a bunch of the MOST unprofessional actors you can find, and rewrite the dialogue at the end of a bad acid trip. No wannabe cult hit, it was apparently made with the best intentions, and we all know what the devil does with those! The director's called it "an unpretentious childrens' story," overlooking the obscenely cruel ending, which jars the relatively light-hearted mood of the first 92 minutes of the film. Not to be missed.

Well, I happened to come across Troll 2 while at the local supermarket, as I was picking up some marshmallows, corn, and bread for dinner. I turned to look out of the corner of my eye, in the $1 bin lay this wonderful little beauty, one of the greatest horror/suspense/thrillers that one can ever hope to buy.Who would have thought that Claudio Fragasso's dream of cinema gold would be accomplished with Troll 2? The film is just an absolute wet dream for film lovers and critics all around, and it's no surprise with all the things it has to offer, but not limited to: quirky and clever lines, awesome special effects, a star-filled cast and crew, state of the art equipment and cinematography, and the perfect plot, what more could anyone ask for? The cast and their execution of the lines is absolutely curtains. Michael Stephenson as the lovable Joshua Waits gives one of his best performances, especially with the scene peeing on the food, that is just what this film needed!! George Hardy also gives one of his best performances, and I tell you, "You can't p*ss on hospitality, I won't allow it!" My family is always in silence from his performance, it's almost like he God commanding us from heaven. Finally the great Robert Ormsby, who plays Grandpa Seth. He steals the screen as the dead grandfather, whom Joshua talks to. His performance needs to be reviewed by screenplay writers and actors from all over, this is textbook acting. I would love to list the rest of this brilliant cast, but there are too many great things about their performance that would take too many pages.This film is probably one of the most perfect films I have had the pleasure to watch. It ranks better among many other classics of horror, such as Halloween, Nightmare on Elm Street, and even Saw. This film has everything in those films, and more! If you have not seen Troll 2 yet, forget all other movies, this is the must-see film of 2009!!!

reviews.content: Imagine you are watching paint dry, but each molecule of paint is a train de-railing and the wall is also stabbing you. Troll 2 is really bad, really really really bad. This is not a movie. A movie implies, a good script, masterful directing, a well rounded cast, and a coherent and believable story-line. The cast are cheap cardboard, pilfered from the streets of ineptitude. Troll 2, might be one for the masses of movie goers who enjoy the likes of Epic Movie. But a movie named troll, that actually depicts Goblins, who are possibly the worst villains in existence, On youtube, we see a video of the main delivering some of the worst lines in film historyFilmed in the late 80s, when horrors were at their peak, Troll 2 reminds aspiring directors, what not to film.

Enough said.
But seriously this movie lacks all subtext in its writing, and can only be truly enjoyed in an ironic/comedic sense.

reviews.review_title: I Wish These "Trolls" Were A Myth...
reviews.content: Awkward and clumsy film about an American family who uproot from their "city" life in order to live in the country. As to exactly why they do this is never really made that clear, (I doubt anyone cares anyway). Anywhow, after some painful drawn-out scenes, including a disturbing dialog exchange between Mom and Dad, the family eventually set off for their new home - a town called "Nilbog".Like a teen-novel, we see things from the youngest kid's unheard and somewhat ignored point-of-view. His performance is as good as it was ever going to be, but nevertheless it is very trying and more than occasionally annoying. Being the only member of the family with the ability to see his grandfather's ghost, he is viewed as unbelievable and hysterical by his naive and idiotic family.The film forces us to wade through the messy plot and inexcusable deus ex machinas as they are lumped on to one another. By the end, the whole plot has become unglued, the characters unwelcome, and worst of all the good and evil voices of the film are watered-down - nothing is suspenseful, frightening or even remotely original, (again like a poor teen-novel).The worst crime this film commits is that it undermines it's own invention. The trolls of the title, I suppose, are the goblins in the film. They are never dangerous or threatening. In fact, their powers seem to weaken throughout the film (I suppose this was one lazy and easy way of giving the "good-guys" their strength). For example, towards the end of the film, there is a siege-type situation in the family are trapped in their own house, surrounded by the goblin/townspeople. Exactly why the townspeople (who vastly outnumber the family) don't just enter the house and kill them all is illogical, incredible and frustrating.Regular viewers should ignore this film, while C or D grade enthusiasts will only give mixed responses at best.

reviews.review_title: One of the scariest movies I have ever seen (as in BAD)
reviews.content: This film was to me a comedy as it has the worst productions values I have ever seen. I think it might have been shot and produced by an elementary student class.I think when they had production meetings they must have been discussing how could they possibly make this the worst movie ever to have money spent on it. The acting is a joke. I did watch the entire movie just so that I could see how completely unbelievable they could make it. This film is however somewhat famous just because they have a following of people who like to poke fun at the most ridiculous film ever made.

Terence Malick. Stanley Kubrick. Stephen Speilberg.  Great directors all, and yet none have come close to the genius that is Troll 2. The man by the name of Joe D'Amato, of Anal Perversions of Lolita fame, created this masterpiece that deserves a place alongside the great films of our time.The story involves a house exchange program in which a family from the country switches places with a family from the city. Although this occurs often without incident it seems this time something went wrong. It's a good thing that dead Grandpa Seth is around to help out when the sh*t hits the fan with that sage advice for which he's known. Joshua, our hero, tries to warn his family of the threat of attack by the goblins of Nilbog but the family pays no mind. When good old dead Grandpa Seth gives 9 year old Joshua a molotov cocktail to play around with the truth about the goblins becomes apparent. Needless to say that this film achieves a level of genius so far unmatched in the film industry. Joe D'Amato was working on a level in which few of us could hope to understand. But for those of us who believe in the true beauty of film, Troll 2 holds a special place in our heart. And as Grandpa Seth said, "No I'm not in hell but I knew someone who was there once." Genius!

This movie sucks so much. This movie is horrible in every way you can imagine. Do not rent it, don't even read the back of the box your wasting your time. Plot - Makes no sense. reviews.review_title: Deborah Reed Is Unforgettable in Stunning Performance
reviews.content: Ten stars for Ms. Deborah Reed, who give the performance of a lifetime in this odd little horror film. Her work in this movie incorporates a subtle blend of horror, humor, pathos, and a burning sensuality. Some of her scenes are unforgettable but the popcorn scene certainly stands out as a profound expression of her talent and beauty. She brings depth and meaning to her character and sets the screen on fire whenever she appears. While Troll 2 is an unusually bad film, there is a very important reason that this is a motion picture not to be missed. That reason is Ms. Deborah Reed.

"TROLL 2" (1990, Fragasso) amounts to nothing at all. I hate this film for two reasons: 1) I saw it, 2) it was 'on trend' to wax about it when I was at college (which just bewildered me).So many people have nothing further to say than some films "are so bad they're good". I hate that phrase and it's often used to describe this film. Sorry, it's rubbish, there's nothing good about it.

I'm just airing an opinion here.)

reviews.review_title: Here's a zero star movie if ever there was one
reviews.content: I usually enjoy these "so bad they're good" movies, but this one just takes the concept WAY too far. We start with a suburban family that's "trading houses" with some country folks. Apparently this is their idea of a vacation. Could you imagine that, having some total strangers living in your house, going through your stuff, doing god-knows-what in your bathroom? Anyhow, they get to the town of "Nilbog" and...well, I would say strange things happen, but nothing quite so strange as how bizarrely untalented these people are in the acting department. I mean, this is truly elementary-school stuff here. In fact, none of these people could get a lead role in an elementary school play. At one point the daughter is having a private conversation with her boyfriend, but she speaks all her lines as if trying to make sure that the people in the 10th row can hear everything she says. The father is just, well, out there. A person doing an intentional parody of bad acting couldn't hold a candle to this guy.Anyhow, they find goblins in this town, they turn people into some sort of salad, and then eat them. The daughter's boyfriend and his two bumbling semi-gay buddies come along (easy to see why she doesn't want him hanging around with them) to provide yet more comic relief. Eventually they manage to defeat the goblins (never mind that the name of the movie is Troll), by holding them at bay with a double-bologna sandwich.Back to the acting. This thing makes the cast of Slumber Party Massacre look like they deserve Emmy awards in comparison. It's just incomprehensible how bad these people are. The writing is beyond retarded. I mean, why not have these people driving through Nilbog when the car breaks down, instead of having them "trading houses"? Because that wouldn't have been retarded enough. I should mention that Mom asks the kids to sing her favorite song while they're driving to Nilbog, which is "Row Row Row Your Boat". And yes, they do the thing where everyone sings the verses starting at a slightly different time. Why do they do that? Is there any other song where people sing the verse, then two seconds later someone else starts singing, then two seconds later someone else does it? I mean, that is just SO annoying.The only good thing about this whole movie is that there's a short scene of the daughter working out in her sexy leotard. This is way at the beginning of the movie, so just turn it off once you get to that point.

This is it ladies and gentlemen. It doesn't get any worse than this. I saw this movie a second time a while ago with my son and I warned him about what he was about too see. He thought that I was exaggerates when I told him about the movie and my first painful experience but when the movie was over he was in absolutely shock. I had warned him, and he have seen a lot of bad movies in his days, so he is not new into bad movies but he was in trauma after this one.This movie, if one should calls this one a movie at all, is hard to describe. One can use the usual word like awful, terrible, crime against humanity and stuff like that but words in any languages never really can describe the nature of this work. Yes, its awful, yes the actors are terrible, yes, the script is insane, but so are many other really bad movies out there. This one takes bad movies to a new level.This movie makes me feel physically sick, like having an high fever or something worse. It is an insult to my eyes and my senses. It is the same feeling that I had when I was bullied in school by an idiot. The same feeling you have when your boss tells you you are fired. The same feeling you have when you came home and your house has burned down.So this is it. It doesn't get any worse, not now, not in the past, not in the future. This is truly unique film experience, it will change you view on films for ever.

reviews.review_title: A must-watch for comedy and "bad movie" fans
reviews.content: TV is entertainment. That's the purpose. The reason I gave Troll 2 five stars out of 10 is because it really is entertaining. It's unintentionally hilarious. It's very poorly done but it's almost worth watching just to get a good laugh out of it. I would recommend this as a must-see for those who love movies that are so bad they're good. Production wise, nothing is done right. The music is completely unfitting, the camera angles are weird, the writing could have been done by an elementary school child, and the acting, wow, don't get me started. But all this somehow comes together to make a brilliant comedy. I recommend it to anyone who is willing see this movie as it is: a movie so bad, it's hilarious. It is definitely worth watching.

My favorite bad movie. So bad, it's actually good. I show this movie to anyone I intend to keep in my life for a very long time. A sort of "hazing" if thou wilt. I remember the first time I stumbled upon this atrocity. I was flipping channels around 2am in 2010. This film was playing on the "Decades" channel. A low budget, indie channel in Los Angeles. I ended up watching it all the way through. I brought it up to one of my co workers a few weeks later who had admitted he had seen the movie as well. He then began to re-enact the scene where Holly dances in front of the mirror and sees a holy vision of dead "Grandpa". It's singed in my memory forever and still makes me laugh. I love this movie.

The original Troll was a rubbish film, but nothing can prepare you for the true awfulness that is the "sequel", which has gained a reputation as one of the worst movies ever made, and rightly so. In fact, it is not a sequel at all, it was originally meant to be called Goblins, but it was marketed that way. Basically, Michael Waits (George Hardy) and his family travel to the rural farming community of Nilbog ("goblin" spelled backwards) for a month-long home exchange vacation. Michael's son Joshua (Michael Paul Stephenson) is haunted by the ghost of his dead grandfather, Seth (Robert Ormsby), who warns him that there are goblins who want to mutate the family into vegetables and plants so that they can eat them. Meanwhile, Joshua's sister Holly (Connie Young) is visited by her boyfriend Elliot Cooper (Jason Wright). Holly accuses Elliot of being homosexual since he spends more time with his friends, but he promises to show his devotion by accompanying the family on vacation. Elliot fails to arrive on time, but the family catch up with him and his friends Arnold (Darren Ewing), Drew (Jason Steadman) and Brent (David McConnell) in an RV. Outside of Nilbog, Seth appears as a hitchhiker, who warns Joshua that Nilbog is the kingdom of the goblins, and that if his family eats anything while they are there, they will be mutated into plants. The family disbelieves Joshua's warnings and continue their journey. They arrive in Nilbog and meet their strange exchange family, the Presents. Joshua sets about destroying all of the food the family finds or acquires. Seth suggests causing a scene to stop them eating a feast prepared for them, so he urinates over it at the dinner table. Meanwhile, Arnold goes for a walk in the woods outside the town and encounters a girl (Michele Abrams) being chased by goblins. Arnold approaches them and insults them; they respond by throwing a spear into his chest. Arnold and the girl enter a chapel, where they encounter the goblins' queen, Druid Witch Creedence Leonore Gielgud (Deborah Reed), who uses the "Stonehenge Magic Stone" to give the goblins power. Creedence tricks them into drinking a magic potion that dissolves the girl into vegetable matter, Arnold witness the horrifying scene of the goblins devouring her, before screaming helplessly as he is mutated into a tree. The following morning, Michael and Joshua venture into town for food, but find the general store closed. Michael falls asleep on a bench, while Joshua enters the local church and eavesdrops on a goblin church sermon, all about the "evils" of eating meat. Joshua is eventually found; the parishioners capture him and attempt to force feed him poisonous ice cream, until Michael finds him, suspicious of the townspeople he takes him home. Meanwhile, Drew goes to get some food, Sheriff Gene Freak (Gary Carlston) picks him up and gives him a green hamburger, and at the local store, the owner (Don Packard) gives him poisonous milk. Feeling dizzy, he goes to the chapel and finds Arnold, who has mutated into a tree. Drew tries to drag him, but Creedence appears and knocks him out; she chainsaws Arnold into pieces and Drew is killed off-screen. Returning home, the Waits family find the townspeople have prepared them a surprise party to apologise for the events at the church. Joshua attempts to make contact with Seth, only for Creedence to appear in goblin form through the mirror. Seth's ghost appears to stop her attacking Joshua and chops her hand off with an axe. Creedence returns to her chapel, where she mutates herself into a beautiful woman in revealing clothes. She finds the RV, seduces Brent and drowns him in popcorn. Seth and Joshua try to cause a distraction, but the Priest captures them and recites a spell which banishes Seth's soul to Hell. However, before he vanishes, Seth summons a bolt of lightning from the sky, which causes the Priest to burst into flames in a fiery explosion, killing him. When Michael extinguishes his burning corpse, his true goblin form is revealed, and the villagers turn on the Waits, revealing themselves all as goblins. The Waits and Elliot then retreat to the house, where the villagers surround them and hold them hostage. Joshua, Elliot, Holly, Michael and Diana (Margo Prey) hold a séance to bring Seth back from the dead, after returning he only has mintes to retain his physical form before he has to return to the afterlife. Seth gives Joshua a paper bag containing a "secret weapon" to use against the goblins. The creatures break into the house and transport Joshua to Creedence's chapel, where Joshua opens the bag, revealing a meat sandwich. He eats the sandwich, making his body poisonous to the goblins; he then touches the Stonehenge Stone, which destroys Creedence and all the goblins. The family returns home, and everything seems fine. But the family were unaware that the goblins had poisoned their food in the house exchange. Joshua walks in on a group of goblins eating his mother's transformed corpse on the kitchen counter. They offer him a bite, and Joshua screams in horror. Also starring Mike Hamill as Bells, Christina Reynolds as Cindy, Glenn Gerner as Peter, Lance C. Williams as Mr. Presents, Elli Case as Mrs. Presents, Gavin Reed as Presents Son, and Melissa Bridge as Presents Daughter. The producers decided to market this film as a sequel to Troll, as they worried it wouldn't succeed, of course, it doesn't make any difference, it just makes it all the more stupid. It is not actually a sequel, it has no relation to the original whatsoever, and has no trolls at all. The plot is absurd, the acting is terrible, especially the over-the-top strange looking Reed as the female villain, the puppetry and makeup effects are wasted and cheap looking, and the script is full of laughable dialogue ("They're eating her, and then they're going to eat me! Oh my gooooood!"). It may have a cult audience that embrace it being so bad it's good, for me, it was just an abysmal film that is a complete waste of time, a horrendous fantasy horror. Poor!

reviews.review_title: This was a good old fashion horror movie.
reviews.content:
I know I'll get lots of hateful replies after I say this, but I don't care. It´s a great film. An original setting. Nice acting, great characters, enjoyable plot...so why was this not too good of a film? I have to say this was a good old fashioned horror movie because of the gruesome death scenes. I haven't seen a movie like that since i saw Friday the Thirteenth.THE END!!!! I want to SMACK the producer or whatever genius thought it would be good to leave the last ten seconds in. Couldn't they hire an editor? The end was just SO laughable. It really is a shame because by . 99.5 minutes of this film really sparked my interest. Problem? This film is 90 minutes. I'm sorry, the ending was SO pitiful. I won't tell you what, but if they would have edited that part out, this would have been a terrific movie. Don't even see out of curiosity what I'm talking about, you'll either cry or die of laughter.Whatever the case, I sure hope the producers didn't take the end seriously.But credit where credit is do. It was a great film until the end.6 out of 10
