Must admit this film ive watched multiple times. The first time i watched this. It was like WTF. Especially being a very young fan of the first movie Troll. So i was expecting much of the same from the first. So i think i was more dissapointed that it was not.
However it continues to grow on me everytime i watch it.

reviews.review_title: May God have mercy on your soul
reviews.content: And i thought no movie could be worse than Hobgoblins. Well let me tell you, Hobgoblins is to Troll 2 what Gone with the Wind is to Heaven's Gate.Let me sum it up : Troll 2 has no trolls, it has Goblins. There are no actors, only people trying to act. And their attempts are beyond the pathetic. The kid on the box isn't even the same actor as in the movie !!However, there are some scenes that are soooo bad, they actually make you laugh. One of these is Joshua, a 9 year old boy, the "hero" of the movie, who takes a leak on diner in order to avoid the family eating the Goblin prepared food, that would turn them all into green jelly (does this make any sense ??). Anyways, thats not the funny part cause u dont see him actually doing it....The funny scene is when his dad punishes him : get this, he actually tells him "I'm tightening my belt by one loop so i don't feel hunger pains, and your sister and mother will have to do the same". Is this a script or what ???? How dumb does one have to be in order to write such KRAP ??I actually bought this movie in order to show it to all my m8. The first showing is to my brother this evening. I can't wait to see his reaction :)

reviews.review_title: Hilariously terrible trash; the Holy Grail of bad movies!
reviews.content: That this is without a doubt one of the worst films ever made is without question. However, TROLL 2 is also one of the funniest grade Z stink-fests ever made! The acting is one step BELOW your average high school play, the costumes, effects and script are laughable, and you can actually FEEL your IQ points slipping away with each passing second this brain-damaged atrocity grinds away in your VCR. I can't believe Columbia/TriStar paid money for this badly dubbed Italian atrocity, let alone dared to release it! It is interesting to note that the TROLLS in this film are identical to the TROLL weaponsmith in QUEST FOR THE MIGHTY SWORD, another Italian quickie that is also a parody/sequel to Joe D'Amato's mind-numbing ATOR series. At any rate, TROLL 2 is the Holy Grail of bad movies. Bravo!

you have to rent this movie, trust me folks...the worst effects, the worst lines "a triple decker bologna sandwich!" and down right horrible acting...but that's what's good about it! i couldnt stop laughing for days. wonderfully bad taste.  get some friends and stay up late and get ready for the worst piece of film you'll see in years troll 2 is hysterical.

This agreeably idiotic movie, which really doesn't have anything to do with John Carl Buechler's "Troll", still has enough W.T.F. moments, lousy acting, insane writing, and memorable lines ("You can't pi** on hospitality! I won't allow it!") to make it fun viewing for folks who appreciate crummy B cinema. However, this viewer has to admit that for him the film failed to quite live up to the reputation it's developed; he really didn't laugh *that* much. The story concerns a family that for whatever ridiculous reason swaps residences with a farming family in a not-that-far-away small town named Nilbog. (It's not a real brain twister to figure out the meaning of that name, but that is part of the clunky charm of this thing.) The young son, Joshua (Michael Stephenson) is seeing the spirit of his deceased grandpa Seth (Robert Ormsby), which will turn out to be important in his family's later fight against the multitude of goblins (yeah, this movie is about goblins rather than trolls) inhabiting this fair town. There is a certain enjoyment in seeing amateur actors not only stumble their way through the story, but in actually taking themselves seriously, which in itself is an impressive enough achievement. The tacky special effects are endearing, as are some of the characters. The highlight scene is one with which many of us are now familiar: the not-to-be-forgotten "Then they're gonna eat me!" scene. Of course, who could expect any film of this ilk to be actually seeming to promote a message about the wonders of going vegan? Yeah, that's in here, too! And, as has been mentioned, "Troll 2" does espouse the belief that hospitality is not to be taken for granted. When watching this, one has to wonder if it was EVER meant to be taken seriously. It gets goofy almost right away and keeps being silly right up until its ending. It's exactly the kind of thing you watch with friends and beers.But not coffee. That's the devils' drink.Mind-boggling bit of trivia: exploitation goddess Laura Gemser is credited with doing the costumes!5/10

Suburban family take a vacation to rural Nilborg, running afoul of goblins masquerading as human locals, their leader a "Goblin Queen" who draws her power from a Stonehenge equipped with magic. The family's son, Joshua, will have to summon the spirit of recently departed grandfather, Seth, in order to combat the supernatural powers of the Goblins.With an American cast, it's certainly augmented by an Italian style, particularly the zoom-friendly camera-work and lighting, not to mention the laughable goblin face designs and emphasis on icky gore/make-up effects. An entire Italian film crew and an American cast, can you just imagine the disconnect and the culture clashes that must have occurred? Grasping at straws, I just took the plot as the mad nightmarish fantasies of a child who has lost his grandfather, concocting this fairy-tale(..with the grimmest of Grimm overtones)where he and Seth could save the day, rescuing their family from the vegetarian Nilborg goblins.It's reputation certainly caught my attention and Troll 2 is so positively bonkers I couldn't turn away. It's so indescribably bizarre, Troll 2 held my interest, despite the fact that I was well aware of how dastardly awful it remains from start to finish. I simply couldn't stop watching it, scene after incomprehensibly strange scene would unfold and I would just stare at the screen dumb-struck. Green slime would fall down the faces of those humans who had the misfortune of drinking poisoned broth, tainted by the bad potion of the ghastly Goblin Queen. One poor soul is paralyzed, slowly turning into a tree. Another is overtaken by popcorn! I kid you not! You see one poor girl deteriorate into a mass of green goo! Once the human form turns into a green gelatinous blob, the goblins have a great feast! Michael Stephensen, as the kid hero, along with the rest of the cast, will cause plenty of belly laughs with their performances. Deborah Reed, as Creedence Leonore Gielgud, the Goblin Queen, is really made up into a grotesque witch, and she contorts her face into as hideous a visage as possible..and there's no restraint in her over-the-top performance, as she takes it over the cliff, into a thickety ravine, with plenty of broken bones and brain damage. Reed's performance reflects the nature of the film, she matches the heightened hysterics of a maddening story. Everything about the movie is off-the-deep-end, and Fragasso's Troll 2 has built a loyal following because of it's lunacy. I mean the way Papaw Seth and Stephenson's Joshua join forces, a ghost and his young grandson needing all the help he can get to save the family from a community of goblins in human clothing, it all lends itself to parody and mockery.Troll 2 must be seen. It's an example of the purest form of weird cinema. It should've been titled Goblins, though. I wondered just how the cast members must've felt while watching it once the film was completed, seeing their reaction as it played out on the screen.

TROLL 2 concerns the Waits family, especially young Josh (Michael Stephenson), who is obsessed with his dead grandpa, Seth (Robert Ormsby). Packing up and heading out for a "month in the country" to "live like farmers", the Waits' travel to the town of Nilbog (get it?). Unbeknownst to them, hell awaits!Sort of.This movie is the true north of magnificent ultra-schlock! From the universe's worst rendition of "Row, Row, Row Your Boat", to the idiot Waits clan, to the brain-drubbing plot, T2 delivers like no other!WATCH FOR: #1- Grandpa Seth and his big, floating head! #2- Holly Waits' feeble-minded boyfriend, Elliot and his equally challenged friends, who are quite possibly the most annoying group ever filmed. No, really, these guys will make you homicidal!THIS MOVIE INCLUDES: #1- A total lack of direction! #2- Incomprehensible dialogue and "story line"! #3- Random occurrences that lead nowhere! #4- Preposterous "monsters"... er, "goblins"! #5- The crackpot embodiment of demented cheeeze, that is Creedence Leonore Giulgud (Deborah Reed), and her baked goods! Her tickling chainsaw! Her corncob! #6- Mom's haystack hair that changes with each scene!PLUS: A completely unnecessary, ungodly overuse of green slime! An eeevil, hillbilly preacher! Spontaneous, vegetarian dancing!Don't forget Sheriff Freak (Gary Carlson)! The windy seance! Oh, the list goes on and on! No one in this film has an iota of charisma or appeal! Still, we cannot turn away!Outrageously inept! Outlandishly insipid! And yet... and yet, we stare cue ball-eyed at the screen! Don't attempt to make sense of it, just go with it. As with a terminal case of posterior warts, it's best to simply give in and succumb to it.P.S.- You will never look at a bologna sandwich in quite the same way again! Ever!..

reviews.review_title: Joe D'Amato and Claudio Fragasso give us one of the best movies ever made!!
reviews.content: What can I say about Troll II that has not already been said. All my fellow Nilbogians on here who also have a great love for this movie understand. Its just the average "Scream and I Know What You Did Last Summer" junkies who hate this masterpiece. From Italian masters Joe D'Amato [Buio Omega, Anthropophagous] and Claudio Fragasso [Hell of the Living Dead, Rats, Zombie 3] comes a movie that is so bad in terms of acting, FX, and everything else you can possibly imagine, that is is GOOD! Troll II is a classic! From Grampa Seth telling little Joshua the story of Peter, all the way to the edge of your seat finale with Joshua and his poor mommy, this movie ROCKS! Being a die-hard fan of Italian gore [Fulci, Lenzi, Soavi, D'Amato, etc..] I had to check out this flick. I heard so much bad stuff about it, and i wanted to find out myself how bad it was. I finally managed to find a copy [actually I own 3 VHS copies now] and watched it in awe. Horrible Acting, K-Mart FX, Green food, Cheesy dialog, Banjo Music [UGH!]. I was hooked! They need to bring this bad boy out in the US on DVD. I will buy it! Where else can you hear lines like "They are eating her, and then they are going to eat me, OH MY GOD!!!" CLASSIC! If you like cheesy movies, then this movie is one of the best. You cant help but being hooked to this movie. Does it suck? Yes. But in the best ways possible! Troll II is a classic!

Joshua's family takes a trip to Nilbog, which, unbeknown to them, is the kingdom of the goblins, as told to young Joshua by his grandfather Seth, who just happens to be dead.Now it's up to Josh, magical time stopping Grandpa Seth, and a bologna sandwich to save the family from the evil Goblin Queen, who uses everything from magical rocks to an ear of corn, to destroy Josh's family......This was on MGM HD the other night, and i had to give in and watch it, and while it's not the worst film ever made, it's the kind of film that makes you feel depressed when watching it.Some of the acting is beyond awful. The mother is just plain disturbing from the upstart, never before have I seen a person with one facial expression through a movie.The first act of the movie is solely watchable just for the awfulness of the acting, nothing to do with the set up of the movie.And then we finally reach Nilbog, where people are dumb, and the camera man decides to do close ups of vegetable cookbooks.I can really believe the cult following that this movie has gained, because it's so richly full of bad things, you really have to endure it to believe it.From the flirting with corn scene, right up to the famous 'their gonna eat me' scenes, right up to the advice Grandpa gives the young lad, so he decides to urinate over the food, this has it all.Devoid of emotion, but good for laughs, Trolls 2 is epic in it's badness.I feel a better person for sitting through this trite, but there is no way in my life I will ever watch this again.See it, because you have to see it, and witness the apocalypse.

If you have seen a movie where the director has more passion for absolutely festering chunks of horse apples, please contact me. this movie has not only become a personal obsession of mine but my friends and i reference it on a daily basis. our vocabulary has melded around Troll 2. If you haven't seen it......a family (the Waits') from the city trades houses with a family (the Presences') from the country for a month in the lovely town of Nilbog. The townspeople are billed as friendly but they are nothing short of strung out, overly creepy and laughable rednecks. of course everyone in the town is a horribly inept GOBLIN, despite the title of Troll. In human form they are slow, awkward and can't act. as Goblins, they are smaller, stupider and even more retarded (watch for the GOblin with bug eyes and watch how the flimsy rubber fingers of the costumes shake)if you can make it through this movie without laughing, you'll need a drink or 4. if you love it, come join me and my retards over at groups.myspace.com/nilbog

Objectively awful and worthy of joyful mockery in every respect. But it's just not entertaining, and I'm more disappointed by that than anyone.All of the memorable lines (of meme infamy) are before the thirty minute mark. And after that, it completely lost me; just bored to tears from then on.We'd been on a bad movie kick recently; "Silent Night Deadly Night 2", "Miami Connection", "Samurai Cop", all fantastic. And I remember liking the documentary of this movie, so I was all primed and ready to go. This is like the mack daddy of trash movies, and I think I like the narrative of making "Troll 2" rather than the actual movie: that the cast really tried to make something legitimate, but circumstances conspired against them.
Passable camera work and costumes, but atrociously bad script and acting. And ah yes, the evil vegetarians. Oof.

Note I'm an avid fan of MST3K and have developed a fondness for bad movies and subjegate my self to the torture of watching these miserable movies.I read about this movie and I wanted to see it so bad since I read the review/summary. Well I tried all the video stores in the city. Nothing. Looks like I'd never get to see this film ever. :( But at the store where I work we had a bin of lousy movies on sale for $5. I scan Find one other crappy movie I've been dying to have to make fun of in my free time. What do I see underneath the basket?? But a copy of this VHS movie!!! Sweet lord I'm gonna get to watch this film!! I pay for it (along with two other lousy movies (Making Contact and The Brain). I can't wait to get done with my shift.I finally get home and watch this. I have not laughed this hard at a bad movie in such a long time!! Man Mike and the bots would have a feild day with this film. The effects are lousy, plot is lame, acting is wooden and I noticed some of the actors looking right into the camera more than once. The kid looks like is is constipated through the entire film. I've seen movies so bad you wouldn't believe your eyes. I've seen Manos The Hands of Fate!! The costumes are obviously 'little people' inside with potato sacks for clothing, gardening gloves over their hands and masks that look like they were made by pre schoolers!This film is so ripe for Mike and the bots. I can see some of the sketches. For the final one Crow is, as always, dressed like a charachter from the film. This time he is a Goblin. Mike is dressed seductivly like the witch trying to seduce Tom with the ear of corn. (If you saw this film you'd get the gag). Oh the possibilities.... I found my jokes flying out ripping this film to shreds.I HIGHLY recommend this for any MST3K at home parties for fans. If you simply love bad movies like I do, then find it and rent it if you can. For everyone else, avoid like the plauge.

reviews.review_title: could we maybe see some trolls
reviews.content: Your first clue that this movie stinks,could be the fact that although the movie is called "Troll" 2, its actually a movie about goblins.It takes place in a place called nilbog(how cute,goblin spelled backwards).Everything about this movie is disgustingly bad.the special effects suck, the acting is either nonexistent,or so badly overdone as to win the Shattner award.The plot and storyline seem to disappear at times, then suddenly reappear.There are also many,many continuity problems.But the worst of all, its just not very entertaining.mostly its just boring.I would only recommend this film to people wanting to audition at the William Shattner school of overacting,and insomniacs who don't respond to drugs.

reviews.review_title: We Saw More Green Than They Did
reviews.content: OK, first time viewer here. I've been advised that Troll 2 is, in fact, the "Best Worst Movie." I'm here to tell you: I've seen worse.No, it wasn't about the "expectations being so low due to all the reviews." I just watched it with an open mind, though I cringed at almost every minute – especially at Creedence (Reed) who probably made her high school drama teacher drop dead if that person saw this.Maybe it was just so well known and publicized that it garners so much attention. It's (far too) easy to ridicule – the town of NILBOG is goblin spelled backwards in addition to blatantly reiterating the truth throughout the movie these are goblins (and not what the title suggests.) Hell, Halloween III: Season of the Witch wasn't about Mikey Myers, but then again, aside from the future subtitles, it wasn't called "Michael Myers."Perhaps it's just me that comes down harder on movies that are actually supposed to be of high quality that's more of a letdown. I have yet to see the documentary based on Troll 2 (though its #1 in my Netflix queue): Best Worst Movie, but I cannot simply imagine they set out to make a masterpiece.OK, sure, it was bad all around: laughable acting, dialogue, camera angles and shots and special effects that would make the Syfy channel directors droll. And those masks! One in particular was the worst, but since they don't wear name tags, I couldn't state which one I'm referring to.Is it sensible to give way the spoilers to the plot? Oh, why the hell not? Family + Dead Ghost Grandpappa head off to the town of GOBLIN (say it backwards!) where they're practically force fed green icing in order to decompose them enough so the vegetarian residents of Nilbog can eat them.Like all 1980s horror films (in fairness, this was released in 1990, but the three hours it took to film probably took place in 1989) it's up to the boy who cried green to save the day. Thankfully, he's got the most useless ghost since Ghost Dad to at least attempt to help him.I might write an addendum to this review following my viewing of Best Worst Movie because I'm curious to learn a little more about what they were thinking. For example, not five minutes in is the stereotypical homophobic remark but later on, the same guy, Elliott (Wright) had his arm wrapped around his "buddy" in bed with no clothes on. Also, why they thought they had to steal the "not-so" brand name of the original Troll in order to sell this.If you get a chance, like I did, watch this movie a second time using the Rifftrax commentary. I was rolling in laughter with what they came up with. That is, if you can tolerate one of the worst movies ever made a second time. (And yeah, you can. It's call alcohol, or the "drug" of your choice.)

reviews.review_title: It's entertaining how bad this movie is!
reviews.content: Many people have said it before, but it's true, Troll 2 is so bad that it's good. It really is fun to watch this trainwreck. One of the most impressive things about this movie is how they got so many bad actors in the same movie! It's shocking how horrible/entertaining this movie is.

reviews.review_title: Be honest, this is more entertaining than 3 hour Holly drama films
reviews.content: A great movie, truly worth watching. Movies are supposed to entertain you, and this movie does that too well. You will laugh until you cry, and laugh some more. Honestly, I would rather watch this movie and have a good time laughing than sit through a boring Hollywood drama movie that is supposed to be dark and deep (such as the movie Network, and The Conversation, movies I had to watch as part of college film class). This is not great filmmaking at all, but this movie really delivers on the entertainment value. This is really a funny movie, and will be remembered forever. Plus the writing is amazing, you will quote things in this movie for years to come.10/10

reviews.review_title: Double Decker Bologna Sandwiches Have Better Acting Skills
reviews.content: Watched this specifically for an episode of my podcast, Absolutely Horrifying. You do not need to watch the first one to understand this film as it literally has nothing to do with the first film. Hell, you do not even need to watch this one to understand the film as it has no cinematic value unless you're high on gas fumes. Probably the first and only "horror" movie that has an anti-vegetarian take but even the meat of this film has no seasoning. I had to split my viewing experience into two and still somehow wanted to scream at my television at the complete audacity of this film. The only way to make this movie better is for it to live on through a Krewe in a Mardi Gras parade.

I had steered clear from this abomination for so long to only let my guard down and allow the temptation to take hold. I see some people adore it for its sheer badness, but I didn't find it particularly amusing (save for a couple of scenes and dialogues) in that aspect. It bored me, and while technically it was rather standard with some bottom of the barrel choices in wonky make-up FX (no really cheap Halloween masks) and clumsy special effects. I was expecting something more along the lines z-grade trash. Trash it is, especially the material (bonkers plot and terribly inane script) and overbearingly inept performances (leading the way is main the kid with the screwed-up face and the hammy rejected stage-actresses Deborah Reed, and the mother is quite ding-bat too), but for me it wasn't so bad it's funny like it's mentioned it's just tiresomely bad and goes for 91 minutes too long.Some no all of the plot details are ridiculous, but some more so than others like very needy boys hanging out with pal (who's the boyfriend of Connie Young's character) and the welcoming town's folk with their fascination for food. Green food and drinks and no one bothers to question it.The thing that was running through my head (other than can see this get any more stupid yes) was this trying to be a comedy (I hope so) or serious horror. Well it's horrifyingly stupid. If I start thinking too much about it, I might have just started sweating out green sludge! What was the deal naming the film 'Troll 2', where it's goblins that appear I guess that's one of life's many mysterious. At least the ending (while tacky) is unexpected.

reviews.review_title: Edward Wood would have been proud
reviews.content: You just can't make a movie this bad. It's impossible. There had to be some collaboration involved. I think the director got everyone involved and said we only have $200,000 to make this movie, so let's make it as bad a movie as we possibly can. Good acting will not be allowed, even for those of you who can actually act. As to the script, turn your manuscripts upside down and read then backwards. A total of $7.35 will go towards costumes and special effects. Not a penny more. The most expensive item in making the movie was the damn motor home. If we had it to do over we should have used pup-tents, and saved the extra money to buy beer for the crew. Unfortunately, as it is, there isn't enough money to buy beer.All in all, it's a really horrible movie and I hope saying that hasn't violated the 'contain spoilers', clause, because horrible is the only thing good about it.

Troll 2 is simply one of the worst films (in my opinion) that has ever been made. But is it so terrible that its good? Depending on how you choose to view it, the movie can be an unbearable pain, or a hilarious comedy. Everything, every single aspect of the film is far below average. But this can also be ingredients to getting a good laugh.This means though that you can expect sets, actors, lines, music, effects, costumes, and camera work that reeks of incompetence. I cannot, literally cannot imagine trying to make a serious film and having it turn out like that. Sure I could make a purposefully poor film that may be comparable with Troll 2, but without a lot of intent. I wonder if the creators of this film had some.....issues, that is the only logical explanation I can fathom.If you choose to take Troll 2 seriously then this film will feel like torture, and by the ending your brain will have reduced itself to mush. I really enjoy watching poorly made films to laugh at them, so this movie was very enjoyable to me.

reviews.review_title: Disturbing and as bad as proclaimed
reviews.content: Troll 2 has seemingly been advertised and recognized as a "so bad it's good". It is without a doubt one of the worse films yet there may be some things which make it slightly entertaining instead of completely boring.The acting is subpar and amateurish. The plot is weird and makes little sense and the goblin creatures (not trolls) are quite creepy and disturbing looking.The film isn't as funny as people claim. Had very little laughs but most of them were of unintentional.There is some sort of unpredictability within the plot which isn't completely bad. Overall Troll 2 is beyond terrible yet should be watched to see how awful it is.

Notorious for only featuring goblins and no actual trolls, 'Troll 2' is not really a sequel to the fun 80s horror comedy starring Noah Hathaway. It does have a surprising amount in common with the first film though as both concern mischievous shape -shifting creatures who enjoy turning humans into plants. Here though, their agenda is far more horrific since they only want to turn humans into plants to eat them since they are vegetarians (!) and yet, 'Troll 2' is never scary, frightening or unsettling in the least. A lot of the blame comes down to the wooden acting, with Connie Young turning in a particularly poor performance with very rehearsed line delivery as the protagonist's older sister. The dialogue in general is bland though and the costumes and makeup for the goblins are cheap-looking. There is admittedly something interesting about the plot regarding being a vegetarian and the possible benefits of eating meat, but this all gets a little mixed up amid such absurdities as the young boy's dead grandfather being able to pause time in order that he can urinate on the food that his family is about to eat (yes, that happens). The mythology at hand is quite hard to nut out too with grandfather coming back in visions, then in real life and then, who knows? More could be said, but in short, it is easy to see why this has become a cult hit among those who like to laugh at its sheer awfulness.

There, now I can say it, I survived "Troll 2", and I am definitely worse off for it. Obviously the word average should never be uttered in reference to this "cream of the crap." The problem is, despite the grade "F" acting, screenplay, and production values, the audience must be made up of viewers who can barely write their name in the mud with a stick. Anyone with a fraction of intelligence will not be amused by this inept veggie, goblin, borefest. Better bad movies that immediately come to mind would include "Mighty Peking Man", "Mega Piranha", "Abraham Lincoln Vs The Zombies", "Bloody Trail", Bait Shop", and the King of them all "Godmonster of Indian Flats." Other lesser contenders would surely include "Microwave Massacre", and "Shark Attack 3." MERK

reviews.review_title: Can't Tell if Trolling, Or Just Bad at Cinema
reviews.content: I wish a double-decker bologna sandwich could save me from this terrible film. The cameraman, much like the daughter in the film, was still smoking dope, the plot has more holes than a block of special Nilbog Swiss Cheese, the special-effects were nothing special, and all of the lines could be better delivered by a group of 12-year-olds with ADHD. Though it IS fun to watch.Let's start with the acting. Joshua: A young boy who is either emotionless or distraught. That's it. Those are the two things he conveys. His father is either emotionless or enraged. He's sitting in a chair while a town of people sings and dances and brings him food, and he looks like he could care less about the goings on. The mother is always emotionless. Always. Never upset, angry, or caring, just emotionless. Did the director tell her she was playing a statue? Was she trying to emulate the first 45 minutes of The Matrix? Or did she just get botox injections before each scene? If she did, it doesn't show. I'm not even critiquing the daughter. She doesn't deserve attention. EVER.On to the props. They dyed some food green and bought some cheap as free Halloween masks from a pharmacy. These were there costumes and special Nilbog food. And the kid who gets turned into a tree? Exactly which kind of tree is it that he got turned into? Is there such a thing as a tree with rubber bark? If there is, that's the one. As for the goblin's weapons, I'm more than certain they hired an amateur whittler to carve some tree branches into shivs. The most realistic weapon was thrown at a 85 degree angle into the air that hit home at the target's shoulder. It was cheesier than Cheese-O-Saurus Rex's diarrhea.Finally, the worst part of the film, the plot. It includes goblins who hate meat, and turn people into trees/piles of green syrup, a grandpa who is dead, an apparition, able to freeze time for 30 seconds, come back to life, and give his grandson a backpack with a double-decker bologna sandwich. Need I say more?Although this movie has to be the WORST made movie of all time, it is pretty fun to watch, so I gave it two stars. Seriously, if you're bored on a Friday night, invite your friends over and have a laugh with this movie.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I was lead to believe.
reviews.content: I think the big problem with this film is that it's not the horror movie it's advertised as being. Not that Leprechaun is all that horrifying, but it was intended to scare people. Troll kind of is too, but It feels more like a bad episode of Goosebumps than a full fledged horror film. Having nothing to do with the original Troll movie, both films seem to tread a thin line between if being Fantasy and Horror, and just doing a really bad job of it. I also feel like the movie was made at the wrong time. Troll 2 was made to piggy back slasher films when it seems more like a child friendly fantasy vibe.Overall, I did not feel like I wasted my time watching it, but it's not really all that worth watching.

Holy something ... this is amazing! That someone can actually make a movie this bad is fantastic. Absolutly everything from the actors to the goblins is so terrible that you can´t make it on purpose. You have to be totally delusional to think you made a good movie when releasing it as a horror film to the audience. It´s known as the best worst movie ever, and I get why. Must see soon again!

reviews.review_title: Never Go To A Town Called Nilbog, It Obviously Means Goblin!
reviews.content: This 1990 fantasy-horror film stars Michael Stephenson, Deborah Reed, George Hardy, Margo Prey, Connie Young and Robert Ormsby. This tells of young boy, Joshua Waits (Stephenson) who goes on vacation with his father, Michael (Hardy), mother, Diana (Prey) and sister, Holly (Young) to a small town, Nilbog. Joshua discovers that the residents are goblins disguised as people feeding on plants and humans. Reed plays their goblin witch, Creedence Leonore Gielgud. With help of the spirit of his late grandfather, Seth (Ormsby), Joshua tries to warn his family until they eventually believe him. I watched this on HBO as a kid. Everything about it is bad, but it's a bit amusing and like a Grimm fairytale on drugs. It also should've had a different title because it has nothing to do with "Troll" and has no trolls, only goblins. Reed is probably the only person in the film who is somewhat entertaining and yet a bit over the top with her Bela Lugosi/Eva Gabor accent and facial expressions. This cheesefest has managed to gain a cult following and if you're into occult or B-movies, give it a try at least once.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a strange specimen..
reviews.content: Troll 2, in my opinion, isn't the worst movie ever made. That title would go to "Monster A- Go Go". This movie isn't exactly so bad its good either. Its sort of in between. That's not saying its a bad movie. A good movie wouldn't make a movie about goblins and call it Troll 2. The acting is beyond awful as well. Some of the actors in this movie, like the daughter, make Tommy Wiseau look like Bela Lugosi. And last, but not least, the trolls. Most of them look the same, which is like little kids in terrible plastic masks. I don't really understand what this movie was trying to accomplish. I couldn't tell if it was a horror, comedy, or both. In conclusion, stay away from this one.I give it: 3/10

reviews.review_title: Maybe we're not understanding the message and symbolism...
reviews.content: I have never seen a movie where a ghost (grandpa) is having a heart attack. Brilliant? I don't understand it.I wanted to live the experience. Many people talk about this movie on the internet as if it's some kind of urban legend. Everything is true.But I have to thank this movie for making me laugh out hard with incredulity. I couldn't believe most of the behind the camera situations that were actually displayed! The acting is putrid, worse than amateurish. Have you noticed how the actors look awkward, like not knowing what's going on. For example, when everybody is dancing, singing, and clapping in order to convince the family to "eat". If you take a close look at the actors, none of them knows what to do next! Pay special attention to the drugstore owner.Maybe Fragasso (the director) tried to use symbolism in order to express his ideas. For example, the "erotic" scene between the crazy vegetarian freak woman and the guy in the trailer. What was the deal with the popcorn's exploding while they were making out?. Maybe the pop corns represent an orgasm while exploding? Maybe the Director wanted to give priority to the visuals instead of the story, like in most generic Italian movies. Heck, if Argento does it, why not him?. We don't learn about the connection between the dead grandpa and the boy, also what happens to the guy who has sexy with the freaky lady?, what's the deal with the Patrick Duffy look alike preacher?. What was the trick that "a friend" taught to grandpa?. Why is one of the trolls an obvious puppet?. Why would grandpa mistake the bedrooms and scare the hell out of the blonde girl?.The dialogs are beyond bad. When more than three scenes focus on discussing about a guy who has to pick between his girl and his friends, then you know something is wrong.What about the random and uncalled for moments?!. When the geek friend goes out of the trailer, finds a hot girl, and then tries to negotiate with the trolls... please, that was awful. Then the same geek delivers one of the most outrageous if not comedic moments of all time in cinema. You know, the "oh my Gawwwwd" moment.The "sinister" score was the same used in "Dead Dudes in the House". How's that strange? One last thing. I can't take off my head the silly song everybody sings in the family's house. The whole piano, the "la la la" tune, it's so catchy it's evil.Please, get this movie out of my life.

If you delight in torture in its purest form, you've found the right movie here. I was a fan of the first movie, watched in my early teen years, so I was eager to recapture a bit of the B Movie magic it had originally displayed. What I got was a maddening exercise in bad acting, horrible writing and cringe worthy cast interactions. At a mere guess I'd say the same misguided soul who produced this, also wrote and filmed it. To imagine work this bad being the result of a larger cast of movie makers is indeed frightening. Nearly 30 years after its release I have to hope that those involved in its production look back with an embarrassed laugh. Anything resembling pride should be buried deep down and never brought to light.

reviews.review_title: "Grab the pot and drag me out!"
reviews.content: A hideous child who likes to converse with the ghost of his dead grandfather and his hopelessly dumb family go over the meadow and through the woods to the off-putting and peculiar rural town of Nilbog to swap houses with a family they've never met and all the oddball townsfolk are actually goblins in disguise who repeatedly try to get them to eat disgusting green glop that will transform them into vegetables so that they can be eaten! Troll 2!!! So this movie has a pretty impressive 'cult' fanbase as one of the best bad movies ever made, and while there are bad films I like better, I think this beauty more than lives up to its reputation with every frame. I enjoy it and find it good but not on the level of it being any kind of good motion picture, I just love how much it makes me laugh, because it's not just awful, it's hysterically awful! There's no question that it is indeed a terrible film in every aspect, the effects, the music, the camerawork and most of all the acting, but it's so entertaining because of that, because of how much of a colossal failure it is at a serious attempt at cinema and to watch this movie is to enter a bizarre fantasy land that feels like it can go off in any random direction at any given moment, but it can be such a fun blast if you're in just the right frame of mind for it, whether that may require you to drink or smoke a little something first who can say! The original Troll I have a special place for and enjoy on a genuine level, like a movie. It's witty, it's goofy, it's fun and it's even a little creepy, so why did this 'movie' have to associate itself instead of sticking to its guns and daring to be its own thing? Obviously because somebody took one look at what an astonishing sh*theap it was and realised that it would never attract any attention or stand on its own, and so they decided to just leach off the good name of a far better horror picture! It's so weirdly structured and so much stuff in it doesn't even remotely make sense, like how the grandpa can randomly become corporeal enough to hand out Molotov cocktails to his grandson or use the Force to battle sinister goblin reverends, or of course stop time itself so that ugly children may p*ss on hospitality! The dialogue is so stilted and unnatural sounding, like it's bad rehearsals for a community stage play, with the worst offender for me being the freakshow of a mother who always looks so astonished and strange, like a deer caught in the headlights. She really looked out of her mind, you can see the insanity in that woman's eyes, she clearly was not quite all there! I did like the rather strapping father, he was at least a little gung-ho about his silly thankless little role, and speaking of enthusiastic, I love Deborah Reed as the goblin queen witchy-woman, because she seemed like the only cast member to be fully aware of what kind of film she was acting in and just went completely nuts with it, her manic expressions and thunderous theatricality are a real highlight and have to be seen to be believed! The director was a deluded old stubborn fool for not acknowledging and embracing his movie's legendary rottenness! So ridiculous but so funny, if you don't get the so-bad-it's-good thing than you'll definitely just hate it, and you'd be in your right to, but just roll with it and try to have fun and enjoy the offbeat freaky ride, and do remember to eat ya veggies! X

It is a horrible movie and Connie Young only makes it worse......but it's like a train wreck where you can't look away.I mean, you get stuck to your seat wishing Young had another line so she can shout it like she's talking to someone across the train-station whilst looking directly into the camera.You can't wait to see the God-awful trolls again, which, honestly, I think were made to look that way because the director just wanted to humiliate midgets.From start to finish you want to kill everyone involved......but you finish it because it falls into the so bad it's entertaining loophole.But, well, it just hurts to watch it.

I thought Joshua was pretty hot first time I saw this, but now he seems ugly to me. Plus he spend's to much time with that dead guy worrying about trolls. And his mom is so 80s. I did not like how the movie makes fun of freckles; thats just mean. Holly is a good person who does not put out! Its not her fault that her boyfriend turns gay! I feel bad making fun of midgets now, they eat people, so you should really try to be nice to them and not be like Arnold who thought he was cool by telling them off. Probably you should not eat food that is green, it might be moldy or turn you into plants.I learned how popcorn makes guys go crazy for you, so it wasn't a total loss.

reviews.review_title: Yes, it really is THAT Bad!
reviews.content: Warning! SPOILERS! (allthough there's little to spoil about this pile of crap) I'm not sure why I decided to watch "Troll 2" of 1990 after I already hated its predecessor. Probably due to the film's reputation of one of the worst movies ever made. And this reputation is justified. It's not often that I give movies the lowest possible rating of 1 out of 10, and i can usually find something positive even about the crappiest films, but "Troll 2" simply has no redeeming quality whatsoever, the film is utter garbage and hardly bearable to sit through. Also, this isn't one of the films that are so bad that they become funny and are therefore worth watching. This film simply becomes more annoying and unbearable with every minute, and even hardcore fans of awful cinema are well advised to avoid this stinker. The film doesn't even feature Trolls but only Goblins.A family consisting of an extremely annoying boy who talks to his dead grandfather, his irritating teenage sister, an idiot father and a mother who looks like she'd be typecast as a witch rather than a mom decide to travel to the countryside. They are followed by the girl's idiot boyfriend and his 'good for nothing' friends. The father thinks they are a bad influence on his daughter, although they look like a nerdy group of 'Dungeons and Dragons' players. Anyhow, the little boy is repeatedly warned about dangerous Goblins living around the little town. This little backwater is supposed to be the Goblin's kingdom... It's getting more and more awful with every minute. Every second of the movie I hoped that this pain in the ass of a family, as well as every other character in the movie would die as quickly as possible so this terrible thing would be over. Nonetheless "Troll 2" is unendurable 95 minutes long.The film makes every effort to destroy any possible tiny bit of tension that could have come up. In the very beginning, when the (dead) grandfather tells a story about goblins, in which a guy meets a woman, the boy comes up with the line "I bet it was a goblin in disguise", which is exactly what happens next. Also, the 'goblins' like to turn humans into vegetables in order to feed on them. On the other hand these goblins are hardcore vegetarians, who are so afraid of meat, that they can be defeated by throwing a sandwich at them.Even if you're a hardcore fan of bad cinema, and even if you're curios whether this really is as bad as they say, I seriously recommend to avoid this at all costs! It really is as bad as they say, or, more precisely one of the most awful stinkers ever made! Unbelievably terrible pile of garbage! 1/10 because there is no 0.

We've finally found it, the worst film ever created. Seriously. This isn't bad like "Phantom Menace" bad or "Epic Movie" bad, because (apart from the acting) were FILMS. This is not a film. This does not even deserve the title "BAD". This should be shown to budding film-makers to show them what NOT to do. Of course there may be people out there who think Highlander 2 or Batman and Robin should be worst, but remember that some people think those movies are good. There is NO ONE who can honestly call Troll 2 a good film.Don't get me wrong, I LOVE this film, it's one of my favourites, but it is really the ultimate "So- Bad-It's-Good" film. Bar none. So do the right thing, vote 1 star for this film and help it return to the No. 1 spot.

reviews.review_title: DO YOU LOVE WATCHING FILMS WITH SAND IN YOUR EYES ???? GREAT !!!!
reviews.content:
Then you'll love TROLL 2 (electric boogaloo)this film is called the worst film ever made and yet hailed as one of the greatest bad films that people love ... so bad you love it ...so bad people praise it ... but whatever you think of it you know it is in fact BAD .... the stories behind the production are strange and confusing , ranging from how no one on set spoke the same language, leading to odd conflicts during shooting for the actors and director etc, to how marketing changed the name to troll 2 to cash in on the American title of "troll" a film that has NOTHING to do with this movie .... the history of this film is a roller coaster ride in and of itself ...
BUT the film ....lets talk about it ...the FX are about as good as a wal mart Halloween sell gets , "50% off ?!?!?! man I bet I could film a goblin movie with these masks !!!!" ... the gore was at times silly but at least they had fun with it I guess ....the acting is stiff , now granted they were reading the direct written script and were not allowed to wonder from it lol... and wow ... it was bad ... mis translated and mis understood and mis fired and missed the point and anything else "mis" lol.. it was cheesy and over the top (so I loved it )the over all quality was at least on par with other films of the era though so good job lol....its a great film to make fun of OBVIOUSLY in internet trolls found their king and dug into it lol.... but its stupid ...terrible and awesome ..... I give it an 8 but not because it is good or deserves it ....but because like so many others out there .. it found a special place in my heart .... awwwww lol

reviews.review_title: Quite probably the worst theatrically released film ever!!!
reviews.content: I don't even know what this was, it was that bad. It was weird, horribly acted, badly directed, even worse written and the trolls were pathetic looking. I'll start with the plot. It's about a stupid family going to the stupid town of "Nilbog" and meeting trolls and witches there. Not only that, but the little boy sees his dead grandpa's ghost. Sounds good?...Read on. I'll start my negatives on the acting. This has some of the worst acting I've ever experienced. Every line said has no emotion whatsoever, and it's as though they got these people off the street. The best actor was the little boy who is one of the worst child actors I've ever experienced.Now onto the effects. They were some of the worst I've ever seen. I guess this was on a $5 dollar budget or something. The trolls were all midgets in fat little suits with really lame looking troll costume heads. In a particularly brainless scene, a girl turned into a witch comes onto a boy and they have an ear of corn in each other's mouth and popcorn starts coming at them(???) They were about as scary as something from an Ed Wood movie!The direction was all over the place. The camera-work was awful and shaky and I just hated it! The writing was just as bad as the acting, and this was one of the weirdest, stupidest things ever. I guess there were trolls, and witches and the witches turns people into trees or something(?) It was awful, don't see it unless you want to make fun of it, which is why I own this film. It is really hilarious, and would have been better off being released as a comedy. The worst line has to be, "Grampa Seth is still with us in our hearts, but we must banish him from our minds."PG-13 for lame green blood. 93 mins. 0/100.

On its own, this movie is not very good. It's not the worst, but not good either.The actors are pretty bad, as are effects, continuity, production values, etc.But the worst part of the whole movie is the dialogue... well maybe it's the acting, but the dialogue makes it fail, or win depending on how you look at it.This was a movie written by an Italian, and directed by an Italian, who spoke almost no English, yet they wrote the English dialogue! The characters said things in a way no normal American would. There was no English speaking director to realize they were saying things the wrong way.There was no possible way this movie was going to be good. It turns out to be one of those movies that you'd pass over if you saw it on TV.It's only when you've been told "It's the worst movie EVER" that you take the time to watch it. It's pretty good as a Good BAD movie, but but no means is it the "BEST WORST MOVIE" as so many claim. It's really not much different that so many other direct to video 80's films.This movie is great when watched with friends after repeated viewings... which makes it NOT the worst movie of all time.
This movie has some weird stuff, some funny stuff, and some downright disturbing stuff. The acting is truly terrible.

Young boy fears the worse when the goblins from his nightmares come to life and set there sights on his family as lunch, however they turn their victims into plants or veggies first, because these goblins do not eat meat. Slightly better then the first, but that really isn't saying much. Terrible make-up and costumes, along with some laughable acting and dialogue sink it.
Rated PG-13; Violence.

Believe me when I tell you that you have not lived until you see TROLL 2, a sequel in name only to that 1980s bizarro flick, TROLL. A family moves to the tiny town of Nilbo, only to be besieged by forest goblins who want them dead. Itis up to the young son and his dead grandpa to save the day. Shile the film is called TROLL 2, there's nary a troll in sight. The film's original title, GOBLINBS, is more like it. And check out the name of the town spelled backwards for further proof. A really bad movie. For those who were captivated by the low-budget Euro horror comedy, TROLL, a remake is coming in 2010 from the director of the original.

This movie is awful. It is laughably bad. I liked the first one, but this is terrible. sure there are a few good scenes(Oh my God,Corn Porn) But most of the movie is awful. It has a terrible plot. It is so painful that it is not even so bad its good. There are so bad it good movies, Like Plan 9, but this has worse acting than that. at least plan 9 is entertaining, but this is not. Troll 2 is the 4th worst movie I Have ever seen. don't waste your money. don't waste your time. It may be entertaining sometimes if you pretend your on MST3K. 1 out of 10. Terrible movie. should have been on MST3K. If you want to see a good bad movie, watch Plan 9.

The rarest and most satisfying kind of bad movie, one that whoops and hollers and waves its hat around like Raquel Welch in Myra Breckinridge. Nothing shy or retiring about Troll 2 - Joe d'Amato makes no excuses whatsoever for his crummy little movie, he REVELS in its badness, putting every cent of his $58.23 budget right up there on the screen where you can see it.I mean, you only THINK you've seen bad acting in a color movie - Troll 2 has entire rooms full of actors - okay, warm bodies - reading lines to each other like rehearsals for the church pageant.  And it has Creedence the Druid.  Creedence the Druid sets a standard for over-the-top-screamingly-godawful acting that may never be exceeded unless they make Manos 2: The Reckoning with Richard Simmons as Torgo.And you only THINK that nothing could top the mutant sheep fetus in Godmonster of Indian Flats for flaky plot points.  How about - vegetarian shape-shifting trolls, identifiable in human form by shamrock-shaped warts?
Crappy FX?  How about lime jello and green food coloring used as...no, you won't believe it, nor the use of a double baloney sandwich as an offensive weapon.Gotta see this one, folks.  This isn't a bad movie because it's incredibly boring, or because MST got hold of it, or because all the major critics hated it.  This is a bad movie because it's crazy as a backhouse rat whacked with a ball bat, running around in circles in the middle of the barnyard.

reviews.review_title: I Enjoyed This Film. Here's Why
reviews.content: Firstly I am giving this film the highest rating I can give 10.Now onto the film. Its a horror film to be sure. There is no happy ending just like the first film Troll. This film has Goblins, rather than Trolls, disguised as normal human beings. The goblins feed on part plant, part animal food. In order to obtain this food they need a human victim. They feed him food which is doctored by their queen and which converts the victim into the food they need. The Goblins eat their victim WHILE HE IS STILL ALIVE!!!WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED? Honestly people, this is a gem of a horror film.The principles of good film making are adhered to. 1. The plot is intriguing. 2. There is good gore and make-up effects. 3. Sound-effects and background music are adequate to film. 4. The film IS SCARY AS HELL!!! 5. NO HAPPY ENDING. The hero is probably eaten or killed at the end, WE MAY NEVER KNOW.What more do you want out of a horror film?Brief Plot: For the summer vacation, the Waits family has decided to vacation in the town of Nilbog, a remote farming community, where they will swap houses with one of the local residents and spend the summer living off of the land. The night before the family is set to leave, young Joshua Waits (Michael Stephenson) is contacted by the ghost of his dead grandfather, Seth (Robert Ormsby), who warns him about monsters known as goblins—malicious vegans who turn people into human/plant hybrids in order to eat them...When they reach Nilbog he Waits family discovers that the residents have left a large, all-vegetable meal for them. Seth helps Joshua by freezing time and warning him that the food is actually a potion that will turn them into vegetable people.Eventually Joshua will face the true terror of Nilbog and attempt to stop it once and for all!Verdict: Must have for all horror buffs. I already own a copy of both films Troll and Troll 2.

reviews.review_title: Not so much a film as it is an experience
reviews.content: One of the best worst films ever made, this is not so such a film as it is an experience. It is not as outrageously fun as "Plan 9 from Outer Space" and "The Room" as it isn't quite as bizarre as those films but it's pretty damn close. I understand that neither Claudio Fragasso nor Rossella Drudi, who were responsible for the screenplay, spoke great English at the time that the film was made. That...would explain a lot. Maybe if they had written it in their native Italian and had had someone - hopefully someone qualified! - translate it into English, the dialogue would make more much sense. As it stands, the vast majority of it is pretty atrocious but hilariously so. That said, better dialogue would have done little to improve the insanely stupid plot. Fragasso's direction is not as bad but it is still very bad. This is particularly apparent during tracking shots when the camera almost always shakes slightly. If he was going for the shaky cam effect, there were no other indications of it in the film! It lasts for 93 minutes which I think is about 15 minutes too long as it tends to drag towards the end. As is well known, the film has nothing to do with "Troll" and does not feature any trolls nor is the word even mentioned. Other than that, however, the title was perfectly chosen. The film stars Michael Stephenson as Joshua Waits, a young boy who is regularly visited by the ghost of his late grandfather Seth who warns him that goblins plan to turn the family into plants and consume. The goblins are vegetarians so they're particularly conscientious movie monsters so we have to give them credit on that score at least. As part of a house exchange holiday (which actually isn't a bad setup for a horror film), the Waits family are going to spend a month in a charming little hamlet called Nilbog with a population of only 26 people. As is helpfully pointed out to us by Joshua a mere 45 minutes into the film, "Nilbog" is "Goblin" spelled backwards. Amazingly, this little nugget of information did not pass me by until that point. Joshua's father Michael is played by a dentist named George Hardy. He has all the on screen charisma of Cary Grant, if he had been a dentist. There is hardly a line delivered by anyone in a remotely natural sounding manner but the award for the worst performance is a tie between Connie McFarland as Holly Waits and Deborah Reed as Creedence Leonore Gielgud (no relation to Sir John, presumably), both of whom are wonderfully awful in completely different ways so, hey, at least there's variety. Reed's overacting in particular is a joy to behold. My favourite bit is certainly the (in)famous urinating on hospitality scene and that is also the best line in the entire film. However, I did find it educational as before I saw this film for the first time, I thought that it was indeed possible to relieve myself on concepts such as hospitality, kindness and generosity. Thankfully, this managed to set me straight. The popcorn sex scene was...odd. It's something that I've never been able to forget. Try as I might. Another great moment is when Michael says, "Are you still smoking dope, Holly?" in a tone which suggests that he takes it about as seriously as her not using a coaster on the table. I also love Holly's interaction with Elliot Cooper, played by future bestselling author - no, really - Jason Wright. Well, I say "interaction" but it mostly consists of her insinuating that he is gay because he has three good male friends - none of whom are the sharpest tools in the shed, bless 'em - and assaulting him. I assume that it is the fact that she is incapable of saying anything like a real person that attracts him to her.Overall, this is a gloriously bad film which manages to fail admirably on every level. It was a great disaster for all concerned. If it were possible on IMDb, I would have given it 0/10 for quality. 9/10 for enjoyment factor though!

Goblins (not Troll 2) is an extremely poor, yet extremely entertaining film! I found myself chuckling away throughout most of it, and my friends seemed to thoroughly enjoy this rather terrible film too.The characters are sort of there actually, and there is some development to them. But the story is so ludicrous and the costumes hilarious along with bad cinematography it can never be taken as a serious horror film.1/10: As a film it's shocking, one of the worst ever. However, if you just want a laugh I would absolutely recommend this

I watched this movie because I read it was one of the worst movies of all-time and I had to see for myself what all the talk was about. Troll 2, does not disappoint, it is a HORRIBLE movie. I felt like I was watching a high school play, where half of the students didn't even want to be in the production but were forced to in order to pass.Pretty much everything about this movie is bad. It is a sad day when the 7 year old boy is the best actor and that isn't saying much. Troll 2 is so bad it is entertaining. I am not sure if the production team was trying to make a horrible movie or if it just turned out that way.There are too many funny things in this movie. The spear throw... awesome! The delivery of dialogue is painfully bad. The girl who was tricked into eating then is tricked again into drinking some broth... idiot. The corn on the cob... The house warming party. The Double Decker bologna sandwich.And last but not least.. the whole principal of the movie; Why would vegetarians bother with converting humans into plants before eating them when they are already surrounded by a forest? Oh, and I think the mom was a template for the goblin with the bulging eyes, because she makes the same kind of look throughout the entire movie.So horrible you won't be able to turn away...

A child's imaginary (or is he?) friend is the ghost of his grandpa who warns him of the evils to come. When he tells his family they just tell him he needs to get over Grandpa's death and move on. But Grandpa's right on all counts, and all the ridiculousness he predicted unfolds in this cheap, trite, tired "Invasion of..." in this case "trolls", looking mostly paralyzed in grotesque reject costumes a Hallowe'en store sent back en masse and the producers got for pennies on the dollar.
Absolutely nothing to recommend.

Classic drive-in junk, TROLL @ has a family vacationing in a rural town called Nilbog -- "Goblin" spelled backwards. There they run into a bunch of forest goblins who eat people. This is the kind of movie you try not to watch while it's running, for fear your hair and teeth may fall out. It was an Italian flick shot in Utah with an English-speaking cast. And it looks it. Watch for the pretty blonde about halfway in who falls prey to the goblins. She's worth the wait. This is not a sequel to TROLL, by the way, regardless of the title. It was called GOBLINS everywhere but here. The family in peril is annoying as hell, although the teenaged daughter is curvy and reasonably cute in a 1990s way. Avoid at all costs!

This was easily the most grating movie I have ever had the displeasure to sit through. Its hardly worth the time it takes for me to write this review, but it has left such a horrid taste in my mouth that I fear if I don't spew it out, I may to turn into a troll....I mean a goblin. That's right, Troll 2 doesn't have a single troll in it. That's not the worst part. All of the actors (save for the obnoxious kid) seem to have been dosed with a near-lethal cocktail of anti-psychotics and sedatives. They also appeared to have been instructed to read the lines as if they had no comprehension of proper inflection and/or any type of readable/audible human emotion. I could look past a phony accent, but these people seemed to have been beamed down from some planet where language itself simply does not exist. The result is a bona fide suck-fest of a film that I, a man with a wide sense of humor, have trouble comprehending. Just what exactly was this movie? That question has muddled my mind for the past 24 hour period and I advise strongly against going down that dark and dreary road for it will surely end with your ears bleeding. This movie was nothing more than a dreadful reminder of why I don't carry a gun.

reviews.review_title: If you ever want to make fun of a movie, THIS IS IT!!!
reviews.content: We've all had those times where we sit down with a bunch of friends to watch a movie, and all you can do is point out everything wrong with it, and laugh your butts off.  Well, Troll 2 does the work for you.  It points out EVERYTHING wrong with the movie, which IS basically everything.  From the hilarious over acting and inablities to act, to the moronic plot-line ("The town's name is Nilbog.  That's Goblin spelled backwards!!!"  I laughed for ten minutes at that one).  My favorite parts were when the kid had to take a leak all over the familiy's dinner so they wouldn't turn into goblins, and also everytime one of the goblins throws a "spear" (it wobbles up and down in the air, and we can see the victim grab the spear and "plunge" it into himself....HOW TECHNICALLY ADVANCED!!)  All in all, the best worst movie of all time.  Rent and watch it with friends for good laughs.

reviews.review_title: What a fine piece of garbage.
reviews.content: This has to be the funniest bad movie ever made. Also one  of the worst movies ever made period. Some of the worst acting I've ever seen. The daughter is maybe the worst of  the bunch. The dialogue is some of the most hilariously awful dialogue ever written. The ending was hilarious, but mean. All in all if you love bad movies you have to see this, its hilariously awful. I give Troll 2 * out of ****

reviews.review_title: There must be some logical explanation for this...
reviews.content: Oh my GOD this movie is bad.  The first time I saw it, I simply sat there with my mouth agape at the incomprehensible dialogue, the pathetic acting, the grade-school costuming.  However, I may advise you that it does get better with multiple viewings, as you start to see more of the subtle nuances of the badness.  For instance, in most other movies I can single out one or a few actors who are not good.  In this movie, the best actors are the extras.  From the hideous mugging of Joshua, to the bizarre lines of Sheriff Gene Freak, no one comes out unscathed.  Especially bad are the mom, who shouts all her lines in a grating monotone, and her daughter, who dances for no reason and has a love/hate relationship with her quasi-homosexual boyfriend.  As in, she loves him in one scene, and hates him...in the same scene.  But then, I haven't gotten into the goblins.Yes, Troll 2 has no trolls at all.  These are goblins ("spiteful, and impudent", the 'wise' Grandpa Seth explains), also known as squat burlap-sack-clad midgets with Wal-Mart $2.95 Halloween masks and work gloves.  Of course they don human disguises for most of the movie, because this is easier to film.  They are led by Deborah Reed as Creedence, who rivals Jon Voight of Anaconda and John Steiner of Sinbad of the Seven Seas for my hilarious overacting award.  They are vegetarians who listen to intricate sermons on the evils of meat-by-products, while still loving to eat people, just so long as they're "purified" by dry-ice concoctions or green-toothpasted food.  Which, by the way, none of the family finds strange in the slightest.  Green corn-on-the-cob?  Sure, eat it every day.  No problem.I won't spoil the magnificent ending for you here (though many have already) except to say it nullifies the entire struggle against the goblins up to that point.  Which I suppose is indicative of this entire movie.  It's pointless to the nth degree, but I love it.  If you like bad movies, you will too.  Heed the advice of Grandpa Seth.  They can.  They CAN!!!

This Film was so Bad it was Great I gave it a 10. I Love the behind the scenes just imagine this Crazy Funny Man. Making this Fantastic Masterpiece now he WORKS ON YOUR TEETH. IN REAL LIFE. When he was Punishing his Boy with that ONE LINE. IT WAS SO MESSED UP. AND SO FUNNY AT ONE TIME WITH THAT BELT THING. I ALMOST PISSED MY PANTS. It was so STUPID BUT IT WAS THE WAY HE SAID IT.
