Troll 2 took a shot at stupidity in the name of horror comedy. Stupidity didn't like being shot at, and so it beat the crap out of Troll 2, left it half-dead in the gutter, and took its lunch money. It's forgivable to fail at matching Federico Fellini in terms of quality, but to fail at mocking cheesy B horror movies? How do you screw that up? Can you think of anything more pathetic? Neither can I.Apparently, they couldn't get the troll back for the sequel  something about a pay dispute. He was supposed to get a nymph, and a few "good" leaves from the previous film, but the studio held out so he said no dice to this one. But hey, don't fret, they got something better for the sequel! A small army of vegetarian goblins! It makes you wonder what will appear in Troll 3 should it ever be made. My money's on a transvestite Treant that shaves its roots.Critics and especially net critics get carried away in their quest to prove to the world they have wit with exaggerated statements like, "the goblins look like fat kids in Halloween masks! The actors might as well be puppets they're so wooden!" Usually you take such comments with a grain of salt since most of the time said critics are glorified message board trolls (no pun) seeking the delusional power from making fun of a movie. In this case, they're completely right. The goblins do look like fat kids in Halloween masks, and the actors might as well be puppets (that goes quadruple for the actress who plays Diana Waits).Remember, this is a movie where the ultimate weapon that slays the evil vegetarian goblins is a double-decker baloney sandwich. I think it's safe to say these people were trying (way too hard) to make the acting ridiculously wooden. Most of the time you can hear the punctuation in their dialogue. Who talks like that? In simple sentences with elongated pauses between each sentence? One sentence at a time? There's no life or anything remotely natural about this delivery.Diana, the mom, stares with eyes wide all the time, giving her family menacing looks as though hinting that she has something to do with the goblins (even though she does not.) Oh, sorry, the word "hint" implies that she's subtle. The mom might as well be wearing a sandwich sign that says, "I have something to do with the Goblins!" I mean, the dolls in the later Child's Play films are light years more articulate, more subtle, and more believable than this actress.Each of the cast has their own unique (read: irritating) quirk. And in their mighty efforts to make fun of bad acting, most of these people forgot that they were also trying to be funny in a cheesy B-horror way. The result? Oh my God is it painful. The beginning of the movie attempts to establish the characters before sending them on the road to trade homes with the family from Hills Have Eyes (don't ask), and so we get to endure 10 or 20 minutes of this pain nonstop before any kind of relief.When they started singing "Row, row, row your boat" in the car, an epiphany struck me: Troll 2 was an attempt to take over the world. It would inspire mass hara kiri from those watching its virtually unprecedented awful qualities, leaving the powers behind the film with no opposition for global control. It was difficult, but I resisted the urge and survived to write about it.The film contains exactly three jokes that work (as in the audience laughs with the film), but by that point the audience doesn't even notice  they're busy laughing and/or cringing at the mountain of stuff that fails. The most notable of Troll 2's successes is the character of Creedence, the psychotic druid (the first two times she appears  after that the punchline gets old). Creedence is played Troma style and, honestly, should not be one of the films successes; however, juxtapose to the rest of the lifeless cast anything with a hint of heartbeat is a success.The art of Troma style acting involves answering the question, "How ridiculously far over the top can you possibly go?" Under the Troma school of acting, a character can't ask a question without perpetual eyebrow movement and overly animated facial expressions. Creedence would be the perfect match for Ace Ventura, the pet detective.Like I said, Creedence shouldn't be as entertaining as she is, but after watching zombies trying to walk around and act for 20 minutes  a total flake is a nice change of scenery.All in all, Troll 2 sets rock bottom expectations for itself, then grabs a shovel and starts digging so it can sink even lower.

Warning Spoilers!!! Warning Spoilers!!! Warning Spoilers!!! After hearing the reviews for Troll and Troll 2 i decided to check them out for my self and liked them. Troll is about a Troll(Obvioulsly) trying to turn an apartment complex into his world while a boy named HarryPotter (This was made before the Harry Potter novel so their not stealing the name) suspects something.But now Troll 2, besides the name this film has no connection with the first film. the film is basically about a boy named Joshua who keeps seeing the ghost of his Grandfather Seth who warns him about the Goblins (Not Troll's) and if anyone eats their food their skin becomes plant matter and are eaten by the Goblins, while his told about them his parents have booked a holiday in a remote town called Nilbog (Goblin spelt the other way) Meanwhile their daughter Holly is in her room working out when her Boyfriend sneaks into her room, and it seems her father hates him and would chop his balls off and eat them. Since Holly doesn't like him spending any time with friends and only be around her.The family soon arrive at Nilbog and are given a feast of food with green and blue clay on top, so instead of wondering why Joshua's family decide to eat it when his Grandpa Seth stops time and tells him to do something so thinking quick Joshua pisses on all the food.While in the mobile home Holly's boyfriend and his mates are also enjoying a stay at Nilbog after he told them that the town is full of young women looking for men. so Arnold decides to go out for a walk and sees a young woman running through so he follows her only to find that Goblins are right behind them.The two go off into a church to find that the Queen of the Goblins lives there and after the woman drinks from the streaming cup she becomes the a plant like woman and eaten by the Goblins while Arnold becomes a half man half tree.Soon one of the others decides to go out for supplies and runs into Sheriff Gean Freak (Nice name) and offers him a lift, during the drive the Sheriff offers him a sandwich with a green meat inside it and the guy eats it with no questions asked why it's green.of course the family soon discover that the town people are Goblins are the only way to kill them is to touch the magic stone but when Grandpa Seth takes Joshua there he fends the Goblins with a baloney sandwich, him and his family touch the magic stone and kills the Goblins.Joshua, his family and Holly's boyfriend go home and while the father goes to work and the two teenagers decide to go out Josh and his mom go in their house. it's not long before Joshua goes into the bathroom and find green mush in the shower so he runs into the kitchen to find the Goblins eating her Mother with the Goblin's line "Want some, Joshua?" Troll 2 is a enjoyable movie if you're into low budget horror films. Written and Directed by Italian horror mastermind Claudio Fraggaso.

reviews.review_title: My IQ dropped 32 points because I watched this movie.
reviews.content: If any movie can make you stupider for having seen it, this would be it.  I don't understand how the acting was so bad.  If you randomly chose a family reunion in Jersey to use as a movie cast, the average performance would still be better than this.  It's as if the actors were given electric shock every time they delivered a line well or naturally, until eventually they could only express themselves only in pseudo-angry shouting and/or wooden monotone.  Just remembering this movie makes me feel dirty, but it's a dirt I can't wash off.

reviews.review_title: So bad you've got to watch it
reviews.content: This movie is so bad in every aspect of film making. However, its one redeeming feature is that it is so bad that you've got to watch it for a bit of a laugh.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely the worst film of all times!
reviews.content: Someone mentioned that they would vote for a 0, well i would like to go beyond that and give this film a -0.It is hard to understand what the people behind this film wanted to do, is this a comedy? horror? kids film? when looking at this movie from my perspective (Hell i knew this movie sucked and i wanted to see just how bad it was) this movie is the holy grail of awful movies.Acting is non existent, actors have absolutely no emotions what so ever, father acts as if someone is holding a gun to his head or as if he had no mind at all.Mother is supposed to be a sensitive woman, but comes across as more cold hearted than Hitler. Overall this is definitely the worst acting i have ever seen, i did not think i would find worse actors than Schwarzenegger in his debut as Hercules in "Hercules in New York" but this movie proved me wrong. I could understand Arnie, he had no idea about the language he was babbling........but these people......oh boy! My rating for the acting job = *FART* Special effects. Oh dear god! The goblins looked like they were made from feces, their faces looked fake and stupid. Special effects job seems to be done by some blind retarded teenager.Music, it seems to be done by the same sound-engine found on the very first Pong console.....bleeping and stupid sounds without any relevance to what is going on.The script? Jesus Christ! Who in their right mind wrote this? Or who in their right mind approved this to be aired?! I am 100% sure if i would throw some corns on my PC keyboard and let a chicken peck on it i would create something a million times better than this awful fiasco. The lines are so incredibly stupid, it boggles the mind! Once again you ask yourself is this supposed to be serious or just stupid? Watch this film if you want to laugh at something totally stupid and retarded. This is the best bad-movie of all times!

This is my favorite entry in the Troll saga, its the funniest one, and the most entertaining one, its directed by Claudio Fragasso, personally I love Claudio Fragasso movies, they are very entertaining and bizarre, his dialogues are some of the most memorable dialogues in exploitation cinema, but this I believe to be his worst movie, I think that this movie would have work if he would have been given a bigger budget, but there's only much they could do with such a low budget, I think this movie suffered from Fragassos decision to make the actors recite the script word for word, but maybe that's what makes this movie so funny, this weird, bizarre dialog and this awful effects, with amateur acting, or even some script problems. All of this is what makes Troll 2 be Troll 2, highly recommended, its amazing bizarre fun.

reviews.review_title: At least they didn't call it Gremlins 3
reviews.content: Why? I mean, how did this happen? Nevermind, I'n not even going to attempt to comprehend what I just saw, but I really do need to talk about it...At first, it seemed like a kids movie, and hell, maybe it is, more like something from The Disney Channel in the early 90's, but after the first few minutes of a kid having a conversation with his dead grandfather, it becomes obvious that there is something very, very "off" about all of this. Off how, you ask? Kind of peculiar? A bit bizarre? A mind-blowingly awkward sin against common sense? Yeah, that's the one. Troll 2 isn't just another bad movie with bad acting, and zero atmosphere, there's something else going on here. Anyway, Kid is being told a bedtime story, about goblins, by dead-Grandpa, come to think of it, that's what Troll 2 is all about... yeah!! Goblins!! Dead-Grandpa disappears when other family members show up, possibly because kid's acting is the only one he can stand, really, the other family members are really something special. Speaking of Goblins, they've tricked kid's family into temporarily trading houses with another family from a town called Nilbog. Well, nuts to that, kid says. Unfortunately, the family is quite keen on the idea, so it's off to Nilbog to hopefully, not be eaten by Goblins... yeah, Goblins!! And what about Troll 1, you ask? Well, what about it? I haven't seen it, I don't watch much mainstream. This practical joke on celluloid has nothing to do with it, whatever it is, they just picked a money-making title at random. In all my years of searching,Troll 2 is only the third worst movie I've come across. If you care, or don't believe me, or are just insane, check out Zombie '90 (#2) and The Chooper (#1) for experiences still not as strange as this one, but worse, nonetheless. Ultimately, I walked away from this one with a smile. Bewildered to hell and back, but smiling, because when the complete and utter shock wore off, I came to realize, I not only witnessed something too strange for words, but also, something too hilarious for words (almost). If you're looking for a new level, as well as a new type of badness, then this garbage from another dimension might be for you. How would one rate Troll 2? How am I supposed to know? I don't even know what the hell I just watched, so let's just let this one be.There are rumors of a sequel entitled Troll 2: Part II... I repeat, Troll 2: Part II. and in case you were wondering, Nilbog is Goblin spelled backwards. No, really!
I've never seen such art, such is Oscar worthy acting. I am swooped up in emotions that are unspeakable. This movie touched my soul.

reviews.review_title: Its so bad that its NOT funny
reviews.content: I have always loved bad horror flicks since they often turn out to be great comics but this is beyond that. ITs so bad that its beyond the line of "so bad its fun" line. I have wanted to see this for quite some time and now I am just speechless. I honestly wanted to cry while watching this horrible, dreadful and obnoxious movie. If you can call it a movie that is. Its about a family played by very bad actors (Espically the teenage daughter who always laughs..) wanting to go for an vacation in Nilbog to escape the grandpas death. Along the ride comes the daughters "boyfriend" and his friends. Although they don't go in the same car since ht egirls is upset since her boyfriend liks to spend time with his friends. Controlling freak. Anyways the disturbed boy sees his dead grandpa in his head which tells him that its a baaad and evuuul place and that he must stop them. But of course the family doesn't listen because its a retarded movie. At Nilbog they meet the family they are meant to switch houses with. The family is typical redneck stereotypes and just stare at the family (and laughs, not because its in the script but because they are lousy actors) and pushes them away. Very awkward scene. He claps his hands and the family "freezes", although they sure blink, grin and shake a lot to be frozen. Boy pees on food to stop them. Hes such an hero. The dad takes him upstairs and hreatens him with a hunger strike and beating. This was in the 90s and still his dad threatens his child? weirdo. And from now on its goes waay downhill. Not because it was good before this but its even worse. Please don't for the love of God watch this movie it will kill all humanity.

This is probably the worst movie that I have ever seen which is saying a lot because i make a point to watch bad movies and find the worst. First off the plot was probably written by a 5 year old and a man who was on crack. At one point to defeat the monsters the kid pulls out a "double decker bologna sandwich" he throws it at the goblins which hurts them because meat is their weakness, that kind of idiocy sums up the movie.The story revolves around a boy named Joshua who has visions of his grandfather's ghost telling him about goblins. The kid's family meanwhile is switching houses with a family from a small town calledNilbog (Goblin backwards) of course this means that the townspeople are really goblins disguised as humans that they to get Joshua and his family to come to their town. the only way that the goblins will eat the humans is if the humans will eat a green substance that looks like cake that "chlorophies" humans, or turns them into a plant. The plot only gets worse from there, as the residents of Nilbog constantly try to get Joshua and his family to eat their food, while Joshua and his Grandpa's ghost try to stop them. Another big problem that I have with this movie is that it is called Troll 2, while the word troll is not used once in the entire movie. In fact it is about goblins. Maybe they should have called it Goblin, it might have made more sense that way. This is the worst acted movie that I have ever seen. The kid who is probably 7-8 yrs old is the best actor by far. It makes me wonder if the director spent all the film's budget on green icing (which there is a lot of) and was forced to make his own family do the acting.I think that my friends and I could have done better acting. The only reason that i give this film a 1 is because there is no .5 or 0. That said, if you want to watch a terrible movie and get a good laugh from it, this is for you. I laughed many times at the ridiculous plot twists, cheesy score, bad acting, and complete awfulness of this movie. On the other hand if you want to see anything that has the slightest semblance of a decent movie please don't rent this. And no matter what don't buy it.

reviews.review_title: Worth a watch if you want a good laugh
reviews.content:
I was wondering what all the fuss was about. This movie is okay. The effects are okay. The problem is the way the lines are said, and the reactions, or should I say, over-reactions. Looking at the director's info, I think it doesn't help that he's not a native english speaker. His dialogue might have worked in Italian, but translated to english, it sounds unnatural. And then his expectations of the actors, they're really over-actors for this one. Bizarre moments. Unexpected hilarity. I like the part where the deceased Grandpa says 'I'll distract them with this' holding a fire extinguisher. I'm pretty sure the fact that he was dead and is now alive will be pretty distracting, hahaha. The witch troll lady was a bit much, I found it really hard to watch her scenes, so I fast forwarded whenever she was on there.
This movie doesn't surpass The Room for quotable hilarity, but it's still a fun watch.

All Low-budget horror fans know/love/hate/despise/own/cherish this gem of crap cinema!! I will not argue the point that this is by far one of the worst films made in the world. Hell, the cast has admitted that in the past! But this movie has a sickening, seductive appeal to it. Every time it is on cable, I cannot pull myself away from it. Though I have seen it nearly 20 times, I watch it every time. My 6 1/2 year old daughter watches it with me. He doesn't understand that it's a piece of tripe, but she does laugh at some parts that, I assume were not supposed to be humorous. But at her age, she can even tell it's funny! This movie is like a car wreck... u have to watch!! "Nilbog spelled backwards is goblins. This is there kingdom!" How can you not love it! Though I do not consider this the worst film of all time. Manos: The Hands of Fate does get that honor, this is in my book a very close 2nd! Though I think it is awful, I will always be a fan of Troll 2!

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie ever made (or second worst)
reviews.content: My continuing search for the worst movie ever made has led me to Troll 2, but I have taken a wrong turn with this film. This is not the worst film ever made - it's not even close! For a movie to be truly bad it should have no entertainment value. This film was highly entertaining in its woeful attempts at acting, dialogue, effects. All the reasons mentioned elsewhere in the comments section are precisely why it is so entertaining. It does however deserve credit for Connie Young's performance, which is one of the worst annoying kids I have ever seen. 'It Goblin spelled backwards!' Also special mention should be given to the Goblin Queen whose eyebrows each deserve an Oscar. And someone Grampa's age should know better.So where do I go now in my search? 'Manos' the Hands of Fate!

reviews.review_title: Yes I Made It Through This Movie!!!
reviews.content: Troll 2 is known as the Father of horrible movies. Everything about it is so amazingly bad. The writing is horrible, the cast does the worst job at acting I have ever seen a cast do, the effects are awful, its cheesy beyond belief, etc. The film was made by Italians with Itlaian actors, but they decided to make it in English. That is why the delivery of the dialogue is so bad. The people saying barely knew any English. Its legendary for being bad, and I got everything I thought I was going to get and more out of this movie. It's an awful, badly made mess of a film that I'm glad I sat through and made it to the end. Now I just need to watch The Room and Manos and my quest of bad films will be complete.0 stars out of 4

reviews.review_title: The movie that end all bad movies
reviews.content: I've seen a couple of bad films in my life, but I never have seen a movie as bad as this one before. Troll 2 is the most painful movie that I watched in my entire life. This film is much worse than Attack Of The Killer Tomatoes, at least that film was funny. This one is SO BAD, it isn't funny.This movie is a HUGE mistake, After I watched this movie. I got sick for the entire week in bed because of it. This movie IS SO BAD, IT HURTS.Sorry Troll 2, I won't give you any stars. You just suck SO MUCH!

reviews.review_title: I have to tighten my belt one notch to avoid the pain!!
reviews.content: Sweet sweaty poopsicles (yes I meant poop) Alright this is the second best movie about a family exchanging houses with a strange farmers family so they can "live like peasant did a 1000 years ago" I can remember. Well I'm not sure how much of what it took them to come up with an idea like that but they never seemed to run out of terrible ideas. The "acting" is astoundingly soul rapeingly bad. Well the 8 year old is the only one you can't tell is reading his lines off the napkin they were written on. The dead grandfather seems to pop by whenever the hell he feels like it and does things like freeze time for 30 seconds so the kid can pee on dinner and will occasionally hand out Molotov cocktails. I'm not sure if they really thought they would make a good movie out of the idea that there is a town of vegetarian goblins run by a witch thing powered by a magical rock of power from stone hinge (spelling?). Vegetarian goblins of course won't eat you until you eat their green crap that will either turn you into more green crap or a plant WTF? Every once in a while you will catch yourself paying attention to the plot and you will start to cry. It's one of those movies that goes well with alcohol or anything mind altering.

What do you get when you mix bad acting, a horrible script, and a dozen goofy rubber goblin masks? Troll 2.  The only rule you must keep in mind while watching is attempt at a movie is: DON'T ASK WHY.  If you are confused, just remember that the actors probably were too.The first thing you must accept is that the title of this movie is `Troll 2,' but there are no trolls mentioned anywhere, just goblins.  The ONLY connection I can make from the first film is that people do turn into green pods.  The next piece of garbage to swallow is the idea that the family is taking a vacation through an `exchange program' where they switch homes with someone in the country.  The star, a young boy named Josh, has the weight on his shoulders of not only being the hero, but also being the best actor as well.  His mother, who seems to only have one facial expression, forces Josh to sing her favorite song (Row, Row, Row Your Boat) during the car ride to Nilbog.  The father is an idiot, and the teen sister delivers her lines as if she had just read them before filming the scene and then there's Grandpa Seth, the family ghost who tries to help them.  Trailing the family van is the sister's boyfriend, Elliot, and his friends to look for `liberated Nilbog girls.'  In one of her best lines, Holly warns Elliot `If my father knew you were here he'd cut off your little nuts and eat them!' Thank God none of these people had much of a film career afterwards. The family arrives in the practically deserted and oh-so-clever titled town of Nilbog and meet with the family who they are exchanging homes with. Right away, Josh recognizes that something is wrong and his fears are confirmed when he receives a message from the goblins written on a baseball (???).  The family sits down to eat food that looks like it has been covered in mold as Grandpa Seth appears to tell Josh that the food will turn them into goblins food and he will stop time for 30 seconds for Josh to do something.  Torn, Josh stands on his chair crying `I must do it!' while unzipping his pants.  The angry father carries Josh upstairs to deliver one of his great lines `You can't p**s on hospitality - I won't allow it!' and tightens his belt a loop while challenging his young son to a hunger strike.Elliot's friends (who he sleeps naked with?) head out one by one looking for food, but don't realize that coffee is the devil's drink in Nilbog.  Arnold believes that there must be `a logical explanation for all of this,' but the only explanation I can think of is that the script was the result of a drug-induced hallucination.  Grandpa Seth can stop time, but just can't seem to find Josh's room in the house, the father falls asleep outside the general store while looking at a cookbook, and Josh overhears the townspeople complaining about the `smelly bladders' of humans.  When the family is confronted by the townspeople with more Nilbog food, one of Grandpa Seth's solutions is - of course - to give his young grandson a molotov cocktail!  And what about Elliot's friends? Forget about them, it is obvious that the director certainly has towards the end.Of course, the best part of this movie is the end, which is fairly anti-climatic, but hilarious.  Afterwards, the movie pretty much drops off without much explanation to an even more `shocking' ending.  Amazingly enough, the director made this 93 minute fiasco seem like an eternity, but don't let any of this deter you.  If you love watching bad flicks, don't hesitate to run out to your video store now searching for it.  The entertainment you receive from the interesting love scene with corn is worth the rental fee alone.  In my opinion this one belongs right up there next to `Manos.'

After hearing about this film I went to my local cinema to indulge my curiosity. I had heard nothing but bad things, but after five minutes of watching this film I was worried that I may have walked into the wrong screening, because this is possibly one of the best films I have ever seen. In comparison to the film street fighter, this film is something of such greatness, that it could only have been crafted by God or some other omnipotent being. The acting was some of the best work I have seen since The Godfather and the screenplay was scary, witty and brilliantly written.I have seen the 'conventional' greats like Shawshank redemption and Creep, but no film can stand up to this thing of beauty.

this movie is amazing!!!!! if you want a high quality, family movie, this is the one you want it is perfect for a date, or family night it is a great comedy for all ages even though it is supposed to be a horror, it is a great comedy this should actually only be used to torture your friends Nilbog or goblin spelled backwards, my 4 year old niece could think of that and it doesn't even have trolls the goblins look like left over casserole and there are pointless scenes, one of them is witch turns hot and pops some popcorn from some corn on a cob although it was hilarious if it was supposed to be serious that would be sad

Having read the postings on "Troll 2," I put it on my Netflix queue figuring it's gonna be bad, but won't be a match for "Plan 9 from Outer Space," my fave piece of golden garbage. I was wrong."Troll 2" is not just bad, it's a total embarrassment to everyone involved. It's a fail of such epic proportions I actually wished I had a time machine so I could go back to when this was made and run onto the set swinging a baseball bat yelling, "Stop doing this! Go home!"Words fail me, but let me just describe one scene. A woman dressed like Elvira shows up at an RV in the woods. The guy inside sees her approaching ... on TV. She's carrying an ear of corn. He steps out of the RV and she starts vamping it up, showing her garter belt, licking her lips, etc. The camera zooms in on her ample cleavage. She tucks the corn into her belt and they go inside. She shoves him down on a sofa and crouches over him, waving the corn. "Aren't you hungry?" she asks. "I like popcorn," he says. She then puts the corn in her mouth and presses it against his mouth and says with a leer, "Then let's ... heat it up!" Immediately, buckets of popcorn are flying around the room.Everything about this movie screams cheap, stupid and amateur. Not a single line of dialogue rises above idiotic, the characters act by bugging their eyes out and the little trolls or goblins or whatever the hell they are can barely move inside their Teletubby costumes. It's capped with an ending of such jaw-dropping bad taste that you will fall on the floor laughing, especially when you hear the kid's final line and the reply it gets.Don't miss it.

reviews.review_title: watch with friends, but definitely watch!
reviews.content: Honestly, this one is a tough one to rate. Either it's a completely stupid movie with a dump plot, bad acting, illogical character reactions, -OR- it's a near work of genius of being such a stupid movie without making it look like it's trying to be a stupid movie.If it was a genuine attempt of making a movie, it's a 2. There is one scene where the the trolls (read:goblins) throw a party for the family that has a genuinely creepy feel that I think was intended. That alone takes it from a 1 to a 2.There is also a joke told in the movie that makes me think they intended this movie to be campy. If that's the case, then the movie is a 7-8 -- purely for that "so bad it's good" type enjoyment.I'm going to with calling this movie an 8/10 and definitely a bucket list movie that is best watched with friends and a fair amount of alcohol.

reviews.review_title: it IS the worst movie ever made
reviews.content: Ahhh what a treat to write this review so many years after i saw Troll 2!For the last 20 years+ whenever i have seen a bad movie i would always finish with "at least it's not as bad as Troll 2"...I remember the night i watched this movie, around 1989, and i had rented it from the local supermarket (VHS video tape) and was to watch it as the 2nd film of the evening (2nd films of the night don't have to be that good)...i watched about 10 minutes of it and the rest in fast forward, it was dreadful..So to spare anyone else having to sit through this rubbish, bearing in mind the local supermarket had closed by now and i didn't have another film to watch, i pulled the film from it's reels, took the strip of film and the case outside, poured lighter fluid on it and set fire to it...i ended up having to pay the supermarket 5 times the rental but it was worth it because i managed to talk the manager into not re-ordering Troll 2 again (i was a regular there)...I have never destroyed another film after watching it, none have been that bad, and i've seen some real bad movies...You know when you hear someone review a bad movie and they say but it's worth watching anyway because it's so cheesy? Well if you watch this movie, even if you are normally a passive person, you may sit there afterwards and think "hey it wasn't so bad" but for the rest of the day you will have this underlying anger at the 2 hours you wasted and fact that you were warned...Phew been waiting to tell someone that for 20 years!It's so bad, so very bad...

reviews.review_title: The most entertainingly bad movie after "The room".
reviews.content: When a family unknowingly goes on vacation to a little village inhabited by vegetarian goblins led by a plant loving witch, they will be hunted down by the vicious little creatures so they can be turned into green moss and eaten. When you combine a plot like that with some of the worst acting and dialogue ever put to film, you get a movie sequel that is so bad it's laughable. Furthermore, this ''sequel'' has absolutely no connection to the original movie, which makes it a mystery to figure out the reason why it was even named "Troll 2".

Watching this movie is the best way to spend an hour and a half of your life.  I tell anyone that hasn't seen it to view it as soon as possible, for it can only have a positive impact on your life in some way or at some point.  I recently spent two hours walking around downtown San Francisco, a reportedly "cosmopolitan" city, but couldn't find Troll 2.  I had to have a friend send me his copy.  However I was able to find it in Video Ezy in New Lynn, New Zealand.Embrace the film, the depth of the characters, the carefully written lines and of course the idea of a house switch with a family named the Presences'.I was introduced to this gem by my friends and could not ever begin to repay them for how they have dramatically influenced my life.Jennifer Aniston...ECK!!!  Don't you know we hate friends here in Nilbog

Right on kid! That'll teach em!  And maybe if it doesn't, you could invite grandpa back from the dead so he can shoot railguns and howitzers and other tricks he learned from his friend in hell, at the big bad goblins. ohhhhh, Troll 2 is the mother of all B flicks.  Intended audience?...uhhhh either "Rainman" or those two dudes from "Of Mice and Men."  The cover itself, makes absolutely no sense in relation to the movie.  "The original boogeyman is back?" Where?!?! I just see Warwick Davis and pals hobbiling around in Jo Ann Fabric baby pajamas with Walmart masks over their faces.  We also have the opening scene, which features absolutely heartripping suspense as Gunter the Nazi Postchild, gets jiggy with some random babe in the woods named Hildegard.  She gives him some Vegan concoction, spiked with acid, which transforms her appearance into something closely resembling an Ewok. Suddenly, Gunter finds himself consumed by tiny fury munchkins, all angrily bent on destroying him and conquering the world or something.  Really Really bad.  Every scene in this movie, sucks.  All the actors, suck.  It's really funny.  If you can find this gem at your local video store, save it for the next party.  Troll 2 is the standard for which all movies will rate themselves better than.

reviews.review_title: Best worst movie because of the background story
reviews.content: Worst movie I have ever seen, but once I learned the background story, I just had to go back and watch it again! The story makes it so much more fun to watch!The Italian Director and his wife wanted to make a "serious" movie about the perils of vegetarianism because they were outraged that some of their friends had become vegetarians.Filmed in Utah, the crew speaks only broken English at best, the only one who speaks English is Laura Gemser, a former porn star, who was tasked with extremely low budget costume design. So, the dialogue was translated from Italian into broken English and the cast, mostly Mormons who had never acted, were commanded to say their lines as written, even though they offered to correct the English.This info is all over the Internet and on Wikipedia.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I thought
reviews.content: Well I bought this film as it only cost me like £1 so I thought why not?, then I logged onto the IMDb and read all about this film and then I thought to myself hmmm maybe thats why not. But after watching this film maybe with my expectations set rather low I was quite surprised and I found this film entertaining if not really good, but then thats why we watch films isn't it? to be entertained. Yes OK the acting is appalling no doubt about that however there are some great expressions of shock on the faces of the "actors" I especially enjoyed the mothers look of shock ! All in all not a bad film I have seen many low budget films in my time and I have to say this is far from the worst, and almost good but not quite. Probably best viewed when intoxicated.

reviews.review_title: How is this not the worst movie ever?
reviews.content: The one thing i can say is that this movie stirred powerful emotions within me. Emotions like "longing for death" and boredom. This movie helped me realize that as long as hell does not involve watching this movie, my afterlife will be filled with joy. This movie is the black hole of cinema. If i scraped dog excrement off my shoe and put it on cellulose, it would have more value than this movie. The acting would have been better of 9 year olds had been reading straign from the script. Basically, the list of reasons why this is the worst movie ever go on and on... Next time you consider suicide and need an extra reason to jump off this cliff, lock yourself in a tall building with this playing incessantly. At least the movie isn't 2 hours long.

reviews.review_title: This is the greatest worst movie of all time!
reviews.content: How can a film so poorly written with such incompetent actors be so horribly good? Troll 2 is the story of little Joshua who is being visited by his deceased grandfather. His grandpa tells him stories about goblins. Of course Joshua's parents don't believe him. Joshua's family go on vacation to a little town called Nilbog. Any guesses what that spells backwards?The family is staying in a town full of goblins. Man are they in trouble. This movie is so incredibly absurd. It seems as though a child wrote the script. If I'm not mistaken one of the "actors" was actually a dentist. The funny thing is all of that makes this film so entertaining and it's what I would call the greatest worst movie of all time. I highly recommend it.

'kay, it's like this... Grandpa Seth comes back from the dead to tell his grandson Joshua Waites a bedtime story about goblins, which is really lucky because Josh and his family are going to spend a vacation in the deceptively-named town of Nilbog, in some other family's house. Along the way they sing mom's favorite song "Row Row Row Your Boat" and Josh gets out to pee but ends up talking to a homeless man instead, who is Grandpa Seth in disguise. His family have no problem with this. They are also followed by Holly's boyfriend Elliott and his two mates, who sleep in the same bed without their shirts on.Grandpa Seth stops time so Joshua can pee on their food. Sadly that's all the food left for them and they didn't bring any, so dad and Josh have to go into town the next day to buy some. Joshua accidentally stumbles into a church where the goblins look like people and try to make him eat ice-cream. Elliott's mate is pursued by goblins but because they are NOT people-shaped they can't catch him so they throw a spear at him. He enters the house of Frankenfurter's understudy Creedence Leonore Gielgud, who turns him into a tree. The other friend gets sick off vitamin A enriched milk and stumbles into Creedence's house but he can't move the pot his friend is in so she drowns him in popcorn by eating a corn cob with him. Or something - I'm going by memory and I didn't concentrate hard enough while I was watching this.Meanwhile the townsfolk (in people suits again) stand and stare at the Waites menacingly until they barricade themselves into the house. They try coaxing them out again by throwing sandwiches on the porch in a threatening manner. Joshua takes charge by performing a séance (he must have done a few of them) which involves lighting every candle they could find. The goblins chase them into Creedence's house where a rock from Stonehenge has somehow materialized. I think I've skipped bits. Do you care? Grandpa Seth returns from the dead one last time to give Joshua a triple-decker bologna sandwich which makes the goblins scream in agony when they watch him eat it. The Waites family kill Creedence and the goblins by concentrating on Stonehenge with their hands. Elliott becomes part of the family just for being there. There's a surprise twist at the end, because nobody expects something random to happen at the end of THIS movie. Academy Award nominations, sadly, did not follow.

Troll 2 is rubbish. Unbealiviable. It's so horrible and poorly done you must see it to believe it. There are many reasons why to hate this movie (or better yet, don't see this crap!) 1) It has NOTHING to do with Trolls. Only Goblins, there isn't even any mention of Trolls in this movie. Possibly it was in production of 'Goblins' but it was so awful they couldn't even distribute it with it's own name 2) NOTHING to do with the First Troll, which I found quite amusing. Like I said, there was probably not enough money from "Drake Floyd's" pocket that he couldn't make it unless he made this a crappy sequel 3) AWFUL acting. It's worse than a middle-school play. The acting is so laughable you won't believe it, I saw that most of the actors weren't really actors at all and those that were real actors were uncredited for being A PRODUCTION Assistant FOR THIS CRAP! 4) DREADFULLY Hideous cinematography. It's constantly shaking and it gets SO annoying AND STOOPID, (a word to describe the entire film) 5) It's so gay, literally. The Grandpa's burning in hell and the older sisters' 'boyfriend' has homosexual friends that are into 'group bi-sex' 6) The music is...oh dear, it gives you the worst mood in the worst way Avoid this movie. If it's on TV, watch it only if you're BORED and I mean BORED. Overall it sucks and I can see why John Carl wasn't credited in this film; HE DIDN'T WANT HIS CAREER RUINED

reviews.review_title: Drew Carey or Clive Anderson: "Now do a film in the style of 'Second Grade School Play"
reviews.content: My header pretty much sums up my feelings on this film. The director must have been tone deaf among other things, or he was actually trying to make the worse film possible. The delivery of dialogue is almost painful to listen to, the mother especially.My friends think it's so bad that its funny, I just think this film is utterly vile, and for the most part unwatchable, I rarely have to get-up to get away from a film for purely its technical matters, such as dialogue, lighting and such, but this one is definitely one of them. The special effects are an utter joke, but some of the more observant may recognize the same goblin costumes from other low budget fantasy films, one of which was based on the myth of Siegfried, but the title escapes me at the moment. Watch at your own risk, some may laugh at the film's utter lack of merit, others may just cringe and squirm uncomfortably, unable to watch out of a sheer sense of embarrassment.

reviews.review_title: BWA HA HA HA HA!!! he-he he-he GWAH HA HA HA HA HA HA!!!!
reviews.content: I don't know why everyone else says this is the worst movie ever made. There's no way!  This is clearly the SECOND worst movie ever made just behind "Manos: The Hands of Fate."(spoilers)  (like it matters)That having been said OH MY GOD!  I find it difficult to believe that this movie was actually made by adults!  There is just no way anyone over 12 could have concieved of plot devices so incredibly ludicrous!  "Family exchange program"??!!?? What the hell is that!!??!! And why doesn't anyone find the food that turns you into Goblin food (that's right Goblins! No Trolls here!) strange?  Oh! green corn on the cob with green butter and a big glass of unrefridgerated green milk!  My favorite!  Who can leave out the special effects?  Oh where do I begin!!??!!  For some reason the goblins seem to be very fond of burlap sacks and work gloves because that's what they all wear and apparently their normal goblin faces aren't scary enough so they all have on $2 Halloween masks from Wal-Mart.  I'd say the special effects that went into the box cover were much better than any that appeared in the actual movie.  The cover has a kid on some stone stairs being menaced by a large werewolf looking monster carrying a huge battle axe.  Nothing from that cover (including the kid) appears in the movie!Now that I've said all that I would like to say SEE THIS MOVIE!  It is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen!  Not good for the people who made it since this was supposed to be a straight horror feature but good for the audience!  Mystery Science Theater 3000 never had it so good! (with the exception of the aforementioned Manos)  The whole thing is one long SNL lampoon of horror movies! (but it wasn't supposed to be)As a movie .2 out of 10, for being fun to watch an 8!

While certainly not the worst movie ever made, this is pretty bad. But, in a good way. You'll get a lot of unintentional(I assume) giggles out of this film. It struck me as less of a horror film and more of a bad episode of Goosebumps. Now, already not being a fan at all of that series, this movie has enough naive charm to oddly enough warrant more than one viewing. That being said, you should watch this film first, before the original Troll(and by now, I'm sure you've learned the two movies have nothing in common), if you have young kids, maybe 6 or 7 years old. Then, while your kids might be scared by a few goofy masks, you can laugh with your mate over the moronic dialogue.And, overall, it's the dialogue that makes this movie fail. There are other issues, such as poor actors and bad effects, but lots of movies have that against them. According to the film trivia(and if you merely look at the names of the film crew), almost the entire crew was Italian, whereas the actors are American, so besides the language barrier, the director demanded the script be read verbatim. And whoever wrote this script must have been about 17. I think this movie could have easily garnered a 4 out of 10 from me if the dialogue was a little more realistic, even if the delivery was still just as silly.The oddball plot involves a young boy who has visions of his grandfather, Seth, who died six months prior to the start of the story. His parents repeatedly tell him that there is no way he could possibly see Seth and to drop the issue. Seth constantly warns the boy, Joshua, about being on guard against goblins(Goblins is the original title of the film and certainly more appropriate--there are no trolls at all, if you care). In a strange turn of events, Joshua's family is supposed to "trade homes" with a farming family from a town called Nilbog. However, after arriving in Nilbog and meeting this other family, we quickly learn that not only is this other family a goblin clan, but the entire small town is goblin-kin as well. And, as an important plot point, goblins don't eat meat--they use special foods to turn wayward travelers into gooey green plant material they can consume. Now, you've probably seen several of the "best parts" already online in small random video clips, but they are no less spectacular when viewed as intended. So, after the whole family realizes what's going on in Nilbog, and after Seth appears a few more times to help out, Joshua eventually helps his parents, sister, and sister's beau escape from Nilbog by using a baloney sandwich against the goblins. Yes, you heard that right.Hailing this as the worst movie ever does it a severe injustice, and it also shows you probably haven't seen very many really terrible movies. Most people don't seek these films out, they have the films thrust upon them by friends or relatives with a sick sense of humor. I think with the moderate success of the original Troll, lots of people were apt to see this one as well(a rather smart move on the part of the distributors). Troll is also a great children's fantasy/horror flick with cheesy, albeit acceptable acting(Blue Cheer, anyone?) and lots of special effects. By watching Troll 2 first with the kids, you set up for watching Troll maybe a year later. I think both films could potentially give your kids some scares, but Troll 2 will definitely leave you rolling. I'd rather watch it again than be forced to sit through some of the garbage Hollywood allows to be heavily promoted on TV and given theatrical releases with big name actors. I've seen lots of trash films, and 2 stars is a pretty low rating--I don't hand out low ratings like candy--but I still recommend it for the daring.

Troll 2 was a good movie.  I don't really remember much from it, but I remember that it was so good.  I remember seeing it back and march of 1995. I do remember the ending though.  The ending is so good.  This is one of the best b horror movie(straight-to-home video movie) that was ever made. Watch it and take note.

No matter what kind of day I'm having or what mood I'm in, this film makes my day that much better. It makes perfect sense why this has become a cult classic. There are movies that are so bad that it's bad, yet this movie is so bad that it's good. The highlight performance is George Hardy, the man who plays the kid's father, his acting skills are amazing. The dialogue is laughable, rather than painful, and it's hilarious to see how inconsistent Holly's character is, especially around Elliot.The story revolves around a little kid named Joshua, who is forced to move to Nilbog with his family. Along the journey, his ghostly courageous Grandpa Seth (also my name!) saves him from getting eaten by the goblins. Yes, these goblins are vegetarians and they turn people into plants before they eat them. I swear to God that I'm NOT making this up. Everybody knows the "Oh My God!!!!" scene, even if you haven't seen the movie.What makes this movie work is how unintentionally funny it is throughout, which makes it so entertaining. The goblins are anything but scary and try to watch this as a disastrous comedy as opposed to watching a terrifying horror film. Bottom line, this movie is fantastic and I can watch it numerous times, without getting tired of it. Just enjoy it for what it is and don't take it seriously, you'll thank me later!

reviews.review_title: The best worst movie of all time
reviews.content: This is the worst movie of all time. This movie is so bad, that I questioned what I'm still doing on this planet. This movie is so bad, that it actually good. I couldn't stop laughing for 2 hours at the terrible plot, acting, and everything else in this movie. First of all, the movie isn't even about trolls, its about goblins... The entire concept is just ridiculous and makes absolutely no sense at all. I feel like whoever came up with this idea had a stick shoved up his ass all the way to his brain or something. Something that made it so he couldn't think straight, because this movie was so bad, that it gave me cancer. I lost intelligence from watching this movie.However, you should watch it. Why? It is so bad that it actually happens to be the funniest movie ever created. You will laugh more at how terrible this movie than you have ever laughed at any other comedy movie. I can't even describe how bad it is, you just have to see it.

reviews.review_title: The best movie ever made....by humans
reviews.content: When I first stumbled upon Troll 2, the box itself looked ridiculous enough for me to watch the movie.  But after watching, I discovered that what was on the cover of the box had nothing to do with the film.  The little boy on the cover wasn't even the right boy from the movie.  I also discovered that what was inside the box, the movie, was the best film EVER.  If you ever want to see acting at its finest, acting that will make you re-examine your life, acting that will make you see the world for the first time, watch Grandpa Seth deliver words of advice from beyond the grave to little Joshua. It was delightful.  No, it was brilliant.  No, there is no word to describe its perfection, so I'm forced to make one up, and I will do so right now. This movie was scrumtrulecent.  This movie was a blinding, brilliant light from heaven.  Watching this movie is like staring into the face of god, and seeing him looking back and smiling, saying "you are my most wonderous creation."  I am born anew in its genius.  So, go do yourself a favor and buy, or rent, the greatest movie ever made...by humans.

Yes, this movie is the best bad movie ever made.  This is probably the only bad movie that would be rendered less funny if produced for MST2K.  Almost all of the reviews posted here are dead on(aside from those written by people who didn't enjoy the film...those who need to take a physical), but i felt compelled to write a review of my own because no one has yet mentioned my favorite line from the film:"They're eating her.  And then they're going to eat me.  OH MY GOD!"I do not feel, however, that any schmo with a camcorder could make a film of equal entertainment value.  It takes more than just lethargy and poor planning to make a movie this bad...you truly have to lack any sort of talent whatsoever.  Only one person could have made a film this bad; and, I'm afraid, he was born to do so.

What the fwhat was that?I like bad movies, but a funny ones. Like "The Room" (2003). Or "Birdemic: Shock and Terror" (2010). And I thought that this one will be like that. Total trash. Nothing funny, nothing interesting, complete failure, I don't even know what the creators thought. Is it a parody? No. Is it horror or something else? No. Is it a bad movie? No, it is a complete garbage.And why would you use the name of this film as a sequel to the original "Troll" movie? I don't think that's fair, it has nothing in common, just pure marketing.Final Score: 2/10.

reviews.review_title: The Original Boogeyman Is Back? My, How He's Changed!
reviews.content:
If you're gonna make a movie called Troll II, what should it be about? Trolls, right?  Well, this movie strayed from the ordinary (the movie features goblins, instead), but I applaud that; it's not every year a movie as unique as this comes out.  Troll II contains some unforgettable scenes: the popular dinner table set piece, Grandpa Seth's lesson in fire-starting, the priests' sermon on meat, etc. Also, entertaining characters such as the child hero Joshua, his deceased-but-back-to-save-the-day Grandpa Seth, Creedence the local witch, the sexy Holly, the air-head Elliot and his boys, the generous Sheriff Gene Freak, Grandpa Seth's friend who used to live in Hell (whom, by the way, taught him a very useful trick), and of course the goblins themselves. 
The films' use of foreshadowing is, also, very effective (eg, On the way to Nilbog Diane exclaims, with sandwich in hand, "Speaking of hungry, WANT SOME ,JOSHUA?".  Also, look for the big bowl of apples in the middle of the table during the dinner scene).The above may sound silly, but it's different and in every respect of the word:  FUN!  While being a clever spoof, the film also provides chills of it's own; younger viewers beware.So, if you're watching Troll II and find yourself saying "I can't...I can't move(!), why?", it's probably because you're having a good time.
This is simply the worst movie ever made. There's no trolls in this movie, just goblins. This movie definitely gets my vote for the worst movie ever made. I gives this film 0 out of 10

Ok...I didn't know this was credited as a the worst film ever when I got it on a double bill with the first film (Which was poor but watchable) As I type I'm just over 15 m in and what can I say...Awful acting and dialogue, direction fits the acting...And as I type this the freeze wobble/piss on table scene has just played...Will I last the full film...Doubt I'll be arsed to report if I do.

Yes I really did watch this! I've seen only a few scenes of the first Trolls movie, but really this does not qualify as a sequel in any way. Heck there are no trolls, they're all goblins spelled backwards! Wow everybody was right about how ridiculously bad this movie is!
The plot makes Twilight look like Godfather (Yes I really did say that)
The choice dialogue is bonkers
The character actions are mind boggling!
Most of the actors are either over the top or not trying at all
Music is repetitive all throughout
Lamest confrontation ever
Biggest "What the heck!" ending ever!This movie makes me want to study the writers and analyze what they could have been thinking when designing the script. Every scene has at least 5 things wrong with it from horrendous acting, repeating words twice in the same sentence/paragraph, the timing, the "action", the character choices, just everything!! I don't even know how many stars to give this thing, because it's somehow the best worst movie I've ever seen in my life; somehow topping The Room! As a storyteller, it's painful, but this movie forces me to drop that instinct and laugh the whole way through!

reviews.review_title: Awful to watch, but that's what makes it good
reviews.content: For the B movie fans, there are films to watch, and there are "films" to watch. This movie falls in the later. Having become a b movie fan earlier this year, I made it my goal to watch a majority of the "bad" films that exist. This not included garbage made today, I'm talking about 90's and earlier. Over the course of last year, I learned of the films from some people on a forum on another website. Claim it as the best/worst film ever made. They consider it to be the best bad movie of all time, even greater then the cult favorite Plan 9 from outer space.The basic plot of the film is that this family goes to another town for a vacation called Nilbog. The town is completely made up of religious vegetarians who love milk for some reason. It turns out that the entire town is made up of goblins hence the name Nilbog which is actually Goblin spelled backwards.The plot itself is just so bad. The actors and actresses are bland and are overacting at many parts of the film. The whole idea of how to beat the Goblins is just goofy in itself. The film itself has NOTHING to do with the previous film, so if you have seen the first film, and expect to see the 2nd film deal with more Trolls you would be disappointed.The film is bad, but there are worse films out there. Trust me I have seen some of the films that are worse than this and it makes Troll 2 look like a blockbuster hit.Overall if you enjoy b movies or bad movies, then this is your film. If you hate bad movies, then avoid it at all cost.

reviews.review_title: The definition of so bad it's good
reviews.content: I watched this film with my family and we had a lot of fun tearing it apart and laughing at it. I can't think of one thing in this film that didn't make me burst out laughing. What's really funny as well is that this film was made by actual human beings. Human beings who looked at it and said "Yep. That's good acting, keep that in there."The acting is probably the funniest thing about this film. Never before have I seen a film with acting so bad, that every line they speak makes me want to laugh at how atrocious it is. It's a b-movie, I get that. But I've seen other b-movies that are leagues better than this. And the goblins (no this film isn't about trolls this time) look like a bunch of kids in Halloween costumes with masks from Party City.While there's some very funny moments that are trying to be scary, there's some outright strange moments that are trying to be scary. For example, there's this one scene where this woman is transformed into this green slime. And my first thought was just "What?" That scene wasn't even really scary, it was just gross.This remains the best worst movie ever made. If you want to watch it with some friends just to laugh at how bad it is, go ahead. You will sure get something out of that experience.

If you like bad movies, Troll II could very well be your Holy Grail. On top of that, it also boasts some of the most juvenile special effects ever put to film.  All of this combined makes for one of the most hilarious movies you could ever hope to watch.  It easily out performs most mainstream "comedies".The story (if you can call it that) centers around an imbecilic family who -- for totally incomprehensible reasons -- decides to move to a town that's inhabited by vegetarian goblins (as part of some bizarre "exhange" program). Along the way we get to witness: a witch who seduces a young teen with an ear of corn, goblins eating green pudding, a ghostly grandfather who has power over time & space, people being turned into plants, etc, etc.Well worth the rental price (only if you like terrible movies).I gave it a 9 out of 10 stars.  Priceless.

reviews.review_title: I was in this awful movie.
reviews.content: I actually played one of the trolls/goblins in this film, and I'm thrilled by the fact that it's become a celebrated bad movie. It's at  least as awful as everyone says, if not worse. When we were making this thing I knew it was going to be awful, and it exceded my lowest expectations.Incidentally, this movie has nothing whatsoever to do with "Troll". When we shot it the title was "Goblins", and at no point in the movie are we ever referred to as trolls. In fact, the make-up designer was quite offended by my comment that the masks resembled the creatures in "Troll". Obviously this is a ploy to get an audience for this piece of dreck.If you enjoy bad movies on an "MST3K" level, this is a great one. It doesn't get worse than this. I'm so glad the IMDB ranks "Trol 2" so low. It deserves it.

reviews.content: By far the Worst Movie Of All Time, which is why you must see this piece of garbage. This movie not only deserves the award for Worst Movie Of All Time but should also win the following awards: Worst Screenplay of All Time - Claudio Fargasso Worst Direction of All Time - Claudio Fargasso As the man most responsible for this stinker, he needs to be named twice. Troll 2 is one of those films that is truly so awful, that it has to be seen to be believed. I had heard about this movie for years, but never watched it until I caught it on Showtime recently. Basically, this family goes to the town of Nilbog (Goblin, backwards) and are stalked by Trolls who want to eat them. In order to consume humans, the Trolls force people to eat a substance that turns them into a green, slime-like substance that the Trolls can digest. Sounds interesting, right? Well, I'm not entirely sure how a movie this atrocious can get made. The acting is worse than any elementary school play that I have ever seen, the Troll masks are literally rubber Halloween masks from Wal-Mart, and the dialog is so corny that Orville Reddenbacher would be proud. It's a good movie to have a drinking game with (everytime someone says I wish Grandpa Seth were here, drink. Every time someone looks directly into the camera, chug). Seriously, you have to watch this at least once to see just how bad it is. This movie gets a definite 1/10.

When a movie transcends its medium and moves directly into the realm of "art", we call it a classic.  Citizen Kane, It's A Wonderful Life, Chinatown: there are numerous examples. INCLUDING Troll 2.  Yes, I'm serious.  It's easy to make a poor film or a boring film. Ninety percent of movies fall into these categories.  To make a good or great movie requires ensemble talent and a sense of artistic direction.  To make Troll 2, the producers would have had to know how to make a good film because they do absolutely everything wrong. EVERYTHING! This masterpiece rescued a rainy cottage day as I watched it unfold with astonishment.  It fails so miserably, and so bizarrely, that it manages to rise above its form.  Right from the start, the movie takes us further and further into the land of ludicrous, with side trips into insaneville and "what-the-f*&% is going on" city. To criticize the individual  elements (ie. acting, plot etc) would only deter from the whole.  Like a Beethoven symphony it must be viewed upon as a complete masterwork, the parts combining to make the one true artistic statement. Or, lack of there of, as case may be.A must see for all movie fanatics.

Pure cinematic genius.  The absolute greatest movie ever made.  If I'm not mistaken, it won several Oscars, including best spearthrowing in a film, best use of a bologna sandwich, etc.  The other reviews do a good job of summerizing the movie, but you would really need to see the movie to truly understand how bad it is. The dinner scene, the scene where the kid realizes Nilbog is goblin backwards(which happens after his dad tells him that people in small towns go to bed early in the afternoon, then proceeds to fall asleep on a bench while reading a vegetable cookbook), the scene where the guy runs (literaly) into town to buy milk but ends up eating a green hamburger and turning into a puddle of goo, they are all brilliant.  If you see only one movie in your entire life, make it TROLL 2.

So there! (its clearly the second worst film ever made!)

One of the most unbelievable sequels ever made, supposedly shot entirely without the knowledge or consent of the creators of the first TROLL film! At first glance a sub-Z-grade continuity abomination, this fine fine example of direct-to-video hysteria is a nonstop explosion of genius disguised as ineptitude. Grade-schooler Joshua is visited by the protective ghost of his Grandpa Seth, who warns him that his family's vacation destination of Nilbog (.) may be worth avoiding. But there's no changing dad's mind, and soon the whole family is knee-deep in black magic and nefarious villagers, including the remarkably abnormal `Sheriff Gene Freak'. Joshua and his dead grandpa are the only ones aware of their mortal danger, which Joshua at one point attempts to curb by urinating all over the dinner table. Not bad for PG-13. Worth noting is the fact that `trolls' aren't mentioned once in the film, while the threat of goblins remains all too real. In 1990, two great films were released in the United States, "Dances With Wolves" and the spellbinding "Troll 2".  Few films can come close to Troll 2, especially within the realm of direction, acting, plot, and cinematography.  This wonderful motion picture combines the dark, surrealistic elements of grand guignol and infuses them perfectly with subtle camp.   The performances of the two young leads may be compared to that of Humphrey Bogart and Katherine Hepburn in African Queen, yet never has a horror film seen such brilliantly realized characters.  I felt every minute of their fear and pain.  Never has such an amazing screenplay been committed to celluloid.  The reference to Nilbog, the mystical town hidden among the dark, ominous Utah canyons, symbolizes the shroud of mystery lingering over West Germany just before the Berlin Wall fell.  -SPOILER ALERT- And when it is revealed that Nilbog spelled backwards is "goblin," -END SPOILERS- everything comes together perfectly and the plot unspools as devilishly as in another brilliant feature, The Usual Suspects.  I suppose few have seen this wonderful gem, as it suffered a fantastically limited release (1 theatre), but I suggest to go see it when they release the fifteenth anniversary edition nationwide in 2005.   One of the finest, most heartfelt motion pictures I have ever had the pleasure to view, Troll 2 is highly recommended.  Invite all of your friends over to screen this film in the comfort of your living room, and tell them I thought it was a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: "D.U.D, oh my God, thats Dud spelled backwards"
reviews.content:
We can't imagine what circumstances lead to this movie being made.  Did somebody lose a bet?  Honestly, where did they find these actors, we have a few theories.  Theory 1 - These "actors" happened to send their "Win a Starring Roll in Troll 2" cards back first.  Theory 2 - The Casting Director stumbled through K-mart in a drunken stupor slurring "Who wants to be in a movie"  Theory 3 - when the budget got tight, the Director was forced to employ his babysitter, his paperboy, his hairdresser and his cousin in starring roles.  Theory 4 - these people didn't even realize they were being taped.There is so much wrong with this filth its hard to know where to begin. Lets start with the ridiculous plot.  The family exchange program was just ludicrous.  How hurting was this family for a vacation that they would agree to such a ridiculous idea.  The food issue was also a bogus idea.  The family didn't eat for three days and didn't even seem to notice. They also didn't seem to care that all the food was bright green including the butter on the corn and rolls.  While we're on the subject of food, we should mention a scene that should've been left on the cutting room floor.  I'm speaking of the scene in which the witch seduces the teenage boy with none other than corn on the cob.  The scene proceeds to have minimum wage stage hand throwing handfuls of popcorn from behind the camera. 
Now the sister in the movie's acting deserves a paragraph all by itself.  It had to be the worst display of acting ever, a few choice words to describe her performance would be - horrible, lurid, loathsome, appalling, nausiating, awful.  I think she would've faired better in a high school play that was thrown together in a week.  We also found it utterly annoying how Joshua and his sister referred to each other as "Big Sister" and "Little Brother".  Who talks like this?  It's almost as if the screenwriter forgot to proof-read or the actors were just told to make up their lines as they went along.  Maybe the writers just worked on the script during the 4 days that this movie was being filmed.Finally the costumes looked like something you would pick-up the day before Halloween at Family Dollar when all the other costumes were gone.  To wrap things up there were a lot of things just unnecessary with this film.  The gruesome use and abuse of green food-coloring and sweat plagued this film. The ridiculous scenes involving a bologna sandwich and Joshua urinating on the food were just plain stupid.  Without giving away the ending we can honestly say it reeks.  After watching this "movie" we had to take long showers to cleanse ourselves from the memories of Troll 2.

And you can't p**s on hospitality, I WON'T ALLOW IT!" and "They're eating her ... and then they're gonna eat me ... OH MY GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD!" Right up there with SNDN2's "Gar-bage day!" The movie is about a kid named Joshua (Michael Stephenson) who is warned by the ghost of his Grandpa Seth (Robert Ormsby) about goblins whose favorite food is half-human, half-plant. Joshua's parents, Michael and Diana Waits (George Hardy and Margo Prey), go on a vacation with him and his sister Holly (Connie Young) to Nilbog, which is goblins' kingdom. While there, Joshua tries to stop his family from eating their food (it turns people into goblin food) and getting them out of the vegetarian monster infested backwoods town.Go see it. It's so bad, it's actually worth your time.1/10 (as a horror movie) 10/10 (as a comedy)

reviews.review_title: Who needs logic when you've got "Magic" or "Goodness"!
reviews.content: Apparently a lot of people I know saw this when they were little kids, as well as I did. As a child this movie frightened me; I over-looked the shoddy costumes and acting. Also as a child you see this movie from Joshua's point of view and experience the terror of the goblins create because of their group-entity, and their powers of shape-shifting.This film can't really be a child's horror movie in the tradition of "Troll"; as the movie runs-on the viewer looks through the eyes of teenagers and parents. However, teens and adults can't forgive the movie's acting, background music, dialog, costumes, and plot holes-- not to mention how this movie just makes up it's own logic as it goes along (Ex: Grandpa Seth being able to freeze time, yet he doesn't understand the layout of the house the Waites are staying in). What's an even greater indicator that this isn't just a child's horror film is the infamous pop-corn scene-- a Witch transforms herself into a vixen and seduces a teenage boy, whilst brandishing an ear of corn; which also goes back to my other point about how this movie makes up its own logic: the viewer sees that she is broadcast on television inside a teens RV, complete with hot jazz background music; she asserts from T.V. for the teen to come outside, as he does the audience cannot see a sound or camera crew. Simply put, she can broadcast her image off satellites, directly into a camper because she's "magic". This is also the very same reason why she and the teen are able to make the corn on the cob turn to popcorn by biting it! Other logic I find confusing is when Joshua and the family are to destroy the goblins by just touching this foam Stonehenge (which supposedly the goblins draw their power from) this is because Joshua as explains that "only the power of goodness can destroy these monsters". So I guess I'm supposed to assume this "goodness" can be manifested from human beings which can radiate "goodness" from the very pores of their hands? Okay, that just doesn't work. Maybe little kids would forgive that, I dunno who else.One of the major flaws in this film like other Joe D'Amato films, is that it doesn't know how to cater to a diverse audience. The positive side of this, is that people such as myself look back on viewing this movie, and remember how ridiculous it was, and decide to rent it fifteen-years later and die of laughter!

The fact that this film is hailed as a cult classic and a trashy comedy is as baffling as the fact that this Italian director skipped learning America's native language before filming in America. The money I spent on candy at the store one time is probably more then these clowns had in their pockets to fund this freak show. In conclusion, the green devoured by the silly creatures inhabiting this film should have been green invested in a better, more competent idea.

I WISH.What really happens is rather subject to one's state of mind when watching the film.When I watched it, it was painful to sit through. Of course, it left an indelible stain on my memory. Kinda like a cattle brand on my brain. These kinds of movies, once watched, will never leave you. They haunt you to your grave.Anyway, the story - good triumphs over evil, thanks to a baloney sandwich and a bunch of people touching a rock (?) That's right. Even writing it now it seems ridiculous, but imagine actually allowing this movie to get made? That's the difficult part to understand. Pornos have better production values, sets, actors and scripts, for that matter. The story was as ridiculous as any get and the lines are memorable for their poor execution and their utter lack of impact. Take this gem from the annoying Joshua: "Nilbog! It's goblin spelled backwards! This is their kingdom!" Like we didn't see that one coming you little so and so...I will give this movie a terrible rating, 1 out of 10, but I do suggest people watch movies like this. That way, we can start to really appreciate better movies, like Plan 9 from Outer Space. The reason I think it's so abysmal and so great can be summed up by the looks on Creedence's face as she's taunting her captives... Or the overacting by Joshua and the underacting by his mother. The movie is like a 5 car-pile up, you know it's bad, but you don't want to turn away, even if there are little bits and pieces of people strewn across the road, and the screams of the children trapped in the cars will haunt you to the day you die...Terrible. Terrible. Watch it.

Either you get it or you don't. This is a difficult movie to rate, so don't let the Six out of Ten stars fool you. This is one of the movies that I enjoy more than any other, no matter how many times I see it. My subjective self wants to give it a Ten on the basis of pure satisfaction in the movie watching experience. Objectively however, this movie does effuse some of the worst... let me scratch that. I can't say worst, because I genuinely love everything about this movie, so let me just say that it displays some of the most nonsensical writing, acting, music, effects, etc., etc., in film history. One individual from the documentary Best Worst Film sums it up perfectly, basically saying that what makes the movie so enjoyable is precisely that it is so bad, but that it is still so obviously pure. The movie was not made cynically, or just to turn a quick buck. The people involved actually believed in what they were making. This movie, for me, is along the same lines as Jaws: the Revenge, Escape from New York, or They Live. It goes so far past bad that it become good again. Truly good. And one of the most absolutely entertaining cinematic experiences you can possibly have.

Oh my God, this movie is so horrible!
