Seriously, the movie's called "Troll 2" yet there are no trolls, only goblins.... wait, not even goblins, just a bunch of midgets running around in burlap sacks and bad Halloween masks while carrying big sticks they pass of as spears! I usually give movies a chance before I judge them, but the opening sequence killed it for me! Okay, here's what's going on. I'm going to save you the trouble of watching this film. In the opening sequence, the main character, Joshua is being told a story about goblins and how they like to eat people that are turned into plant things (what?) by his Grandpa Seth, who's obviously reading the script instead of a book. Then, the emotionless mother comes in and the grandpa's gone. Gasp, he's been dead for a while and the kid's insane! As the mom goes to comfort him, she says stuff like "Banish him from your mind. His death has been hard on us, especially me, his daughter." That's nice. We kind of gathered that he was your dad, since his last name's Seth and yours is Waits. Stupid people. Anyway, the family's going away to a town called Nilbog (if you don't get what's going on, you're probably dense or illiterate) because of a family transfer thing or whatever. Anyway, the sister, who sounds like grade-A crap yells at her more than likely homosexual boyfriend about him being with his friends more than her. Then she invites him to come with her to Nilbog, even though the Dad hates him. STUPID! Big whoop, where does it say that a guy can't have friends and still have a girlfriend? Wait, that's right, this guy takes his friends to bed with him. Back to the "movie," the family goes to Nilbog the next day while singing "Row Row Row Your Boat" off key. Speed through this if you want.For the rest of this review, I suggest going to my Greatestjournal, look for Gemini Drake.

reviews.review_title: No where near as bad as others say,
reviews.content: I am a major fan of B movies, you know, poor acting and directing. I have always been a Troll fan even though it is really corny, but good. After many years I finally watched Troll 2. I first went to IMDb to see the poor ratings, but now with the Internet, I could watch the movie Online for free (and legal). I was surprised that the movie was Actually enjoyable to me, in a funny way. I am sure that the producer knew that this was probably below a B movie. Either way. I liked it. If you do not like it, just ignore it' it is not hard to ignore things you do not like, you have a remote! But if you must watch it, all 94 minutes of it. Drink a beer or maybe a six pak!

I just came here for the comments section, as I am currently watching Troll 2 as I type this. I'm only 15 minutes in and the acting is so bad, I feel like there's supposed to be a punchline after every line that just doesn't come. Even with no punchline, it leaves me laughing.
I usually can get over bad acting, but not this time. I'm so intrigued to see how "deep" these characters get that I'm actually going to continue watching.
I just know there's going to be a huge payoff moment whenever they realize that Nilbog spelled backwards is Goblin. I can't wait!

reviews.review_title: Michael... Who are the Goblins? ... THE GOBLINS?
reviews.content: So unbelievably bad its great! The acting was painful. I had to watch more to see how this thing can turn out. I could have made a better movie with what they had. I think the cast was having a great time since no one knew what was going on which you could tell when this was made. It had many random scenes which made no sense, like the dance sequence which has nothing to do with anything. The corn seduction, which again has nothing to do with anything. All of these things made this movie so awesome to watch. You cannot help yourself to watch till the end. The most annoying thing was the magic Grandpa Seth who is like a fairy for little Joshua. Again another thing that doesn't make sense. "Joshua, sing me that song I love" Oh My God! This is some classic stuff. This movie tickles you in everyway possible, which you don't see much of anymore. This should be in the comedy section since it was made with the intention of being serious but turned out to be a huge comedy. Priceless! 1 out of 10 since its an awful movie, but 10 out of 10 for extreme goofyness.

This was a pretty funny movie. I remember watching this once when I was bored and the first time I saw it, it seemed extremely low-budget. I remember a girl was supposed to be "turning into a vegetable" or something and it just looked like they layed her naked and put green slime all over her and some midgets came out wearing masks and started to "eat" her, or in this case, scooping the slime off her. Who knows? Maybe they were cleaning her. ;-) The deal with all the food causing people to turn into vegetables was just silly. And a lot of the acting seemed wooden, like it was as if they hadn't rehearsed what-so-ever and showed no emotion in their parts.I'd watch it again if I was feeling depressed. :-)

reviews.review_title: This is absolutely the worst movie ever made.
reviews.content: Forget Manos, this is the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life. The only reason I rent it is to prove to others that it is the worst movie ever made.  Sometimes when I get in a real masochistic mood, a friend who thinks he or she knows the worst movie ever made and I have a contest.  I've won every time, although "Going Overboard" with Adam Sandler is a *very* close second place.This movie has no redeeming qualities whatsoever.  The acting is worse than a small high school play production.  The costumes are awful.  But the script is the worst part.  I can't imagine what the hell they were thinking when the authors put lines in the script for the small kid such as, "They're monsters!  Hideous beings!" or "You're a genius, big sister!"  I actually feel embarrassed for the actors' families who have to deal with the fact that their son or daughter acted in this awful, terrible, awful movie.I can't imagine what Troll 1 was like, but it can't be worse than this.

reviews.review_title: A bad movie you'll love to see over and over.
reviews.content: There are two things I ask for from a movie. A good time and and ability to stand up to repeated viewings. This movie does both. It's hilariously awful and a treat to view again and again. Especially if you have edibles at hand that resemble green goo.

I was recently diagnosed with AIDS. I was depressed, scared and lonely, then a friend turned me on to the homeopathic remedy known as "Troll 2". You simply watch this film one time, and it is such a wonderful film that the AIDS just goes right away! "Troll 2" is the best movie ever made, if you don't believe me you need to see it. If you see it and still don't agree you might be insane! But its OK because this movie also cures insanity. This movie is better than Jesus, in fact "Troll 2" is God. Yes, you heard me right, "Troll 2" is God. Pray to the film, pray to "Troll 2" and you will live a long and eventful existence.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I've ever seen in my life...and I loved it!
reviews.content: I got this on DVD as a Birthday present for my sister as we'd heard of one of the worst movies ever made and since we have a habit of enjoying our time making fun of the movies we watch (even if they're good), we figured this would guarantee us a real good time...and holy freakiolies, did we ever enjoy making fun of this one.There is so much bad acting, terrible directing, even worse writing and unnecessary randomness that taking this movie seriously is completely out of the question. I can't really say much of the plot 'cause there doesn't seem to be one except for a family going to a creepy half- abandoned country village filled with creepy hillbillies who eat people who turn into green goop after eating their food. The rest is just a bunch of random hilarity and a subplot in which the dumb blonde teenaged daughter is completely clueless over the fact that her boyfriend is stuck in the closet...or is that intentional? Not important. Anyway, the movie is awful and I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for something to actually enjoy unless you're a fan of the robots of Mystery Science Theatre 3000 and enjoy making fun of bad movies as much as they do.

reviews.review_title: Ten Things Wrong With This STUPID Movie
reviews.content: 1.The acting sucked. 2.The dance sequence. 3.The father was a complete jerk. 4.The kid's sister is preppy. I bet if she broke a nail she'd have a heart attack 5.The mother was a mook. She was too weird and sad. 6.The little trolls, or whatever they are were fake as Santa Clause. 7.The green stuff was obviously large amounts of food coloring or paint. 8.The soundtrack sucked. 9.There was no pizazz. 10.The plot was as boring as clown shoes.Please I advise you do not watch this pile of rubbish. It has no originality. It has absolutely NOTHING to do with the original. I'm very sorry I even watched thirty seconds of it. the acting was as blank as a ventriloquist dummy's face. Their house looked like it was made out of paper mache. I love 80's music, but somehow they screw up the soundtrack. The sister probably needed psychotropic medicine just to make her shut the heck up. The father was a rageaholic who needed anti-psychotic pills as well. And in the end when the head honcho of the goblins was set on fire, he was wearing protective gloves as clear as day. And one final comment. This movie sucked and cast and crew need psychiatrists.

When I was about 7, I watched this movie, and it scared the living bejeezus out of me. No joke. I was terrified of the woods for months. I watched it again recently. I used to be a relatively intelligent man. You know how many brain cells I have left after watching this movie? One. He's all alone in there, and he's scared. His poor friends never saw it coming. However, the worst part is that being as the inside of my cranium is now an empty, barren wasteland, the poor fool can't even find the means to end his own miserable existence. Just him, and the horrible memory of ever single one of the 5,640 grueling seconds that his eyes were brutally raped by this film.Truly a masterpiece, showing what can be done with a home video camera and a steaming pile of crap.Update: At 10:45 p.m. last night, my last brain cell finally did succeed in ending his own misery.RIP Brain. Beloved friend and vital organ. You will be missed.

I am a huge movie enthusiast, and have been to film festivals all over the world. The cast and production quality of Troll 2 is unbelievable! It had me sucked in from the very beginning with a plot that was psychologically and esthetically unbeatable. You need not watch any troll movies before it because it was fantastically made as a sequel without having to watch a prequel! Good for the kids too! I showed it to all of my kids and younger cousins and the rest of the night, all they wanted to do was to help clean the house because they were so happy! I have watched it three times in a row because i am picky but i could not find any plot holes or anything at all wrong with this cinematic masterpiece. Michael Stephenson does an incredible job also with outstanding performances from Darren Ewing. By far the best movie I have ever seen...unbeatable.

reviews.review_title: Something of a cult movie, ' Troll 2 ' makes perfect late night viewing.
reviews.content: A sequel in name only, ' Troll 2 ' has nothing at all to do with John Carl Beuchler's 1986 fantasy flick.  It has none of the same cast of characters, is shot on a minimal budget and infact features goblins and not trolls, Joe D'Amato's emphasis here on horror and not fantasy.  But is it really all that bad?  Well the goblins may not be too convincing and the acting variable ( young Michael Stephenson the best of the bunch ) but it has an intriguing premise ( the disguised vegatarian goblins of Nilbog feed food to human visitors that render them edible ) and enough unintentional humour to keep the B-movie fan happy.     ' Troll 2 ' may not win any awards for excellence it does have it's fans and has emerged of late as something of a cult movie, perfect for a late night's viewing.

reviews.review_title: A true masterpiece of fantasy filmmaking
reviews.content: The moment I discovered Troll 2 I didn't really know what to expect but from the moment the video went on to the end credits I was enthralled by its amazing sense of invention.This was hardly your run of the mill bad horror film it was far better, it oozed greatness from its slimy Troll interior.I highly recommend it for a tongue in cheek rollercoaster ride of a movie.Troll 2 rent it, NOW!

reviews.review_title: A lot of crappiness about this movie made it funny.
reviews.content: OK, so obviously this is a super low budget crappy movie on which, it seems, the makers didn't spend much effort on. The movie is bad in that there are some really bad actors, there are super cheesy lines, and there are continuity and plot problems. The costumes and masks for the monsters are very poorly made and have fixed expressions, the events do not make sense in a 3rd of the movie, and the actors who try to sound scary or menacing look laughable. This is like something made by high school students who got their hands on good equipment and watched a bunch of decent horror movies.It is very easy to see the bad things about this movie because they are obvious but after having watched this film twice I see how there are actually very unusual good aspects in here. I think this film was purposefully made to appear like its a stupid cartoony kid tale but a horror movie in disguise. There are intentional and un-intentional dark humor jokes and there are some parts which are darn creepy. Also strangely there is a pretty decent soundtrack.I really can't tell if some of the jokes were intentional or not but seeing a kid who screams because he sees green goo and tree branches coming out of his body is funny and scary. Add to that a person who turns into some sort of green pie full of green paste who is eaten by the monsters. These things are funny. Or how about the creepy lady who comes to the unsuspecting family's house to offer them some cake when she makes a comment about Joshua's sister "appetizing! HAHAHA" and the mom goes "WHAT!?" A lot of that cheese is funny, trust me.On the horror side the creepy parts somewhat merge with the humor aspect of the movie. As ridiculous as it sounds but seeing someone be transformed into green good and then devoured by ugly monsters is darn creepy even if its a bad movie like Troll 2. The final scary/creepy kick comes in the very end of the movie so its worth watching till the end.Not all actors are bad in this film. I think the actor who plays the kid is a very good actor , he looked very genuine. The dad and the grandpa were also really good and interesting characters portrayed by decent actors.To me this is definitely a cult-classic, if you are interested in dark humor, bad movies, or like bad 80s horror movies you definitely must watch Troll 2.

Let's get real folks, about what a truly BAD movie is - a BAD film has lasting entertainment value, if only because we can laugh at it and make ourselves feel good in the process - hey, even I can do better than that! TROLL 2 is like HOBGOBLINS - hopelessly inept, bandaged up by blind elephant doctors hoping to salvage a useless mess. I doubt anyone ever intended to make it THAT bad.Ed Wood, however, is the Elvis of bad: he is the perfect storm of ambition, vision, ineptitude and outright dementia. From GLEN OR GLENDA to BRIDE OF THE MONSTER to NIGHT OF THE GHOULS and of course, PLAN 9 - how could anyone literally think what they were doing was good enough to commit to film? Paper place saucers? Cardboard cockpits? Wood is FIRESIGN THEATER all rolled into one - mostly because he truly thought he was making good films, albeit a few "short cuts." TROLL 2 is easily one of the most ineptly salvaged movies ever; but then, so is MONSTER A GO-GO.

reviews.review_title: They scraped this s*** out of the Nil-BOG
reviews.content: Well what can I say about this load of unbelievable ultra-corny horror film. Like Silent Hill, the genuine horror was amount of time I lost through watching this rubbish. This must have been thought up of whilst under the influence of mind-destructing substances.Where shall I start? I'm not sure if this film could be any more corny if one of the goblins said "you're about to watch a nice corn-fest movie" and throw fake corn and mutate into one of corny effect goblin plants.The plot is the film's best ingredient, but even for that there's not very much to tell. A family, which includes a boy with the world's weirdest hallucinations, goes on vacation to Nilbog which is a Goblin-infested town, as do some guys, one of which can only date the daughter if he stops hanging around with his friends. Everyone in the town is trying to turn these people into plants by tempting them into eating food with green gunk on them (now if you found this green gunky stuff on a cob of corn, in a glass of water and then on every food you'd at least wonder the hell why) and drinking stale milk. O-KAAAY. What's more, despite the title, there ISN'T A SINGLE GODDAMN TROLL in the film! In fact, there is NO MENTION OF Trolls nor does it HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH Trolls. You're more likely to find one in around the corner.Instead of wandering if there's a hospital, how about the family-or I should say everyone in the film-asks if there's an acting school in Nilbog, because is this possibly the worst acting I've ever encountered along with the acting in Going Overboard. I rather much agree with Justin Michels' comment about the acting. Unsurprisingly, I researched the actors in this have appeared in only a few at most or no other films. That's really all I need to say about the "acting".One really strange part of the film that'll stick in my head for eternity is where of the teenagers is with the green-plant-mutating-paint woman in the trailer holding a cob of corn with her mouth seducing the guy, and the guy says "I'd like popcorn" or something like that and then suddenly a load of popcorn comes in at them because of the woman's spell. RRRRRRIIIIIIGGGGGGHHHHHHT This film is extremely crap, corny, stupid, crap, and hardly makes sense. You should really Troll 2 avoid this film, or watch it if you want to see the weirdest and worst horror film ever.

This really is one of the worst "films" i have ever put into my disc tray, why do i put films in inverted commas? Because it really is one of the worst movies ever made, for starters one of the main characters was a local dentist, as if that isn't bad enough the whole film is barely acted! It consists of this irritating little kid who goes around yelling about his grandfather and goblins in the town of the family's holiday home, there aren't even any trolls in the movie! The makers of this mess decided to name it this in the vain hope it would succeed. And then there's the SFX oh dear the SFX, lets just say i've never seen more green jelly, (or jell-O to you Americans) in my time.The goblins are just small men in Halloween masks. The music is ghastly, there are so many mistakes in this movie it's laughable. It's dire. Good day. Don't watch this, please.

reviews.review_title: A movie that is perfectly awful.
reviews.content: What should a good film would have to offer? A good movie should have a good story. Actors that bring to life the severe moments are a must. A movie should have good special effects and costumes. They should have natural sounding dialogue. Good music that accents the atmosphere. More important than anything else though, a movie should entertain."Troll 2" starts in an instant with Grandpa Seth reading young Joshua a story to bed. In his story, there are goblins who can change form to make themselves resemble humans. These goblins would trick humans into eating a green sap, which would turn them into vegetables, because the goblins are vegetarians, and their favorite food is human vegetables. Joshua and his family were prepared to go on vacation to the small town of Nilbog. When they arrive, Joshua quickly discovers that the residents of Nilbog are goblins in disguise. Unfortunately, nobody believes Joshua, so it's up to him to prevent his family from eating the food given to them by the locals.I think it goes without saying that the plot of this movie is ridiculous. The actors make Hayden Christensen's performance as Anakin look like Dustin Hoffman in Rain Man. The special effects are breathtakingly cheesy. The goblin costumes are suitable, for those going trick or treating. The dialogue is about as natural as a person speaking his second language for the first time. Lastly, the music is shockingly upbeat, it sounds fine, but it completely offsets the creepy tone that the movie is trying to portray. This movie is very bad.Did this movie do anything right? Believe it or not there was one thing that was done well in this movie. The most important thing about a movie is that it entertains, and this movie is very entertaining. This movie attempted to be a creepy horror, but it became an amusing unintentional comedy. Every poorly acted moment is a burst of laughter. Every time I see those plastered on facial expressions of the goblins I laugh. I can forgive all other flaws with a movie as long as it's entertaining.This movie is truly the offspring of a bunch of bad elements that don't work being blended together into something that miraculously does work. People love to watch the Stay Puft Marshmallow Man wreak havoc on New York City. People also love to watch the poorly acted "Scooby-Doo" cartoon. When people watch old movies, they look for the wires that hold the UFO's up. People love to find imperfections, and are wired to love garbage. This is the perfect mesh of over the top ridiculum, combined with rancid acting, with corny special effects sprinkled on top. Everything offsets itself so perfectly, I wouldn't ask them to change it at all.I really did enjoy this film and it's many, many flaws. I actually would recommend this movie, not only to those who get a kick out of watching bad films, but also to those who love to laugh. This is a bad movie, but it's a guilty pleasure. This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen, and it was supposed to be a horror film.

reviews.review_title: I wish they would have ate m
reviews.content:
Having one of the most iconic bad acting scenes in cinema history couldnt help this turd. I was really hoping watching this for the first time it had more to offer. The acting is horrible as to be expected which I enjoyed. But as far being a great funny b movie it fell flat. By the end I was checking how much time was left and sighing. Yes this is one of the worst movies ever made but not enjoyably bad.
Word of advice just watch the iconic scene on youtube but leave the rest for the trolls. Not good bad by any means.

I remember this movie from when I was much younger...And I was ecstatic to see this movie released on DVD.  Everything about this movie is so bad, I absolutely love it.  The costumes (for the goblins, there are no trolls in the movie) look like used up potato sacks thrown on midgets.  The script is horrible, and I've seen better acting in Kindergarten plays (In fact, the best actor in this movie is the boy).  Watch it if you can honestly sit back and enjoy a movie for what it is really trying to be, EXTREMELY BAD.

Something indefinable has moved me to write this review. I don't understand and can't explain what this movie has done and is still doing to me. Words cannot convey this sense of foreboding I feel in the pit of my stomach.I guess I should give you some background as to what I'm rambling about.I purchased Troll/Troll 2 for the sole purpose of owning Troll. I had no idea what Troll 2 was or what it would eventually do to me. You see, I had seen Troll when I was around 5-7 years old and had relatively fond memories of it, so when I saw the DVD for sale I gleefully snatched it up.The strangest sensation overtook me then, a cross between dizziness and existential dread while razors danced in my stomach and my skin broke into a cold sweat. The feeling soon passed and I quickly tried to forget about the experience.Later that day I watched Troll expecting to relive a bit of my childhood. Well, the saying "you can never go home" held true for me. I found Troll to be an unforgettably, forgettable movie if that makes any sense. Completely disposable and not worth mentioning beyond this point.I watched Troll 2 the next day. My expectations were low, but I figured I might as well give the second movie a chance.My life would be infinitely better had I washed my hands of the whole affair and turned my attention towards other pursuits, or maybe not. Who's to say? Where would the world be if there had been no Bubonic Plague or if the members of the Beatles had never formed a band? My soul cries out for a "what could have been" but without the Plague mightn't the world be even more burdened by overpopulation, pollution and resource depletion? Would we have been able produce someone whose intellect would dwarf Einstein's? If the Beatles had never formed would some other band have been able to garner recognition left by the void of the Beatles or would they create what in hindsight would be considered puerile drivel?These are pointless questions that can never be answered. Time to get down to brass tacks.I cannot stop watching Troll 2. I have alienated friends and family members. I have become an outcast in my neighborhood and have been shunned by co-workers. What is worse, as each day passes, I find it harder to disassociate myself from this film. My waking thoughts are centered around it. My being has become enmeshed with its life force, and make no mistake...it is alive and it grows stronger with each viewing. There is no turning back. I have gotten to the point where I feel little remorse showing this film to others, addicting them, changing them, tailoring them so that they may spread the Gospel that is Troll 2. I'm slowly coming to the realization that this is not just weird gibberish that I'm spouting off. It's not cathartic and it does not ease my burden or put the last shreds of my guilty conscience to rest.Yes...YES! I have become drunk off the wine of revelation and I understand now. I finally SEE. I do not fear the outcome. I feel HER re-assuring hand on my shoulder. Watch Troll 2, such wondrous and provocative pleasures await you!

Got a camcorder and a few friends?  Chances are, you could do something better than this.  Skip this one and find something to do with an hour and a half of your life that you will never get back otherwise.  That is, unless you like watching bad movies and picking on them a la Mystery Science Theater 3000.  In that case, there's plenty of fodder for ridicule.

....When you think of it as a failed Seinfeld 'Halloween Special' episode with Jerry, Elaine, George, and Kramer dressed up in ugly potato sack bags and K-Mart $2.95 Halloween masks romping around some forest in North Carolina. But this film is something much worse and more sinister than that. That's right folks, this is the cream of the crop, the worst movie ever conceived by mortal man.The 'film' (can I even call it that?) begins with a Grampa horribly narrating a dull and pointless story, Princess Bride style to his ugly, whiny, and disturbed grandson, Jonathan. Peter Pan is venturing home from the woods when he gets lost and is chased by a mob of ravenous goblins (Yes, despite the film's title, this movie has droves and droves of goblins. There is NOT A SINGLE TROLL IN THIS FILM) set to a dodgy 1990 theme. This gets me on the vomit inducing soundtrack. It sounds as if an eight year old composed the music. Unfortuenatly, it also sounds as if that said poor eight year old was high off of something. Peter is then fed puke green slop by a supposed 'lovely princess of the wood' (although she looks like King Koopa, but I guess beauty is all in the eye of the beholder). He is then turned into a half man half plant creature. Apparently, the trolls, ooops, I meant goblins are vegetarians and will not eat any meat whatsoever. Although it might have sounded good on the McDonald's napkin it was written on, this feat is executed quite poorly as Peter begins to sweat green food coloring. Oooooh that's a great effect. I could have done better with colored pencils and glitter.The Mom interrupts this little soirée and gives a grating, annoying, monotone speech to Johnathan. It seems Grampa Seth has been dead for six months, but only Johnathan can see him. Perhaps a pre cursor to the Sixth Sense? Hmmmmm.....? We also learn Johnathan is one messed up kid as he rants and raves about goblins and the Mom blows his cover by saying 'Remember what the doctor said?" But don't let the Mom fool you, she is the worst offender of vomit inducing acting in this crap and that IS REALLY SAYING SOMETHING. And she is so '80's. Apparently, her favorite song is 'Row Row Row Your Boat', but since the title is so hard to remember, she just calls it 'That song I like so much'. The sister is pretty crappy as well. She delivers all of her lines with a smirk on her face. Perhaps she was high and realized what crap she was in, or she enjoyed the crap she was in. That aside, I hope the young actress who plays her took acting and dancing classes after she saw the way she was dancing in this. Maybe she tried to dance like Tiffany. The dad is by far the best actor in this romp (and that's also not saying much). It's amazing how all these actors and actresses in this movie can say their lines with straight faces.So the dimwitted family head to the fancy town of Nilbog (get it? To quote the movie: " Nilbog....is...goblin...spelled...backwads!") to switch houses with some hillbilly family out in the woods. Close behind is Holly's boyfriend and his....well.....friends.As soon as the family get to the house, they are greeted by the Addams Family who leave them food in the house. The retarded family sit down to munch on biscuits with green paste on it, steak smothered in green sauce, and corn on the cob smeared in green dip. Even if the stupid family thought it was wasabi sauce, it don't sound too appetizing slapped on corn on the cob. I guess this film takes place in some sort of alternate universe. Grampa Seth shows up and stops time for thirty seconds (hmmm...seems more like ninety seconds to me) so Johnathan can urinate on their dinner. You can say he rains on their parade. He gets his father quite upset, though.We also meet a witch who is so over the freakin' top that she makes John Voight's performance on Anaconda seem like Joseph Cotten's performance on Citizen Kane. She is from Stone Henge, but sounds like she is from Germany (accent included). And she actually (or the writer of this trash, your pick) pulls out some bull Stone Henge plot on us. What is it's significance? What does the Stone Henge have to do with goblins? And also, who really cares? She turns one of Holly's boyfriend's boyfriend, ooops, friend into a plant.The film finally comes to it's lackluster climax when the silly family are barricaded inside of the house and the goblins throw sandwiches at the house. Things get extremely silly when the family holds some sort of freaky séance and Johnathan ends up in the witch's liar. .the witch hoists him up (in an incredibly funny way. It's so obvious he's stepping on some kind of stool, which just makes me laugh every time I see it) and tries to turn him into goblin food. He is rescued by a double decker bologna sandwich. Then he keeps repeating to his family, "Only the power of goodness can defeat these monsters!" And they all put their hands on the stone and CONCENTRATE! Sure, I'll remember that one when it never happens to me. The family then return home and Johnathan's mom becomes goblin food.If you think comedy is dead, check this one out. It is all sorts of funny. The best thing about this movie is that it actually takes itself seriously. Nobody is laughing or smirking (except the sister) and it tries to pursue an aura of dread and desperation. Too bad it's so funny, you will laugh it off the screen of your television set. Have a few glasses of vodka before watching this, it's even funnier.

The best worst movie ever, watching with friends is an absolute joy. When you think this film could not get worse, yes it does. Its a downwards spiral of woeful acting, script, ideas and just about everything that makes a film good. When you can, watch this film, its an amazing experience as will literally never see a worse film. Some moments will have you on the edge of your seat, contemplating how this film was ever made and how this film was ever pitched to a production company. Tear jerkingly funny at some moments, and mind numbingly dull at others, the film has two sides. Even better, the film contains no trolls as the title suggest, but are instead replaced by crack head ewoks, who surprisingly offer a relative threat to holiday makers in the town of Nilbog. The main threat to this film however would be taking it too seriously.

reviews.review_title: The Way We Do TROLL 2 In Texas
reviews.content:
I've already sent a rather lengthy comment in for this film, but I wanted to share some TROLL 2 experiences that I've had.  This is the kind of film that brings people together in bizarre way, the kind of film that could end world hunger, the kind of film that kind of makes up for God putting Rosie O'Donnell on the planet.First of all, the first time I saw TROLL 2, I was about 13 years old, and I happened to catch it on HBO in the middle of the night.  After that night, I tried in vain to find anyone else who might have seen it, and I was a sad man.Several years later, a friend I hadn't seen in a long time and I got to talking about film-- the good, the bad, the ugly films, etc-- and TROLL 2 came up.  I had found someone else who'd seen it! I was a happy man.That year, that friend gave me one of the best presents ever: A dub of TROLL 2 from HBO, with an episode of Jerry Springer preceding it that dealt with the midget ku klux klan.  This happy man became happier.And, then, tragedy struck: One day, while my girlfriend and I were waiting tables at this restaurant, I received a phone call-- my apartment had burned down.  Sure, I lost all my clothes, my furniture, my electronic stuff, but most damaging of all was the casualty of my prized copy of TROLL 2. Things had never been bleaker; I was a broken man.But TROLL 2 and its legacy were not through with me.  Only three months later, my girlfriend and I had started over in an apartment in another, nearby town.  We moved in with a friend of mine, and on the first night in our new apartment my friend went up to the local mom and pop video store to see what he could see.  He returned with, of course, a new copy of TROLL 2. It even had the cover box, which features pictures of actors not seen in the film! We quickly decided that we would not return the film, as any late fees they could possibly charge us would be worth it.We moved yet again before the end of that year, and that's when my girlfriend and I started breaking in the masses to TROLL 2.  It started at a party, where I threw the thing on as background noise/something to make fun of, and from that day on, every time someone came over we'd ask, "Do you know about TROLL 2?"If the answer was "No", then they had to watch the film with us.  By that system, and ever since, I would say that my girlfriend and I showed TROLL 2 to somewhere between 20-50 people.  Before long, a drinking game emerged; People started to be able to quote whole scenes of dialogue from memory; Nicknames were given to favorite characters, and each of us had our own very special TROLL 2 character.My absolute favorite thing in the film is the Tr-- er, Goblin with the really, really fake looking mask.  You know what I'm talking about.  It looks like all the masks were made from papier-mache, and that mask was made with the leftovers of all the other masks.  It's the troll that's usually seen on the far right or left of the screen, the one with bulging eyes the same color as the skin on the mask and the obvious "eye holes" cut beneath them.  We called this Troll "Squiggy" (It seems highly appropriate), and every time he came onscreen everyone had to raise their drink and toast him, yelling "Squiggs!" or "Squiggy!" at the top of their lungs.I miss those days, as I've broken up with that girl now (we're on good terms, by the way, and I'm sure alot of that has to do with the bond that formed between us during such scenes as the "popcorn seduction" and the "Eggs? Blegh!!!" scene), and moved back home.  But the cockles of my heart were warmed (and my cockles aren't easily warmed, mind you) by the numerous posts regarding TROLL 2 on this website.  Squiggy bless you all!If you want to drop me a line about Nilbog or its denizens, write
Word, Dr. Scott

You can worship La Dolce Vita, Citizen Kane, The Seventh Seal and all the great films of the 20th Century, but can they really measure up to this? Troll 2 is the ultimate cinematic experience in it's complete disregard for anything that has gone before. The film pays absolutely no regard for cinematic convention, eschewing the tried and tested structural values of film-making for a pseudo absurdist approach that leaves the viewer disorientated and confused.It is in this state that one can draw all the cathartic and didactic meaning from this film: one the one hand, that nothing makes sense, so why bother living at all, on the other, wasting your time watching films of this nature will instill a feeling of 'Carpe Diem' and make one live their life to the full. The genius of Troll 2 is that literally every single line of dialogue has infinite meaning and none at all simultaneously. Your sanity, reason for existence and destiny are all questioned when watching this film, merely by assessing your own state while viewing.But this film is not just brilliant in a metaphorical and symbolic way, the events themselves allow us to question our own frail time on this mortal coil we call life. Take Grampa Seth's transportation through the mirror, a metaphor for the fear of death and it's importance in holding us back from what we want to do. Or Holly's dance sequence, highlighting the frailty of 'woman'. The 'trolls' themselves, goblins who look exactly like us - suggesting that perhaps vegetarian goblins lurk within all our souls. Perhaps the most important moment is the sweetcorn sex scene - the ultimate metaphysical erotic battle between vegetable and human in one scintillating image.The script of Troll 2 reads not unlike playwrights such as Shakespeare, or the poetry of Milton. It's multifaceted, almost impenetrable mask of mystique is T S Eliot's legacy on film, combined with the homo-erotic subplots associated with the Elisabethans in the form of Eliot and his friends experiences. The camper van itself is a symbol of youth and dubious sexuality, combined with milk based imagery later on we see the microcosmic journey through existence that is at the essence of humanity.Troll 2, in short, is the sum of our hopes and fears, what is to be human, depicted perfectly on screen. The final scene illustrates this best of all - for what sums up the fragility of existence more than the words, 'Do you want some, Joshua?'

reviews.review_title: Hilarious and unique vegibalistic horror movies
reviews.content: Obviously the director wanted to make a veggie/cannibal horror movie for children.  The notion that it's more tasteful to transform human victims into veg before eating them is quite clever and allows the director to show some quite intense scenes especially the Goblins final feast, which I thought was quite disgusting.   Acting, direction, special effects and script conspire to make this an unforgettable and very entertaining experience.

There is no doubt that this is a bad movie---yet this movie is still a must see. If only for the simple fact that Joe D'Amato (if this is indeed his real name) is one of the most prolific movie makers living today.  This does not mean he is a good director, just that he is able to accomplish something few ever will, make over a hundred movies that people actually talk about. Though most of his reviews are quite negative.There is a certain charm to Troll 2 that does not exist in far better films. For example--The way in which young Joshua saves his family from the feast evil vegetarian goblins have prepared for their last supper?
Not wanting to spoil... the plot simply put if you do not find evil vegetarian goblins charming, then Troll 2 is definitely not for you.
And you know it might just be that Joe D'Amato is making movies so bad that it inspires others to do better.  Maybe?

Where to even begin. There is no plot, music doesn't fit and it is terrible, and horrendous acting, if you can even call it that. Surprisingly, in the movie title TROLL 2, they do not even use the word troll. In fact, there are NO trolls in the entire movie, but there are plenty of goblins that all look exactly the same. This movie is pretty much like making a movie called Superman but having it star Spiderman, it just doesn't make sense. The scenes in it are just ridiculous. The town is called Nilbog (I honestly hope somebody got fired for this), and it is run by evil Goblins that want to eat this family, and that's pretty much all that makes sense. I do have a few questions of my own: 1. What does that German Goblin contribute to the movie? 2. Is the family that stupid that they're living in a town called Nilbog where the food all has neon-green goop on it? 3. Don't even get me started on Grandpa Seth. His character does not make sense at all. 4. The ending is eye-gouging awful. The scene I laughed the hardest during was when the father and Joshua go out to buy Nilbog Milk and the store is closed, so they decide to wait. The dad sits down in a chair outside, pulls out a Vegetable Cookbook, and starts reading. The scene cuts away to Joshua for less than 3 seconds, and when Joshua looks back at his dad, he is asleep. This scene is just insane. Words don't do it justice. I beg you, please don't try to be funny and give this movie a 10 without even seeing it. Once you see it, you will want to shoot yourself for giving it anything above a 1.

reviews.review_title: I paid $15.95 for this movie... on purpose!
reviews.content: I saw it long before I bought it. But who can put a price on entertainment value? I have but one comment..."I am tightening my belt by one loop so I don't feel hunger pains, and your sister and mother will have to do the same."

reviews.review_title: Fun story overall, but HORRIBLE ACTORS
reviews.content: I actually liked this movie. A lot. The only thing I HATED about this movie, were the actors. Holy cow. They were truly the worst actors I have ever experienced on screen. ESPECIALLY the mother. WOW. I was shocked that any of these people got hired for this movie. But I guess no one else would do it. Anyway. The plot is funny. The goblins are cool to look at if you ask me. I liked the story and the idea for this movie. The overall experience is that I liked it. It's definitely NOT the worst movie ever. The only thing I hated was the actors. Worth checking out for sure.

reviews.review_title: A movie with virtually no redeemable qualities
reviews.content: This movie is by far the single worse piece of film I have ever had the great misfortune of witnessing. Not only does it make "Troll 1" look like a work of art, it will leave you with the impression that you too can be a director if you have a bag of refrigerator magnets and a home video camera. If you are a bad film enthusiast, this one is a MUST. Highlights include large amounts of green food coloring, burlap costumes, severe acting, meaningless plot, poor sound, and a popcorn scene that will leave you feeling numb, insulted, and generally drained. If you have company you wish to get rid of I highly recommend playing this on your television. Keep it as an emergency deterrent.

reviews.review_title: Now do you Believe in Hell?
reviews.content: Some believe that when you sin and die, you go to Hell. Well there's no sin bad enough to justify this movie. Claudio Fragasso is the incarnate of Adolf Hitler and deserves to be tarred and feathered for the creation of this abomination. My only hope for the future now is that all peoples from all walks of life will band together and see fit to destroy this hellish cataclysm and smite it from the Earth, past, present, and future.This movie is the number one cause of wrist-slitting and various other forms of suicidal mutilation. To say that watching this film causes leprosy is a gross understatement. Everyone who worked on this movie and didn't submit themselves to daily brutal whippings from a cat-o-nine-tails as penance out of regret should be locked in a prisoner of war camp for causing a second Holocaust by helping this movie get made.Historically, the Mongols were able to conquer China just by showing the people there this movie. It bespeaks atrocity beyond linguistic and cultural barriers. Repent. Repent, for this movie is the clear sign of the End of Times. Claudio Fragasso is the Antichrist. Please, God, just let me die.

reviews.review_title: the absolute worst movie of all time
reviews.content: I've seen this movie 3 times just because I'm compelled by how horrific it is. The story, the acting, where do I begin. I have to say I actually enjoy it for the "entertainment value", or NOT. My kids and I laugh our butts off, and the only other movie that can compare to it is "Waxworks 2". I grew up watching "B" movies in the 50's , but I would classify this one as a "D", and that's putting it kindly. So I would recommend it for sheer amazement and disbelief. If you like this one you might like "Tourist Trap", and I just read they are remaking "Motel Hotel". I guess I often wondered why none of the cast in Troll 2 were never seen again. You know you're in trouble when your effeminate sounding father announces you're going to your "timeshare" in "Nilbog" I think Troll was better, especially the little toadstool/lampshade guy.

reviews.review_title: So bad on so many levels...
reviews.content: We actually own this film on disk. It came in a set with "Troll". One quiet, dull afternoon my son and I decided to watch it. After about 5 or 10 minutes I had to ask if it was just me, or is this the MOST poorly written, poorly acted, poorly shot, poorly directed, poorly produced thing we'd ever seen? I hadn't seen the other Troll film, but my son said that it was entirely unrelated to this one. We kept watching anyway, just to see if it could get any worse. I don't want to spoil it, so I'll just mention that it slowly crept to the bottom of the barrel with pace and content and dug itself into the slime when it became clear that something was missing. All hope was lost, though, with the "special" effects. Short-bus "special".That being said, we do get chances occasionally to pop it in at gatherings, or just loan it out to the unsuspecting. It never fails to impress. It gets one star just for the novelty mileage at parties. We've been pretty famous for having discovered this train wreck. We'll be staying away from the deep-discount tables from whence this set arose.

reviews.review_title: Oh, bad. Bad bad bad. Worse than bad. Worse than worst.
reviews.content: Absolutely the most amateurish film I've ever seen - I could do better with a videocamera and no script.  Ugh.  I didn't even find it bad enough to be able to enjoy it for camp (like Ed Wood) - it's JUST BAD.  The worst film I've ever seen.

Troll 2 was one of the least forgettable experiences of my recent life. It all starts with the young Joshua Waits, who is grieving the recent loss of his grandfather, Seth. There is an overwhelming sense of sorrow felt throughout the film due to the family's loss, especially the standout among the cast, Margo Prey, who plays Joshua's mother, Diana Waits. I am shocked to have not seen her in any movies since then, as her performance was a show-stopper. It is almost next to impossible to not sympathize with the character of Diana Waits - there are moments where she comes close to bawling over the loss of her father, whom she makes clear, she is the daughter of, but, luckily, her son Joshua starts singing her favorite song to cheer her up.Let's not forget that Troll 2 is a horror movie, and will scare the most mature of adults. There are several cheap scares as is usual in any horror movie, but it is also deeply atmospheric in a way that only director Cladio Fragasso can accomplish, and it is safe to say you WILL get goosebumps. It is also very gory, but it is relevant to the story and constructive as is rare in horror movies. In one terrifying scene where the goblins are introduced, I was taken aback by how realistic the goblins were portrayed. A smart choice was the employment of Laura Gemsler, a respected actress in her own right, who designed the goblin's costumes. With what was obviously a sizable budget, these goblins all open their mouths and devour the people they victimize after they turn them into plants, in an unexpectedly frightening twist of fate.So watch Troll 2 if you dare. With it's frightening and somber atmosphere, powerful and engaging performances by the whole cast, it will surely be a movie you will never forget.

I was first introduced to Troll 2 at a sleepover. When I first saw the cover I thought "Oh great, it's a double feature so if it's no good I'll be forced to sit through two travesties.I was right in a way: Troll 2 is definitely the worst movie I have ever seen- but in the BEST and most entertaining way possible.I have been recommending this movie to friends ever since, and not of them has disagreed.Every line in this movie is hilarious enough to quote, there are so many fantastically hysterical things said in this movie. I quote it every other day, and people still laugh, and even join in.It's funny...one would think that a movie with a name like "Troll 2" would contain trolls. No trolls ever appear on the screen in this movie, there are no trolls, only hilarious goblins ruled by Creedence, an over the top female troll woman "from sacred druid origins".If you have any sense of humor whatsoever, this movie is a MUST see.

reviews.review_title: The WORST movie I've seen to date!
reviews.content: In all my years of watching movies, Troll 2 is the very *worst* movie I've ever seen! The acting is like something out of a independent film, where there is no "character", just someone acting. Although this movie had its funny parts,(few and far in between)it still the dumbest movie.This movie was so horrible, and cheap that they can't even get decent masks for the trolls. One is actually cross-eyed which I found hilarious! Other than that, I don't recommend this movie.This part might be considered a bit of a spoiler, but hey, you need to know what your getting into!The "trolls" or goblins turn humans into a green pile of goo, upon which they feast on. Go figure. Well, a boy is all alone against the goblins, which he can see as their "true" form, while the parents just see them as friendly townspeople. Well, I'm not going to reveal the rest of the movie, although its pretty much a dead giveaway.
Both of them are in a collection on blu ray. I guess when a movie is so bad but gets that much publicity it can make it to blu ray.

reviews.content: Yes, I've seen it. But for my defense, I watched it on Local TV (No cable at that time) and was in mid 90's... Wow. A friend brought this to my house and four of us watched and gawked and laughed until we cried. If you're entertained by hilariously bad movies, viewing Troll 2 is mandatory. The acting is simply amazing. There aren't actors this bad. Anywhere. I think that the cast was pulling a prank on the director during every take and then he just ran out of film before they could tell him that they were kidding. This movie is about a family that is trading houses with another family that they've never met. ***Spoilers. As if it matters...*** The town that they go to is called "Nilbog", which is "Goblin" spelled backwards. Everybody in the town is a goblin. Sheriff "Gene Freak" is the best character in the history of cinema, and when one character asks him where the girls in the town are, he laughs so hard he seems to be choking and yells "GIRLS? ahahahahaha!" as he suddenly drives away. I can't explain why it's funnier than any other thing I've ever seen on video, but it is. Watching this movie is as cathartic as stabbing cantellope with a steak knife. Go watch it now. It's available on DVD (why?) and can be found in almost any used book/cd/movie store.

reviews.review_title: One of my favourite movies of all time
reviews.content: I think like most of us here, I've discovered Troll 2 thanks to its notoriety online as one of the worst films of all time. Now, I'm not gonna go ahead and claim that this movie is well-made by any conventional standards of cinema, but I do think that Troll 2 is truly a one-of-a-kind film, and that its qualities lie in at a different level of analysis, one that doesn't really care about conventional standards of artistic quality.The premise itself is fairly simple: on a family vacation to a small village named Nilbog, our heroes are going to be ambushed by vegetarian monsters known as goblins. The movie follows Joshua, a young child, as he figures out how to fight back against them, with the help of his ghostly grandpa.This idea for the film came from the fact that, back in the late 80's, the director and his wife (who co-wrote the film together) had increasingly more friends that turned vegetarian and thus they came up with this concept for a vegetarian vampire, presumably out of spite.Now, what's very interesting with that concept is that not only is it charged politically (more on that later) but it also gave them the opportunity to draw inspiration from body horror. At several points of the film, we see characters transformed into plants in a moderately gruesome fashion only to be eaten by goblins, and that in and of itself might get a rise out of you.The movie's overall production quality is fairly low. Most of the effects, props and costumes are fairly cheap looking, which makes them stick out. For instance, several scenes of the film display a sort of green paste that's relatively gross to look at, as well as what is supposed to be green blood, I assume. I find it fairly cool that the colour of nature is portrayed in such a gross, unappealing manner throughout the film, even if that's just a result of budgetary constraints.This also reflects in the food,... which I guess is the main cultural conflict of the film. Goblins have this food that is mostly normal looking except for the fact that it systematically contains that green paste. The characters in the film don't have a problem with the way it looks (aside from Joshua), but as the audience we understand that their food is supposed to be gross and basically inedible. By the same token, the goblins look particularly cheap but they are absolute nightmare fuel in their own right.The acting is absolutely horrendous, but it's bad in a way that is fun and unique. Every single actor plays terribly in their own little style, which gives their characters unique personalities, as a result. Now, maybe if the script wasn't so weird they might have given "better" performances but honestly, I don't think so. Also worth noting: I believe the actors were instructed to not stray away from the material, even if their dialogue was clunky or nonsensical...Which brings me to the script! What's very particular about the script is that it is written by Italians, trying to emulate a language they are not very familiar with, I.E. English, but also trying to paint their own picture of the late-80's American traditional family. And why I think this is valuable is because getting a look into the way Americans are portrayed by people other than themselves, in a genuine manner, is fairly interesting, given the hegemony of their culture.What I believe the film is trying to say is that the American way of life is incompatible with vegetarianism, but not just that. The goblins in the film represent a way of life that is diametrically opposed to that of the traditional nuclear family. Goblins don't even seem to have families, or if they do they don't seem to value that unit very much. They also engage in sex outside of marriage and they presumably have different religious traditions, which puts them in a position of outsider to the hegemonic culture to begin with.On a side note: when it comes to films like these, that have acquired a reputation for being terrible/a laughing stock, we should analyse what they have to say and try to understand what their authors wanted us to take out of them. Because no art to devoid of meaning, and in fact all art carries with it a set of values for us to talk about.In conclusion, I think the reason I love this movie from the bottom of my heart is not because it's "so bad it's good", as some may say, but rather because it's a genuine piece of art, and that none other makes me feel this way. I think it has a charm that far surpasses its ineptitude, in the conventional sense of the term. The film isn't devoid of sense and its plot is no accident: our two writers experienced something in the world and wanted to talk about it in the form of a horror film. There is, I believe, genuine artistic intent in this movie, and this is what makes me come back to it every so often.I cannot look at a movie I enjoy this much and say "oh yeah this film is bad". That doesn't make sense. it's otherworldly qualities are strength rather than weaknesses, and to say this movie is "so bad it's good" undercuts the very reason why I like it so much in the first place. It's bizarre, it's fun, and it's entertaining. It is a truly joyful experience. 10/10

When I was a kid, I had nightmares about all kinds of fictional creatures; the werewolf from Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban being the most terrifying of all. However, after seeing Troll 2, I've realized that what I should have been afraid of was terrible movies made about these creatures. Troll 2 is about a family from a small town who participates in an "exchange program" – some made-up idea where two families swap houses for a period of time. The Waits family is headed for a town called Nilbogor "goblin" spelled backwards. Throughout the trip, Joshua (the youngest son) is contacted by his dead Grandpa Seth, who continually warns Joshua to have the family leave Nilbog. Meanwhile, Joshua's sister Holly is going through relationship troubles. Elliot, her boyfriend, hasgaspfriends! Before the Waits depart for Nilbog, Holly tells Elliot he must choose between her or his friends. So naturally, Elliot follows the family to Nilbog in an RVwith his friends. I would credit the actors, but that would just be embarrassing for them. Before you get your hopes up; there are no trolls in this movie. Only goblins. Terrifying goblins. Goblins that can't eat meat. Goblins that feed humans their goblin goop to turn the humans into vegetables. Apparently, turning humans into plants and then eating them is much better than just eating regular plants. Many terrible movies have at least one saving grace. Troll 2, however, is utterly and completely abysmal. The acting is horrible. The costuming is cheap and unbelievable. The writing is completely terrifying, and the plot itself is full of holes.For example, when the family arrives at the house in Nilbog they find food on the table. The food is visibly covered in green stuff (which would be a warning sign to any normal family), but the family sits down to eat anyways. Suddenly, grandpa Seth appears to Joshua and tells him that he cannot let the family eat the food. Somehow, Grandpa Seth freezes time for 30 seconds just when the rest of the family is about to put the food in their mouths. During this thirty seconds, Joshua must stop his family from eating. So what does he do? He pees on the food. I actually almost peed myself while laughing over the ridiculousness. Troll 2 was directed by Drake Floyd, a pseudonym for Claudio Fragasso. Fragasso is an Italian porn director, which does explain the terrible script and plot. However, I still think there should have been someone there to stop him from making this terrible movie. Rather than give this film zero stars, I'll give it one – because I did spend most of the movie laughing my ass off at how bad it was. In fact, Troll 2 might actually be the worst movie that was ever made. Don't believe me? Watch it for yourselfif you have the time to waste.

reviews.review_title: Why in the name of all that is at least passably decent isn't this movie no 1 worst film!?!?!?!
reviews.content: I saw this movie at least 4 times when I was sixteen years old. Every single time I watched it I found something else to despise about it. It's not that it's overly gory- I've seen much worse violence in cartoons. No, it's that the movie itself is just so horribly made, with no attempt to place any cohesive structure to the many subplots going on, not to mention the ALL TIME WORST DUBBING JOB IN HISTORY.(Was this made in Italy? For crimeny all over, Lucio Fulci was supposedly a hack of a director, but at least his dubbing sounded halfway real, and he used different colors for his gore.) Speaking of plots, the storyline is supposedly a sequel to the original "Troll" movie, (which in itself wasn't half-bad; I found that movie to have a decent story which was explained surprisingly competently and presented with decent, high quality stomach-churning effects, unlike this film which uses nothing but bright green gunk for EVERYTHING; blood, cake frosting, saliva- you name it, they've got it being used for it) but manages, whether intentionally or not, to have no plot ties to that film whatsoever. The acting is annoying, the main character is the most worthless child actor ever in existence, and the ending is just so stupid that it achieves the effect the director wanted- it sickens and horrifies you, but not because it's actually all that horrifying or sickening; it is solely because it's such a horrible waste of time. Overall, and hopefully I'm not giving anything away, the only saving grace of the movie is the popcorn feast/seduction/whatever in the motor home. That actually made me laugh for a bit, and forget for a second how terrible the rest of the film was, and would continue to be.To wrap this up, if you truly want to know what a terrible movie is, I would suggest that you first see "Glen or Glenda?" by Ed Wood, and then watch this film- trust me, "Glen or Glenda" is going to seem like "Citizen Kane" after this tripe. The only successful thing about this movie is its complete ineptitude in almost every single aspect.-1 star, since they don't have that rating on the board. Truly satanic in its awfulness.

reviews.review_title: Joshua, sing that song I like so much
reviews.content: I'm tightenin' my belt from hunger pains, hunger pains caused by NOT seeing this movie in a week! This movie is really, really great. But in a "this is really bad" type of way. "Troll 2" is by far the worst piece of cinematic tripe ever to be produced, and this is why it's so great. It's unique. I mean, it's hard not to ask yourself: "Where did they get these actors? Did they pay them to be awkward?" They could have recruited theater students, not pay them, and they would have done a hugely better job. The actors in this movie just cannot be professionals. There's just no freaking way. Anyway, this movie is a real treasure; chock full of quotable lines for years to come. The best part is the box, really. Not only is there not A SINGLE TROLL IN THE ENTIRE MOVIE, but the kid depicted on the front cover NEVER APPEARS AT ALL IN THE FILM. Rent it, if you can find it.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad or funny as people say.
reviews.content: Troll 2 is basically just like other 80s horror movies like A Nightmare On Elm Street and Poltergeist only it has a truly entertaining campiness that makes those movies pale in comparison. The campiness comes from three things, the pi ss poor acting, the unconvincing dialog and the funny premise: A family goes on vacation to a small town called Nilbog(Goblin spelled backwards), where the locals, who look like humans at first, are actually vegetarian goblins that try to coax them into eating bizarre green food to make them into plants and then eat them. Surprisingly, not everything in this movie is awful. The film's isolated rural landscape creates a sense of dread and tension. You can see that the protagonists of this movie are truly alone, beyond the comforting reaches of civilization where anything can happen. Also the masks worn by the goblin extras look genuinely scary. Some of the characters in the movie are well casted, despite their incompetent acting. This includes the father and the little boy of the family on vacation and the little boy's deceased grandfather, who warns him of what he and his family are getting into right from the start. What Troll 2 does is take the boring old horror movie formula... 1:Someone notices something weird and sinister going on and no one believes him/her. 2:He/she proves the danger is real. 3:They find some way to supposedly defeat the evil. Stupid magicy good vs evil cr ap happens. They think the evil is defeated.4:Fast forward a little and everyone thinks its happily ever after but then the evil force comes back and does something nasty. The film ends.and adds some fun to it with shoddy dialog and acting and a very silly plot and you end up with something a lot more fun than the average depressing, predictable horror film. Also it is blessed with one of the most hilariously delivered lines in the history of cinema "You can't pi ss on hospitality! I won't allow it!" Anyway, in the end, yes, Troll 2 is still bad, so much so that it's almost good but it's not as hilarious as some crazy idiots make it out to be.

If your looking for a film that is so terribly made, so god-awful when it's trying to be serious that it makes you laugh until you cry and your stomach hurts, then look no further! This film puts a new low on low budget. I really wanted to give it zero stars, but IMDb.com requires at least one and I had to give it at least one for making me laugh the hardest i've laughed in a good long while. Now to get the story; the acting and film editing flaws are so bad they stand out like "Where's Waldo" on an empty beach. The "trolls" in it are actually goblins, (and they say this in the movie). The costumes on the dwarfs/children who play the goblins are basically brown sheets and rubber masks put over them. The acting speaks for itself and is one of the main reasons why it's so terrible/hilarious. The story line drifts away like a child with a.d.d. What we have here folks is a film that tried to be scary and ended up failing so miserably that I can't even begin to describe it's epic fail. Was there even a post-production in the making of this movie?

Haha, wow.Troll 2 is one of those rare horror movies that could make you appreciate having thrush because, on the bright side, you didn't make Troll 2. This movie is what happens when the forces of screen writing and brain-damage inseminate a jackal, whose child is melted down in holy water and turned into haunted film. The super intelligent apes of the future will watch Troll 2 to make them feel less guilty about the worldwide rapey-genocide they will have committed on us humans. And it will work.Troll 2 should be rated MA15+ and never shown to your children. It will erase every lesson you have ever taught them about stranger danger. If you show this movie to your child, there is a 100% chance they will become molested or dead within the next hour. It's like saying candyman into the mirror, except the mirror is a television, you don't have to say candyman and the candyman is every rapist in your suburb. I've never seen characters act this stupid outside of a Chris Farley movie. I can only conclude that Claudio Fragasso is some kind of murdering rapist and Nilbog is his fantasy world where parental instruction is as scarce as parental supervision. Giving this movie to a kid must legally be considered 'accosting a minor for immoral purposes'. In Claudio's goblish molestopia, kids always do what you tell them to, even if you're a predator in a policeman's outfit offering them a hamburger made of green goo (Which happens. And he eats it). If a pack of murderers know you have Troll 2 in your movie collection, they won't bother to bring rope.The magic of cinema is supposed to take you to fantastic places and allow you to escape the drudgery of everyday life. The magic of Troll 2 will throw you in a van and take you its gingerbread house. So, if you love fantastically shitty movies, I highly recommend it. If you have trouble finding a copy, I'm pretty sure it comes free with every child abductor's starter kit.

I really don't know what words to use, but trust me - THIS is one the funniest movies ever made.There is no acting, the plot is thin, and several of the scenes have no relevance or credibility. Regardless, this is, to be brutally honest, one of the greatest films I have ever seen, simply because it is a complete travesty in every way. It gets a bit slow (in comedy terms!) around the middle, but the beginning and end absolutely beggar belief. As you will find as you browse these review columns, 'Troll 2' is a cult favourite, and it certainly is worth both your time and your money, since you will simply have the time of your life.There are some films that are, genuinely, so bad that they are awesomely good. This is better than any comedy I have ever seen in my life.If you have already seen this, check out S.P Somtow's 'The Laughing Dead', the only other film out there that is truly in the same league. If you haven't, and you can find a copy of this (both DVD and VHS versions exist, at reasonable prices!) take the plunge, irrespective of what films you enjoy - I guarantee you will get a kick out of it.Simply put, you must see this film.*SPOILERS*If not for the distinct lack of Trolls in a film called 'Troll 2', then for the poor Goblin masks.If not for the completely unerotic and unrelated corn on the cob seduction scene, then for the mad woman singing 'Row, row row your boat' completely out of tune.If not for the lesson that a bologne sandwich can ultimately save the day in any situation, then for the cheesy 80s music.If not for the woman that has Stonehenge in her house, then for the alternate moral, which is that urinating all over your family's food is the answer to all of your problems.If not for the man who shouts the most unconvincing 'Oh... my ... GOD!' in existence, then for the most unconvincing chainsaw scene in existence.If not for the father's tendency to drift off whilst forgetting his lines, then for the bizarre straight/bisexual confused antics of the supporting cast.If not for the moment when SOMEONE FINALLY REALISES that Nilbog is goblin spelt backwards, then for the mysterious repeated resurrection of the grandfather character FOR NO REASON.And remember, son, "I'm gonna tighten one notch in my belt..."

Those who yearned for a sequel to the Sonny Bono/Julia Louis-Dreyfus film "Troll," needn't yearn any longer.  It's hard to believe, but this movie makes "Troll" look like "Schindler's List."  This trying experience includes watching people turn into plants, watching a young boy pee on his family's dinner table under direct orders from his dead grandfather, and wanting to smack the main character for taking the entire length of the movie to figure out that "Nilbog" is "Goblin" backwards.  It is an extraordinarily badly acted movie with excruciatingly terrible special effects and a plot that would make Ed Wood cringe.  I'm perplexed by the fact that this movie was never used on "Mystery Science Theater 3000."  The one good thing about this movie is that it is so terrible that it's hilarious.  Too bad it's not supposed to be a comedy.

reviews.review_title: Quite an enjoyable and unique experience...
reviews.content: I cannot put my finger on what makes this movie so much fun for me to watch over, and over, and over again! I remember my mom renting a VHS copy of this for me when I was 11 or 12 and I remember watching it at least 3 times before the one-week rental period was over. Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't the goblin witch (Creedence) absolutely gorgeous in the few short minutes we see of her with her "old power" and lack of witch make-up? I think so. The overall pace of this movie is pretty quick and I can honestly say I was not bored at any time while watching Troll 2. I don't think I've ever laughed at anything so hard in my life. I can even remember my mom yelling down the stairs at me asking if I was okay because I was laughing so hard. This will always be one of my favourite movies of all time because of its unique entertainment value. This movie is something very special in its own way, in my mind at least, and now that I have the Troll/Troll 2 DVD I'm very happy. This should not be missed if you even remotely enjoy the movies of the so-bad-they're-good variety.

But, this kid looked like a natural, like a kid that would be scared of a leaf falling on his head. Another part that really struck a cord is when i saw that the zombies did not like meat. I DID NOT EAT MEAT UNTIL I WAS LIKE 3 WEEKS OLD!! The similarities of a normal persons life and this movie are endless. I can remember back when I must have been eight or nine years old, and my young eyes set on the television screen and remained there for an hour and a half, and being so young I never realized I would be gazing upon what would later be considered BEST WORST MOVIE. The acting is below par, the film work looks like amateur work and it is honestly one of the most entertaining movies I've ever watched. It lays claim strongly on that late eighties/early nineties style, both in film-style and clothing. Also serving the viewer with the classic lines, such as "Oh My God!!" being dramatically dragged about in such annoying audio recall. I still eat on occasion a double-decker Bologna sandwich. I remembered years ago when I watched this as child, I felt very sad for Joshua at the end. Go through all of that hoopla, to only see your mother being devoured by trolls....excuse me...goblins. Years later, I was browsing a certain site and a small section of my memory replayed in my mind and I recalled Troll 2. So I found a copy and re-watched it all and read about the hype that it now currently is and I must say, this movie comes in close with a tie to Manos:The Hands of Fate.
It is simply a masterpiece. If you have any humor in your soul there's no way you should not think this movie is the best thing to ever happen to film.

Rarely am I. Either the most brilliant intentional work of a genius, or the absolute worst piece of film ever conceived. I'm a big fan of camp and deliberate themes, but I simply cannot decipher if the cast is trying to make us laugh, pull one over our eyes, or torture us with their skills. I deserve a SAG (R) card if anyone who uttered a line in this film received theirs. It may very well become a bigger cult hit than Showgirls. Forget the poor special effects, choppy editing and cinematography, a Casio soundtrack, extras pulled from a local swap-o-rama, and make-up not suitable for a kindergarten class production of Snow White, it is the true jaw-dropping dialogue and the actors' delivery of such that is the diamond or dung of this picture. You have to see it to believe it. BYOB required.

reviews.review_title: The greatest movie I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing
reviews.content: I would like to say, first and foremost, that this movie changed my life in ways I never thought possible. Not only was it the most blissful 95 minutes of my life, this film allowed me to find true happiness while also repairing my relationship with my estranged father. Anyways, this film combines the riveting plot lines of lesser films like the Godfather and Schindler's List with the acting excellence of Robert Downy Jr.'s performance in Tropic Thunder, but like with all the actors. The decision to title the movie "Troll 2" and proceed to not include a single troll in the entire film can be described as nothing short of pure genius. Also, the plot twist where all the townspeople turn out to be goblins was so unexpected that I was forced to question my own existence. The moral to the story, that "only meat or the power of goodness can vanquish these monsters," has only become more relevant in the 27 years since this movie's release. Finally, the closing scene, where the goblins inexplicably return from their defeat and brutally devour the mother while she is in the shower, is one of the most hauntingly beautiful cinematic sequences I have ever encountered. The obvious allegory to the challenges faced by oppressed minorities in modern Los Angeles is icing on the cake in my opinion. The fact this movie did not win every Oscar possible the year of its release is a travesty, and serves more as a statement on the current Hollywood establishment than anything.
